analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: dpal ldan byang chub shin tu rnam dag pa //
analyzed: dpal ldan byang chub shin tu rnam dag pa //
translated: The glorious one, perfectly pure enlightenment,

original: mi pham la btud des mdzad tshig le'ur byas //
analyzed: mi pham la btud des mdzad tshig le'ur byas //
translated: I bow to Ajita, and his verses composed

original: seng ge bzang po'i dpal gyi zhal snga'i 'grel //
analyzed: seng ge bzang po'i dpal gyi zhal snga'i 'grel //
translated: The commentary by Haribhadra's mouth,

original: tshig don rtogs dka'i tshogs ni bshad par bya //
analyzed: tshig don rtogs dka'i tshogs ni bshad par bya //
translated: The collection of difficult to understand words and meanings, I will explain.

original: gang phyir rgyal bas mi khom thams cad ni //
analyzed: gang phyir rgyal bas mi khom thams cad ni //
translated: Because all the unfavorable conditions for the Victorious One,

original: dad pas spong bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pas na //🔽de phyir 'di ni yang dag rtsom pa la //
analyzed: dad pas spong bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pas na // de phyir 'di ni yang dag rtsom pa la //
translated: Faith is the relinquishing.🔽Therefore, those who are holy

original: skye bo dam pa rnams kyis bzod par mdzod //
analyzed: skye bo dam pa rnams kyis bzod par mdzod //
translated: should bear with this composition.

original: gzhung rtsom pa thams cad la rtog pa dang ldan pa phal cher de mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir dang // thos pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa rnams gegs med par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhung rtsom pa thams cad la rtog pa dang ldan pa phal cher de mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir dang // thos pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa rnams gegs med par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In all compositions, the intelligent, for the most part, complete them in order to bring them to an end, and those who are engaged in learning, etc. do so in order to be free from obstacles.

original: rang gi dad pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal ba yin pas /
analyzed: rang gi dad pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal ba yin pas /
translated: Therefore, the homage to one's own deity is

original: thog mar rgyal ba'i lha la phyag 'tshal ba ni /
analyzed: thog mar rgyal ba'i lha la phyag 'tshal ba ni /
translated: the homage to the Victor's deity at the beginning.🔽It is stated with

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa la //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: To the perfection of wisdom...

original: shes rab ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the knowledge which has hearing, etc. as its nature.

original: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni rab kyi mthar son pa ste /
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni rab kyi mthar son pa ste /
translated: The perfection of that is the attainment of the highest degree.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang / de'i don gyi lam dang gzhung dag ni dngos dang btags pa'i dbye bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang / de'i don gyi lam dang gzhung dag ni dngos dang btags pa'i dbye bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: The nondual intuition and the path and scripture of that intuition are the perfection of wisdom in three aspects, according to the distinction between the actual and the nominal.

original: de la phyag 'tshal ba ni lus la sogs pa gus pas rab tu 'dud pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal ba ni lus la sogs pa gus pas rab tu 'dud pa'o //
translated: Saluting it means revering it with body, speech, and mind.

original: ci zhig gi don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig gi don du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: de rgyan te mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa brgyad ni yul de'i rgyan yin no //
analyzed: de rgyan te mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa brgyad ni yul de'i rgyan yin no //
translated: The eight realizations are its ornament, because they are the cause of its high status and definite goodness.

original: de'i tshig le 'ur byas pa dag ni de'i ngo bo'i don rtogs pa rdzogs par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i sdeb sbyor du byas pa yum stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i rgya cher bshad pa rnam par dbye ba ste /🔽char @141a * //
analyzed: de'i tshig le 'ur byas pa dag ni de'i ngo bo'i don rtogs pa rdzogs par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i sdeb sbyor du byas pa yum stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i rgya cher bshad pa rnam par dbye ba ste / char @141a * //
translated: The verses are its words, because they complete the realization of the meaning of its nature, and they are composed in metrical feet. The commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, etc., is its analysis.

original: phye bas nye bar bstan pa'o //🔽ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: phye bas nye bar bstan pa'o //🔽ji ltar zhe na /
translated: The commentary is its explanation, because it elucidates the meaning of the verses.🔽The summary is its condensation, because it condenses the meaning of the commentary.🔽The instruction is its elucidation, because it elucidates the meaning of the summary.

original: stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i don bshad pa brgyan pa'i phyir mngon pa'i sde snod la sogs pa kun gyi rgyan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i don bshad pa brgyan pa'i phyir mngon pa'i sde snod la sogs pa kun gyi rgyan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In order to ornament the Abhidharma Basket and so forth, which explain the meaning of the Hundred Thousand and so forth, it becomes an ornament of all.

original: der 'gyur ba ni bsam pa ste /
analyzed: der 'gyur ba ni bsam pa ste /
translated: The there is the intention,

original: des de bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught by that.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni de ltar bdag gis 'phags pa byams pa'i dgongs pa shes par gyur bas so //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni de ltar bdag gis 'phags pa byams pa'i dgongs pa shes par gyur bas so //
translated: The thus is that I have understood the intention of the noble Maitreya.

original: ci rab tu byed pa'i rnam par bshad pa gzhan dag kyang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rab tu byed pa'i rnam par bshad pa gzhan dag kyang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are there other explanations of the chapters?

original: yod pa'i phyir 'gro la chags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir 'gro la chags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: In order to show that there are, it says attachment to going and so forth.

original: 'phags pa ste nyon mongs pa dang bral ba lta bur chags pa med par sems can gyi don la kun tu chags par mdzad pa gang yin pa des kun tu chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ste nyon mongs pa dang bral ba lta bur chags pa med par sems can gyi don la kun tu chags par mdzad pa gang yin pa des kun tu chags pa'o //
translated: It is attachment because it is attachment to the benefit of sentient beings without attachment, as if noble and free from afflictions.

original: don 'di nyid ni /🔽'gro la chags pa kun chags mdzad //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni / 'gro la chags pa kun chags mdzad //
translated: This very meaning is stated in attachment to going is attachment.

original: ces smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ces smos pa yin te /
translated: It is stated as attachment to going is attachment.

original: 'gro ba la chags pa gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba la chags pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba la chags pa gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba la chags pa ste /
translated: That attachment to going is the attachment to going.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The bodhisattvas are those who have it.

original: de rnams dang 'dra bar kun tu chags par mdzad pa gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: de rnams dang 'dra bar kun tu chags par mdzad pa gang yin pa des so //
translated: By that attachment, he is the one who is attached.

original: de nyid kyis na skyob pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na skyob pa ste /
translated: He is the protector by that very fact,

original: rang gis gzigs pa'i lam ston pas sems can rjes su skyong bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis gzigs pa'i lam ston pas sems can rjes su skyong bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he cares for sentient beings by teaching the path that he himself has seen.

original: rnam bshad ni khyad par can gyi don ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam bshad ni khyad par can gyi don ston pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the teaching of the special meaning.

original: mdzad pa ni rnam par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa ni rnam par sbyar ba'o //
translated: The performance is the application.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: bstan bcos chen pos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos chen pos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: By the great treatise.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'i don ma lus pa sdud par byed pas bstan bcos chen po ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'i don ma lus pa sdud par byed pas bstan bcos chen po ste /
translated: The great treatise is the Ornament for Clear Realization, which collects the entire meaning of the Perfection of Wisdom Sutras.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan zhes bya'o //
translated: What is the Ornament for Clear Realization?

original: ci dpyad pas sam thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas mdzad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci dpyad pas sam thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas mdzad dam zhe na /
translated: Is it composed by analysis or by the transmission of hearing?🔽No, it is not.

original: ma yin de nyid kyis /
analyzed: ma yin de nyid kyis /
translated: He says,

original: mi pham mgon las gsan nas ni //🔽zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: mi pham mgon las gsan nas ni //🔽zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: I heard it from Ajita, the Protector.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi dam par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis na dbang phyug chen po la sogs pas mi thub pa'i phyir mi pham mo zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis gsan nas legs par bsams shing bsgoms pas bstan par byas nas zhes bya bar don gyis shes so //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi dam par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis na dbang phyug chen po la sogs pas mi thub pa'i phyir mi pham mo zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis gsan nas legs par bsams shing bsgoms pas bstan par byas nas zhes bya bar don gyis shes so //
translated: Because he is the best of gods and humans, and because he is the foremost in the world, he is unconquerable by Maheśvara and so forth, so he is called “unconquerable.” This is understood implicitly by the phrase “having taught through hearing, contemplating, and meditating on it himself.”

original: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin brnyes pa nyid yin na yang ji ltar lhag par mos pas tshig le'ur byas pas mdzad @141b pa po las mngon sum du gsan pa nyid yin pas sdud pa po dang 'dra bar 'dir tshad ma'i skyes bur gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin brnyes pa nyid yin na yang ji ltar lhag par mos pas tshig le'ur byas pas mdzad @141b pa po las mngon sum du gsan pa nyid yin pas sdud pa po dang 'dra bar 'dir tshad ma'i skyes bur gyur pa yin la /
translated: Even though he has attained meditative concentration, he is like an actual compiler here, because he heard it directly from the author of the verses through his superior aspiration.

original: 'dir gzhan dag thos pa mang ba yang yin zhing dran pa yang shes pa bzhin bsdus pa byas pa nyid ni 'dir ci zhig ltar 'grel pa byed pa la dbang ba yin na ;
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag thos pa mang ba yang yin zhing dran pa yang shes pa bzhin bsdus pa byas pa nyid ni 'dir ci zhig ltar 'grel pa byed pa la dbang ba yin na ;
translated: Here, others are also very learned and have collected it with a retentive memory, so how could he be the one who is authorized to compose a commentary?

original: mkhas par rlom pa gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mkhas par rlom pa gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: What need is there to mention other so-called scholars?

original: phyi rol gyi shes bya med pa /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi shes bya med pa /
translated: The nonexistence of external objects🔽is based on the existence of internal objects.🔽The author of the treatise is called “the kinsman of the sun” because he is the kinsman of the sun-like Buddha.🔽He is also called “the kinsman of the world” because he is the kinsman of the world, teaching the path to the highest good, which is free of sin and is desired by the world.🔽This is the meaning of the word “world” in the phrase “the kinsman of the world.”

original: nang gi shes bya la brten cing sems tsam pa'i gzhung la gnas pa nyid yin pa de ni 'gro don rtsa lag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: nang gi shes bya la brten cing sems tsam pa'i gzhung la gnas pa nyid yin pa de ni 'gro don rtsa lag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: He is the one who accomplishes the desired aim.🔽Who is he? He is Vasubandhu.🔽He is called “the kinsman of the world” because he is the kinsman of the world, teaching the path to the highest good, which is free of sin and is desired by the world.🔽This is the meaning of the word “world” in the phrase “the kinsman of the world.”

original: 'gro ba la mngon par 'dod pa nges par legs pa'i rgyu kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lam yang dag par ston par mdzad pas na rtsa lag go //
analyzed: 'gro ba la mngon par 'dod pa nges par legs pa'i rgyu kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lam yang dag par ston par mdzad pas na rtsa lag go //
translated: He is the one who accomplishes the desired aim.🔽Who is he? He is Vasubandhu.🔽He is called “the kinsman of the world” because he is the kinsman of the world, teaching the path to the highest good, which is free of sin and is desired by the world.

original: don 'di nyid ni 'gro don zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni 'gro don zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the word “world” in the phrase “the kinsman of the world.”

original: 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the one who accomplishes the desired aim.🔽Who is he? He is Vasubandhu.

original: su zhig ce na dbyig gnyen zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: su zhig ce na dbyig gnyen zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is called “the kinsman of the world” because he is the kinsman of the world, teaching the path to the highest good, which is free of sin and is desired by the world.🔽This is the meaning of the word “world” in the phrase “the kinsman of the world.”

original: rang gi mos pa gtsor byed pas //🔽zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs la mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: rang gi mos pa gtsor byed pas // zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs la mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: He is the one who accomplishes the desired aim.🔽Who is he? He is Vasubandhu.🔽He is called “the kinsman of the world” because he is the kinsman of the world, teaching the path to the highest good, which is free of sin and is desired by the world.🔽This is the meaning of the word “world” in the phrase “the kinsman of the world.”

original: rnam par bkrol zhes bya ba ni bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par bkrol zhes bya ba ni bshad pa ste /
translated: He is the one who accomplishes the desired aim.🔽Who is

original: bstan bcos chen po zhes bya bar rjes su snyegs so //
analyzed: bstan bcos chen po zhes bya bar rjes su snyegs so //
translated: The great treatise is the Madhyamakaśāstra.

original: 'phags pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yi //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yi //
translated: Because he is included among the āryas

original: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he has attained the samādhi called Āryasaṃgraha.

original: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi bdag med pa la lhag par mos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi bdag med pa la lhag par mos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Liberated means that he has attained the special faith in selflessness.

original: dbu mar gnas pa'i blos zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' spangs pa'i dbu ma'i shes pas bstan bcos chen po rnam par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: dbu mar gnas pa'i blos zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' spangs pa'i dbu ma'i shes pas bstan bcos chen po rnam par phye ba yin no //
translated: With the mind abiding in the middle means that he has composed the great treatise with the knowledge of the middle that abandons the extremes of existence, nonexistence, and so on.

original: sngon chad rnam par phye zin pas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sngon chad rnam par phye zin pas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But hasn't this already been explained? So isn't this reasoning incorrect?

original: des byas byas pa min mthong nas //
analyzed: des byas byas pa min mthong nas //
translated: Having seen that it is not made by him

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is stated.

original: sngar bshad pa'i slob dpon dag gis byas pa'i 'grel pa rnam par shes pa tsam gyi gzhung rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ji lta ba nyid ma yin no zhes shes na de'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i sdes bdag med pa la lhag par🔽mos pa'i stobs kyis mu stegs pa ma lus pa'i gzhung mtha' dag bcom nas rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i bla ma'i tshig gi bdag @142a * //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i slob dpon dag gis byas pa'i 'grel pa rnam par shes pa tsam gyi gzhung rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ji lta ba nyid ma yin no zhes shes na de'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i sdes bdag med pa la lhag par mos pa'i stobs kyis mu stegs pa ma lus pa'i gzhung mtha' dag bcom nas rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i bla ma'i tshig gi bdag @142a * //
translated: The commentary composed by the masters previously explained is not reality itself, because it is an engagement with the texts of consciousness only that have a nature.

original: nyid kyi shes pa gsal bar byas pa'i dbang gis bstan bcos chen po rnam par bshad do zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyid kyi shes pa gsal bar byas pa'i dbang gis bstan bcos chen po rnam par bshad do zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, Vimuktasena, through the power of his superior interest in selflessness, having defeated all the texts of all the tīrthikas, illuminated his own consciousness, which has the nature of the words of his guru, through the power of his own understanding, and thus he explained the great treatise.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: One might think as follows:

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das yum gyi ye shes yod pa'i ngo bo yin na ni yod par 'dzin pas yang dag par grol bar mi 'gyur zhing gzhung yang drang ba'i don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das yum gyi ye shes yod pa'i ngo bo yin na ni yod par 'dzin pas yang dag par grol bar mi 'gyur zhing gzhung yang drang ba'i don du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mother of the Bhagavān is the nature of existent wisdom, then because of the apprehension of existence, one would not be completely liberated, and the text would be provisional meaning.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi ni sgra ji bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bshad pa rtogs sla ba dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir yang dag par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi ni sgra ji bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bshad pa rtogs sla ba dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir yang dag par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the meaning of the words is the very essence of the illusion-like nondual wisdom, the explanation is easy to understand, and one will be perfectly liberated because one will not be attached to the extremes of existence, nonexistence, and so on.

original: de yang dbu ma la 'jug pa las /
analyzed: de yang dbu ma la 'jug pa las /
translated: This is also explained in the Supplement to the Middle Way:

original: slob dpon klu sgrub zhal snga'i lam nas ni //
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub zhal snga'i lam nas ni //
translated: The path of the master Nāgārjuna

original: phyi rol gyur pa'i zhi ba'i thabs ma yin //
analyzed: phyi rol gyur pa'i zhi ba'i thabs ma yin //
translated: is not a method for peace for those outside.

original: de ni kun rdzob yang dag bden las nyams //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob yang dag bden las nyams //
translated: They fall from the correct conventional truth

original: de las nyams pas thar pa grub yod min //
analyzed: de las nyams pas thar pa grub yod min //
translated: and, falling from that, liberation is not accomplished.

original: zhes bshad pa dang / dbu ma'i de kho na nyid ni de'i rigs kho na la rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa dang / dbu ma'i de kho na nyid ni de'i rigs kho na la rigs pa yin te /
translated: And the reality of the middle way is reasonable only for those of that type.

original: 'di nyid las /
analyzed: 'di nyid las /
translated: This is because it says in that same text:

original: so so'i skye bo nyid na 'ang stong nyid thos //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid na 'ang stong nyid thos //
translated: Even as an ordinary being, one hears about emptiness

original: nang gi dga' ba yang dang yang du thob //
analyzed: nang gi dga' ba yang dang yang du thob //
translated: and again and again attains inner joy.

original: dga' ba las byung mig ni mchi mas brlan //
analyzed: dga' ba las byung mig ni mchi mas brlan //
translated: From that joy, tears arise from one’s eyes.

original: lus kyi spu ldang ba yang skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lus kyi spu ldang ba yang skye bar 'gyur //
translated: and the hairs of his body stand on end.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.🔽The noble Asanga and the noble Maitreya, like a perfect Buddha, have the realization for the sake of sentient beings by the power of their own intention.

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal snga nas kyi dang / 'phags pa byams pa las yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar rang gi bsam pa'i dbang gis sems can gyi don du rtogs pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyi zhal snga nas kyi dang / 'phags pa byams pa las yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar rang gi bsam pa'i dbang gis sems can gyi don du rtogs pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault.

original: yang rang dang rjes mthun tsam du zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni de'i 'og tu rnam grol sde zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: yang rang dang rjes mthun tsam du zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni de'i 'og tu rnam grol sde zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of “just in accordance with oneself” is stated in the following verse:

original: dad pa nyid rten du gyur pas sa yin te /
analyzed: dad pa nyid rten du gyur pas sa yin te /
translated: Faith is the ground because it is the basis.

original: de la gnas pa yis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas pa yis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is said, “by abiding in that.”

original: dad pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: One who has faith

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dad pas mi khom spang bar 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dad pas mi khom spang bar 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is one who has abandoned the unfavorable conditions through faith, as stated by the Bhagavān.

original: bstan bcos mtha' dag ma rnyed par //
analyzed: bstan bcos mtha' dag ma rnyed par //
translated: Without obtaining the entire treatise,

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar smos pa'i bshad pa'i bstan bcos ma lus pa de mdzad pa po las mngon sum du ma thos pa'am ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar smos pa'i bshad pa'i bstan bcos ma lus pa de mdzad pa po las mngon sum du ma thos pa'am ma mthong ba'o //
translated: This is because he did not hear or see the entire treatise of explanation mentioned above directly from the author.

original: yang chos mngon pa'i sde snod la sogs par bshad pa'i bstan bcos ma rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: yang chos mngon pa'i sde snod la sogs par bshad pa'i bstan bcos ma rnyed pa'o //
translated: Or, he did not find the treatise of explanation in the Abhidharma Piṭaka, etc.

original: @142b da ni sngar smos pa'i bshad pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @142b da ni sngar smos pa'i bshad pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that he is in agreement with the explanations mentioned above, he says:

original: rang blo'i che ba'i bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: rang blo'i che ba'i bdag nyid ni //
translated: The greatness of my own mind

original: de ltar mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the wise one, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tshul de ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tshul de ltar ro //
translated: Thus means in that way.

original: mkhas pas snang byas shing zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa thogs med la sogs pas rnam par sbyar ba'i ye shes kyi sgron mas so //
analyzed: mkhas pas snang byas shing zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa thogs med la sogs pas rnam par sbyar ba'i ye shes kyi sgron mas so //
translated: The wise one, having illuminated means that he has illuminated with the lamp of wisdom that was applied by Ārya Asaṅga, etc.

original: kha cig gis ni zhes bya ba ni bdag las gzhan pa'i mkhas pa mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni zhes bya ba ni bdag las gzhan pa'i mkhas pa mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Some means the wise ones other than myself, the meditators.

original: bstan bcos kun zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed par grags pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos kun zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed par grags pa'o //
translated: All treatises means those renowned as chapters.

original: ma rnyed pa ni ma mthong ba'am ma thos pa'o //
analyzed: ma rnyed pa ni ma mthong ba'am ma thos pa'o //
translated: Not finding is not seeing or not hearing.

original: 'di rnyed pa ni bstan bcos gsal bar byas pa rnyed cing nye bar dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di rnyed pa ni bstan bcos gsal bar byas pa rnyed cing nye bar dmigs pa ste /
translated: Finding this is finding and apprehending the elucidation of the treatise.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The nature of right knowledge is the remainder.

original: ma yin na yang bdag nyid kyis bstan bcos sna tshogs bltas pas blo'i kha shin tu phye bar gyur bas snying po mdor bsdus pa'i rab tu byed pa'i don sna tshogs mthong ba'i nus pa yod pa ni ngo mtshar ba yin no //
analyzed: ma yin na yang bdag nyid kyis bstan bcos sna tshogs bltas pas blo'i kha shin tu phye bar gyur bas snying po mdor bsdus pa'i rab tu byed pa'i don sna tshogs mthong ba'i nus pa yod pa ni ngo mtshar ba yin no //
translated: Even if it is not so, the mind is opened wide by oneself through studying various treatises, and there is the ability to see the various meanings of the chapters that summarize the essence. That is amazing.

original: gal te de ltar yin na gzhan rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba don dang bcas pa'i skabs med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na gzhan rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba don dang bcas pa'i skabs med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, there is no point in analyzing the other chapters.

original: ma yin te /🔽de ltas shin tu rnyed dka' ba //
analyzed: ma yin te / de ltas shin tu rnyed dka' ba //
translated: No, it is not so.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is very difficult to find, etc.

original: shin tu rnyed dka' ba zhes bya ba ni bsod nams bsags pa nyid kyis rnyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnyed dka' ba zhes bya ba ni bsod nams bsags pa nyid kyis rnyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Very difficult to find means that it is found only through the accumulation of merit.

original: zab mo'i lam can zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad ji ltar byams pas thugs su chud pa'i bdag med pas zin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rigs pa dang mi ldan pa dag gis nges par bzung bar mi nus pa yin pa las ci zhig ltar
analyzed: zab mo'i lam can zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad ji ltar byams pas thugs su chud pa'i bdag med pas zin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rigs pa dang mi ldan pa dag gis nges par bzung bar mi nus pa yin pa las ci zhig ltar
translated: Those who possess the profound path are those who have realized the eight realizations of the āryas, and because they are embraced by the selflessness realized by Maitreya, they cannot be ascertained by those who are not rational.

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis bltas te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis bltas te /
translated: What is the point of looking at it from some other perspective?

original: sangs rgyas kyi dbang gis rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dbang gis rnyed pa ste /
translated: It is attained by the power of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis thob pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyis dbye ba'i rigs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis thob pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyis dbye ba'i rigs //
translated: It is obtained by the blessing of the Buddha. This is something that the wise should analyze.

original: bdag kyang 'gro ba'i don 'gro bar dam bcas pa yod pas bdag gi rnam par phye ba dang de rnams kyi rnam par phye ba la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: bdag kyang 'gro ba'i don 'gro bar dam bcas pa yod pas bdag gi rnam par phye ba dang de rnams kyi rnam par phye ba la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: Since I have also made the commitment to go for the sake of migrating beings, what is the contradiction in my analysis and their analysis?

original: sngon sangs rgyas pa yod do zhes te /
analyzed: sngon sangs rgyas pa yod do zhes te /
translated: It is not the case that there is no Buddhahood in the past.

original: de ltar mi bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar mi bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not the case that it should not be done in that way.

original: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / ces sems can thams cad la @143a * //
analyzed: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / ces sems can thams cad la @143a * //
translated: May I attain Buddhahood for the benefit of migrating beings.

original: rgyal ba ma lus pa'i bstan pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal ba ma lus pa'i bstan pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that the teachings of all the Victorious Ones would be meaningless.

original: la lar bshad pa kha cig gis mi 'dul ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: la lar bshad pa kha cig gis mi 'dul ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that some are not disciplined by the explanations in some.

original: sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar de rnams kyi yang dam bcas pa mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar de rnams kyi yang dam bcas pa mnyam pa yin no //
translated: Like the Buddha, their commitments are the same.

original: la lar rnam par dbye ba yongs su rdzogs pa med pa na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo las tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi don thos pa la sogs pas 'tshang rgya ba nyid du bsngags pa yin no zhes bya bar
analyzed: la lar rnam par dbye ba yongs su rdzogs pa med pa na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo las tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi don thos pa la sogs pas 'tshang rgya ba nyid du bsngags pa yin no zhes bya bar
translated: Even when the divisions are not complete in some, the meaning of a single verse in the perfection of wisdom sutras and so forth is praised as being sufficient for attaining buddhahood through hearing and so forth.🔽This is the intention.

original: dgongs so // de ltar phul du byung ba mkhas par gyur pa dang bcas pa yin pa dang / bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag pa'i blo nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba'i go skabs yod pa nyid yin na yang bdag nyid khengs pa med pa nyid ni rnam pa kun tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dgongs so // de ltar phul du byung ba mkhas par gyur pa dang bcas pa yin pa dang / bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag pa'i blo nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba'i go skabs yod pa nyid yin na yang bdag nyid khengs pa med pa nyid ni rnam pa kun tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, even when there is excellence and expertise, and even when there is the possibility of division through the mind being in meditative equipoise, the absence of self-inflation is stated in all aspects with the phrase at all times and so forth.

original: rgyal ba'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir rnam pa kun tu thos pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas kyang bdag gi spyod yul ma yin na gang gi phyir de lta yin na yang /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir rnam pa kun tu thos pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas kyang bdag gi spyod yul ma yin na gang gi phyir de lta yin na yang /
translated: But even though this is so,🔽with the desire to benefit myself and others,🔽I will generate the mind of enlightenment,🔽which grants the highest excellence to myself and all sentient beings,🔽and I will take it up.

original: rang dang gzhan la phan gdags 'dod nas zhes bya ba bdag dang sems can rnams kyi mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa ma lus pa ster ba /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la phan gdags 'dod nas zhes bya ba bdag dang sems can rnams kyi mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa ma lus pa ster ba /
translated: In order to accomplish merit,

original: bdag gir byed par 'dod pas /
analyzed: bdag gir byed par 'dod pas /
translated: I will generate the mind of enlightenment,🔽which is the cause of the highest excellence🔽for myself and all sentient beings.

original: bsod nams dag sgrub dang mthun phyir //
analyzed: bsod nams dag sgrub dang mthun phyir //
translated: In order to accomplish merit,🔽I will generate the mind of enlightenment,

original: zhes bya bar rab tu byed pa rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: zhes bya bar rab tu byed pa rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: which is the cause of the highest excellence🔽for myself and all sentient beings.🔽In order to accomplish merit,🔽I will generate the mind of enlightenment,

original: bsod nams skyed pa la gus pa'i sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams skyed pa la gus pa'i sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: which is the cause of the highest excellence🔽for myself and all sentient beings.🔽In order to accomplish merit,

original: yang dag par spro ba la bdag 'jug pa yin pa ste /🔽rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spro ba la bdag 'jug pa yin pa ste /🔽rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: I will generate the mind of enlightenment,🔽which is the cause of the highest excellence🔽for myself and all sentient beings.🔽In order to accomplish merit,🔽I will generate the mind of enlightenment,🔽which is the cause of the highest excellence🔽for myself and all sentient beings.🔽In order to accomplish merit,🔽I will generate the mind of enlightenment,🔽which is the cause of the highest excellence🔽for myself and all sentient beings.

original: da ni rang gi gzhung lugs 'chad par mdzad pas bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i dbye ba'i mchod pa rnam pa gnyis 'chad pa'i rab tu byed pa'i don ci nas gsal bar 'gyur zhes 'jug pa ni 'phags pa byams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa
analyzed: da ni rang gi gzhung lugs 'chad par mdzad pas bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i dbye ba'i mchod pa rnam pa gnyis 'chad pa'i rab tu byed pa'i don ci nas gsal bar 'gyur zhes 'jug pa ni 'phags pa byams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa
translated: Now, he is about to explain his own system, so he asks, What is the meaning of the chapter on the two kinds of worship, praise and prostration, in order to clarify it? The introduction is stated with the noble Maitreya... and so on.

original: yin te / 'phags pa byams pa ni sdig pa mi mnga' ba nyid kyis sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa dang 'dra bar byams pas phan 'dogs par mdzad pa'i tshul can no //
analyzed: yin te / 'phags pa byams pa ni sdig pa mi mnga' ba nyid kyis sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa dang 'dra bar byams pas phan 'dogs par mdzad pa'i tshul can no //
translated: The noble Maitreya, being free from evil, has a way of benefiting all sentient beings with love, as if they were his only child.

original: re zhig thog mar rgyal ba'i yum gyi mngon par rtogs pa'i don bshad par rtsom pa nyid yin na yang dang por de'i yon tan ji lta bar ston pa sngon du 'gro @143b bas thog mar yang dag pa'i yon tan brjod de /
analyzed: re zhig thog mar rgyal ba'i yum gyi mngon par rtogs pa'i don bshad par rtsom pa nyid yin na yang dang por de'i yon tan ji lta bar ston pa sngon du 'gro @143b bas thog mar yang dag pa'i yon tan brjod de /
translated: Even though he is about to begin explaining the meaning of the realization of the Mother of the Victorious Ones, he first expresses the true qualities, as if showing their qualities as they are.

original: phyag 'tshal zhing lus la sogs pas gus pas rab tu 'dud pa ni 'phags pa byams pa bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /🔽bdag nyid yum gyi dbang gis bya ba byas pa rnyed pa nyid yin zhing gdul bya gzhan dag bcom ldan 'das ma yon tan rin po che phul du byung ba'i 'byung gnas la zhes bya ba dbang phyug dang gzugs bzang po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal zhing lus la sogs pas gus pas rab tu 'dud pa ni 'phags pa byams pa bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te / bdag nyid yum gyi dbang gis bya ba byas pa rnyed pa nyid yin zhing gdul bya gzhan dag bcom ldan 'das ma yon tan rin po che phul du byung ba'i 'byung gnas la zhes bya ba dbang phyug dang gzugs bzang po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'am /
translated: One should pay homage and bow down with respect, body and so forth, as stated in the noble Maitreya himself.🔽 One should see the Bhagavatī as the source of the jewel of excellent qualities, and engage her by the power of the meaning of ultimate goodness, as stated in the source of the jewel of excellent qualities.

original: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas par bcom pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rgya mtsho thams cad las mchog tu gyur pa'i 'byung gnas la don gyis zhes bya bar mthong ba dang / nges par legs pa'i don gyi dbang gis 'jug par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas par bcom pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rgya mtsho thams cad las mchog tu gyur pa'i 'byung gnas la don gyis zhes bya bar mthong ba dang / nges par legs pa'i don gyi dbang gis 'jug par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: One should see the Bhagavatī as the source of the ocean of all excellent qualities such as the ten powers, the perfection of wisdom that has conquered the afflictions along with their traces, and as the source of the excellent qualities that are supreme, as stated in the source of the jewel of excellent qualities.

original: dad pa dang shes rab dag las skyabs gzhan med pa'i bsam pas bsgom pa la sogs pa la 'jug par bya pa'i don du rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i ched ni yid bde ba yang dag par bskyed pa'i don du'o //🔽ci 'dir nye bar brtags pas sbyar ba yin nam /
analyzed: dad pa dang shes rab dag las skyabs gzhan med pa'i bsam pas bsgom pa la sogs pa la 'jug par bya pa'i don du rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i ched ni yid bde ba yang dag par bskyed pa'i don du'o // ci 'dir nye bar brtags pas sbyar ba yin nam /
translated: The meaning of “in order to generate complete faith” is in order to generate mental satisfaction.

original: 'on te des mngon sum du mkhyen pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te des mngon sum du mkhyen pa yin zhe na /
translated: Here, is this a case of figurative application or is it direct knowledge?

original: shes rab kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “wisdom,” etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sngar smras zin to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sngar smras zin to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom has already been mentioned.

original: de'i yul ni de'i rten no //
analyzed: de'i yul ni de'i rten no //
translated: Its object is its basis.

original: rab tu dang ba ni mnyam pa la sogs pa'i yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu dang ba ni mnyam pa la sogs pa'i yid bde ba'o //
translated: Faith is mental satisfaction that is even-minded, etc.

original: legs pa thams cad de mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa rnams so //
analyzed: legs pa thams cad de mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa rnams so //
translated: All that is good is both the higher realms and definite goodness.

original: 'thob ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni dngos kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'thob ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni dngos kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: The primary cause of attaining them is the actual cause.

original: de la rab tu dang ba la rang bzhin gyi nus pa 'di dag ji ltar yod ce na /
analyzed: de la rab tu dang ba la rang bzhin gyi nus pa 'di dag ji ltar yod ce na /
translated: How is it that faith has these natural powers?

original: bdag nyid dam pa rnams kyi spyod pa dang mthun par rab tu ston pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid dam pa rnams kyi spyod pa dang mthun par rab tu ston pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He shows the nature of faith, since he teaches in accordance with the conduct of the holy ones.

original: rab tu dang ba'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rab tu dang ba'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The nature of faith is

original: rang nyid kyi rang bzhin ni ting nge 'dzin dam pa dang / dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa rab tu ston pas so //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi rang bzhin ni ting nge 'dzin dam pa dang / dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa rab tu ston pas so //
translated: the nature of one’s own mind, which is shown to engage in the practice of the excellent meditative stabilization and the ten virtues, etc.

original: de la rab tu dang ba'i rang bzhin ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rab tu dang ba'i rang bzhin ni 'di yin te /
translated: The nature of faith is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir gdul bya ba'i rgyud la skyes pa tsam gyis rnam par g-yeng ba dang mi dge ba las sems rnam par log nas ting nge 'dzin dang dge ba bcu la 'jug go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gdul bya ba'i rgyud la skyes pa tsam gyis rnam par g-yeng ba dang mi dge ba las sems rnam par log nas ting nge 'dzin dang dge ba bcu la 'jug go //
translated: Since it is merely generated in the mental continuum of the disciple, the mind turns away from distraction and non-virtue and engages in meditative stabilization and the ten virtues.

original: de'i dbang gis kyang don thams cad phun @144a * //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis kyang don thams cad phun @144a * //
translated: By the power of that, all aims are completely fulfilled.

original: sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: This is the thought.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan bsam mi khyab //
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas are inconceivable.

original: sangs rgyas chos kyang bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos kyang bsam mi khyab //
translated: The Dharma of the Buddhas is inconceivable.

original: bsam mi khyab la dad rnams kyi //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab la dad rnams kyi //
translated: Those with faith in the inconceivable

original: rnam par smin pa 'ang bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa 'ang bsam mi khyab //
translated: The maturation is also inconceivable.

original: ces gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽de ltar zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du so so rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyis nges par bzung nas zhes bya ba thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa bsgom pa'i rab kyi mthar thug pa la 'jug pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pas nyams
analyzed: ces gang gsungs pa yin no // de ltar zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du so so rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyis nges par bzung nas zhes bya ba thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa bsgom pa'i rab kyi mthar thug pa la 'jug pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pas nyams
translated: Thus, it is said.🔽Thus, in the same way, having ascertained it with the wisdom of individual investigation, having experienced it with direct perception that enters the culmination of meditation that has the nature of hearing and so on, having ascertained it with the conceptual thought that arises after that,

original: su myong nas de'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas nges par byas nas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nges par mdzad pa'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes pa las byung ba nyid kyi tshig ni slu ba mi srid pas rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams shes rab bam /
analyzed: su myong nas de'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas nges par byas nas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nges par mdzad pa'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes pa las byung ba nyid kyi tshig ni slu ba mi srid pas rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams shes rab bam /
translated: having ascertained it with the wisdom of individual investigation, having ascertained it with the direct perception that enters the culmination of meditation that has the nature of hearing and so on, having ascertained it with the conceptual thought that arises after that,

original: dad pas 'jug par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: dad pas 'jug par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: the words that arise from the attainment of the samadhi that ascertains the perfection of wisdom are undeceiving. Therefore, those with conceptual thought will engage with wisdom or faith, but not otherwise. This is what is taught.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lugs kyi bstan bcos la sogs pa brtag cing sbyar ba'i don ni dran pa tsam du bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lugs kyi bstan bcos la sogs pa brtag cing sbyar ba'i don ni dran pa tsam du bkag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the sutra prohibits the mere memory of the meaning of the treatises on logic and so forth for the bodhisattvas.

original: skabs nyid kyis mtshams sbyar bar bya ste /🔽blo phul du byung ba mnga' ba'am /
analyzed: skabs nyid kyis mtshams sbyar bar bya ste / blo phul du byung ba mnga' ba'am /
translated: The next section is introduced by the following:🔽The Buddha is the one who has the highest intelligence

original: mi slu ba'i ye shes dang ldan pas sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i ye shes dang ldan pas sangs rgyas te /
translated: or who possesses non-deceptive gnosis,🔽because he is surrounded by a retinue of disciples,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa slob ma'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa slob ma'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: such as the sravakas.🔽The mother is the one who gives birth

original: nyan thos byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang ldan yum ste /
analyzed: nyan thos byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang ldan yum ste /
translated: to the assembly of sravakas and bodhisattvas.

original: bskyed par mdzad pa gang yin pa'i yum de la phyag 'tshal ba ni lus la sogs pas gus pas phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed par mdzad pa gang yin pa'i yum de la phyag 'tshal ba ni lus la sogs pas gus pas phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: Prostrating to that mother is respectfully bowing with one's body and so forth.

original: da ni don thams cad kyi gzhir gyur ba nyid kyis na yum gyi che ba'i bdag nyid ni nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni don thams cad kyi gzhir gyur ba nyid kyis na yum gyi che ba'i bdag nyid ni nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Now, in terms of being the basis of all meanings, the greatness of the mother is stated with the sravakas... and so forth.

original: rang gi gdul bya rnams la tshig gam lus kyi chos sgrogs pas na /
analyzed: rang gi gdul bya rnams la tshig gam lus kyi chos sgrogs pas na /
translated: It is called Dharma because it proclaims the Dharma to one's disciples by means of words or physical manifestations.

original: nyan thos te /
analyzed: nyan thos te /
translated: They are called śrāvakas because they proclaim the Dharma with their voice or body to their own disciples.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: Śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de zhi ba tshol ba rnams ni mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de zhi ba tshol ba rnams ni mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Those who seek peace are those who desire nirvāṇa.

original: kun shes nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams skye ba med par shes pas so //
analyzed: kun shes nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams skye ba med par shes pas so //
translated: By knowing all, means by knowing that external and internal things are unborn.

original: nyer zhir ni lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nyer zhir ni lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: In peace, means in nirvāṇa, characterized by having remainder and without remainder.

original: @144b khrid par mdzad pa ni thob par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: @144b khrid par mdzad pa ni thob par mdzad pa'o //
translated: They cause to enter, means they cause to attain.

original: 'gro la phan par byed pa rnams ni 'gro ba rnams la ma 'ongs pa na phan pa'i don skyed par mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro la phan par byed pa rnams ni 'gro ba rnams la ma 'ongs pa na phan pa'i don skyed par mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: Those who benefit beings are bodhisattvas who generate the benefit of beings in the future.

original: lam shes nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i dbang gis nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam skye ba med par thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i dbang gis nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam skye ba med par thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: By knowing the path, means by comprehending the non-arising of the paths of śrāvakas and so on through the power of disciples.

original: 'jig rten don grub mdzad pa ni sems can rnams kyi phan pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten don grub mdzad pa ni sems can rnams kyi phan pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The performance of the welfare of the world is the complete performance of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: gang dang yang dag ldan pa ni yum gang dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang yang dag ldan pa ni yum gang dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who is endowed with the mother is the one who is endowed with the mother.

original: thub rnams ni bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams yang dag par bsdams ba ste yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: thub rnams ni bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams yang dag par bsdams ba ste yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: The sages are the perfect Buddhas, who are the self-restraint of their own entities.

original: sna tshogs 'di dag rnam pa kun gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo sna tshogs pa 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du gsung zhing ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di dag rnam pa kun gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo sna tshogs pa 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du gsung zhing ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The one who speaks of all aspects of these varieties is the one who speaks and teaches all aspects of these varieties of Dharma wheels such as the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'phags pa byams pa bdag nyid dam pa rnams kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar smos pa nyid bstan cing gsal bar byas pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa bdag nyid dam pa rnams kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar smos pa nyid bstan cing gsal bar byas pa ni /
translated: The conduct of the noble Maitreya, the supreme ones, and so on, which was mentioned before, is taught and clarified by this verse beginning with this verse.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: This is what is meant by this verse and so on.

original: rnam par thar pa cung zad tsam zhig gis lhag pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams ni bag chags gnyis yod pa yin la rang sangs rgyas ni gzung ba'i bag chags spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa cung zad tsam zhig gis lhag pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams ni bag chags gnyis yod pa yin la rang sangs rgyas ni gzung ba'i bag chags spangs pa yin no //
translated: Those who are superior by a small amount of liberation are the śrāvakas, because they have two latent impressions, while the pratyekabuddhas have abandoned the latent impression of the object.

original: de'i phyir de rnams ni nyan thos rnams las rnam par thar pa cung zad tsam zhig gis lhag pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams ni nyan thos rnams las rnam par thar pa cung zad tsam zhig gis lhag pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are superior to the śrāvakas by a small amount of liberation.

original: de ni sems kyi khyad par kho na las rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa las rnal 'byor lhag pa yin pas nyan thos la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de ni sems kyi khyad par kho na las rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro // dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa las rnal 'byor lhag pa yin pas nyan thos la sogs pa ni /
translated: This is because they are established only by the superiority of mind.

original: rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The śrāvakas and so on are lords of yoga because they are superior to Maheśvara and so on in yoga.

original: ye shes la sogs pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gtsug tor gyi nor bu yin pas gtso bo'o //
analyzed: ye shes la sogs pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gtsug tor gyi nor bu yin pas gtso bo'o //
translated: The perfect buddhas are the crest jewel because of the greatness of their exalted wisdom and so on, and therefore they are supreme.

original: 'di ltar mdor bsdus na gang zag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdor bsdus na gang zag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, there are two types of persons:🔽some are of the nature of faith,

original: kha cig ni dad pa'i rang bzhin can yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni dad pa'i rang bzhin can yin la /
translated: and

original: de yang yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa thob pa nyid na spyod pa med par de'i mod la nges par dad pas nges par 'dzin pa la 'jug pa nyid yin no //🔽gang @145a * //
analyzed: de yang yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa thob pa nyid na spyod pa med par de'i mod la nges par dad pas nges par 'dzin pa la 'jug pa nyid yin no // gang @145a * //
translated: Moreover, when one obtains the result of holding the mother, and so on, and teaches it, one is not engaged in conduct, but at that very moment one definitely enters the apprehension of the mother through faith.

original: yang rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba rnams ni rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs par bshad pa'i tshig dang 'dra bar slu ba yod pa srid pas lung gang la yang bab chol du 'jug par mi byed de /
analyzed: yang rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba rnams ni rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs par bshad pa'i tshig dang 'dra bar slu ba yod pa srid pas lung gang la yang bab chol du 'jug par mi byed de /
translated: Those who are naturally sharp witted do not engage in any scripture in a haphazard way, because it is possible that there is deception, as in the case of the words that explain the self and so on to be permanent.

original: de rnams kyang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad mas grub pa gzhi dang lam dang rnam pa skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yum dang de la brten pa'i ting nge 'dzin rgyal po la sogs pa'i mdo thos pa la
analyzed: de rnams kyang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad mas grub pa gzhi dang lam dang rnam pa skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yum dang de la brten pa'i ting nge 'dzin rgyal po la sogs pa'i mdo thos pa la
translated: Those who are sharp witted listen to the mother, which is the basis, the path, and the aspect, characterized by the absence of origination, and so on, which is established by valid knowledge, and to the sutras that rely on it, such as the Samādhirāja-sūtra, and so on.

original: sogs pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa las dad pa phul du byung ba ni rigs pa nyid de gnod pa ma mthong bas phan tshun 'gal bar brjod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa las dad pa phul du byung ba ni rigs pa nyid de gnod pa ma mthong bas phan tshun 'gal bar brjod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of faith is the highest, because it is impossible to say that they are mutually contradictory, since they do not see any harm.

original: don la the tshom gyis yang dag pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir te /🔽tshad ma rnam 'grel mdzad pas /
analyzed: don la the tshom gyis yang dag pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir te / tshad ma rnam 'grel mdzad pas /
translated: Doubt about the meaning is a limb of engagement in the correct,🔽because the author of the Pramanavarttika says:

original: bstan bcos gang zhig rigs pas grub //
analyzed: bstan bcos gang zhig rigs pas grub //
translated: A treatise is established by reasoning,

original: rang gi tshig dang mi 'gal mthong //
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang mi 'gal mthong //
translated: is seen not to contradict itself,

original: ma mthong na yang de bzung ba //
analyzed: ma mthong na yang de bzung ba //
translated: and even if not seen, it is accepted

original: de ltar rigs pa mkhas pas shes //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa mkhas pas shes //
translated: in that way by the wise.

original: zhes gang bshad pa dang / yang /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa dang / yang /
translated: And also:

original: yon tan skyon dag ma mthong ba'i //
analyzed: yon tan skyon dag ma mthong ba'i //
translated: People who do not see good qualities and faults

original: skye bo gsog tu skyes pa la //
analyzed: skye bo gsog tu skyes pa la //
translated: are born in a heap.🔽Alas, who has given them

original: grub mtha' log par 'dzin pa dag / kye ma 'di ni gang gis byin //🔽zhes kyang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: grub mtha' log par 'dzin pa dag / kye ma 'di ni gang gis byin //🔽zhes kyang bshad pa yin no //
translated: the wrong view of tenets?

original: de nyid kyis na rtag pa la sogs pa dngos po kho nar gang du tshad ma dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba la rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams don dang mi ldan pa'i the tshom gyis khrus la sogs pa de la gang zhig 'jug par byed /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rtag pa la sogs pa dngos po kho nar gang du tshad ma dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba la rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams don dang mi ldan pa'i the tshom gyis khrus la sogs pa de la gang zhig 'jug par byed /
translated: Therefore, when one is conceptualizing something that is permanent and so on, which is contradicted by valid cognitions, how could one who is endowed with reason engage in such things as bathing for the sake of that which is not meaningful?

original: 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
translated: Āryadeva also explains:

original: mu stegs byed pa mang po ni //
analyzed: mu stegs byed pa mang po ni //
translated: Seeing that many tīrthikas

original: bdag tu lta bar zhugs mthong na //
analyzed: bdag tu lta bar zhugs mthong na //
translated: are engaged in the view of self,

original: chos mthong ba yi skye bo rnams //
analyzed: chos mthong ba yi skye bo rnams //
translated: what person who sees the Dharma

original: snying rje bar ni su mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: snying rje bar ni su mi 'gyur // zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: would not feel compassion?

original: gzhan dag gi sgo nas yum gyi mtshan nyid zlos te smras pa dang / mtshang ba nyid dang dgos pa med par rtog pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi sgo nas yum gyi mtshan nyid zlos te smras pa dang / mtshang ba nyid dang dgos pa med par rtog pa la /
translated: Others repeat the definition of the mother from another sūtra and think that it is contradictory and pointless.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pas yang dag par rdzogs pa nyid yin pa de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pas yang dag par rdzogs pa nyid yin pa de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, “If it is perfect because it is included in the three omnisciences,” and so on.

original: de ltar 'og nas bshad pa'i rim gyis mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi bstan bcos 'og nas bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas par grags pa ji ltar mdzad @145b cing sbyar ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar 'og nas bshad pa'i rim gyis mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi bstan bcos 'og nas bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas par grags pa ji ltar mdzad @145b cing sbyar ba yin zhe na /
translated: Thus, in the order to be explained below, he composed and applied the treatise Ornament of Clear Realization, known as the Verses, as follows.

original: gzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: He says, “basis, antidote, aspect, and inclusion,” and so on.

original: gzhi ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: gzhi ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The basis is that which has the nature of the outer and inner.

original: gnyen po ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: gnyen po ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam mo //
translated: The antidote is the path of the śrāvakas and so on.

original: rnam pa ni dngos pos stong pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ni dngos pos stong pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect is the aspect of emptiness of entity.

original: de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig bsdus pas zhes bya ba gang yang rung ba zhig nye bar bzung bas so //
analyzed: de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig bsdus pas zhes bya ba gang yang rung ba zhig nye bar bzung bas so //
translated: From among those, by including any one, by taking up any one.

original: phyogs dang po ltar na ni 'bad pa don med pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs dang po ltar na ni 'bad pa don med pa yin te /
translated: If it is the first position, then the effort is pointless.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan rnam par sbyar ba'i 'bad pa la dgos pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan rnam par sbyar ba'i 'bad pa la dgos pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: The effort to apply the Ornament of Clear Realization would be pointless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It says, “Because this perfection of wisdom . . .” and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zhes bya ba mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi bstan bcos zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zhes bya ba mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi bstan bcos zhes bya ba las /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the subject matter of the treatise called Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos mngon pa'i sde snod la sogs pa bdag las mi smos shing ma bshad pa'i phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi gzhi gang yin pa de 'byung ba med pas chos mngon pa'i sde snod la sogs pa la smos pa'i gzhi mngon par
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos mngon pa'i sde snod la sogs pa bdag las mi smos shing ma bshad pa'i phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi gzhi gang yin pa de 'byung ba med pas chos mngon pa'i sde snod la sogs pa la smos pa'i gzhi mngon par
translated: The treatise on the characteristics, the Abhidharma Piṭaka, and so on, do not mention the self, and it is not explained. Whatever bases there are that are not mentioned in the Abhidharma Piṭaka, and so on, are not existent. Therefore, the bases mentioned in the Abhidharma Piṭaka, and so on, are explicitly explained in the Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: rtogs pa'i rgyan las zlos te bshad pa'i nyes pa yod do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rgyan las zlos te bshad pa'i nyes pa yod do //
translated: There is the fault of repetition in the explanation.

original: de bzhin du phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang 'bad pa don med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang 'bad pa don med pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, if it is the second position, then the effort is pointless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par byang ba'i dngos por bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i dngos por bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is included in the category of complete purification.

original: rnam par byang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Complete purification is nirvāṇa.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pas 'dir ni lam la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pas 'dir ni lam la bya'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of that, here it is taken to be the path.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning: because the paths of the śrāvakas, etc. are included.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po ni gzung ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po ni gzung ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The basis of affliction is the adverse side, such as the apprehended object, etc.

original: de ma bsdus pa ni ma smos pa'o //
analyzed: de ma bsdus pa ni ma smos pa'o //
translated: Their non-inclusion is their non-mention.

original: pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: The word therefore is the reason.

original: 'di gang gi gnyen po yin pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi so sor nges par rtogs pa med pas rtogs pa med pa'i nyes pa yod do //
analyzed: 'di gang gi gnyen po yin pa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi so sor nges par rtogs pa med pas rtogs pa med pa'i nyes pa yod do //
translated: There is the fault of non-understanding, because the adverse side and the counteragent are not individually ascertained.

original: phyogs gsum pa ltar na yang 'bad pa don med pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa ltar na yang 'bad pa don med pa yin te /
translated: Even according to the third position, effort is pointless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rnam pa gzhi med pa tsam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rnam pa gzhi med pa tsam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir te //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because the mere groundlessness of the aspects is included.

original: rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa gzhi med pa'i rnam pa nyid smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa gzhi med pa'i rnam pa nyid smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere groundlessness of the aspects of conceptualization is mentioned.

original: cung zad kyang ma bshad pas don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de @146a * //
analyzed: cung zad kyang ma bshad pas don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de @146a * //
translated: There is the fault of non-understanding of the meaning, because nothing is explained at all.

original: bsgoms pas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas kyang gzhi gang yang thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir skyes bu'i don la dgos pa med pas brjod pa med pa'i nyes pa yod do //
analyzed: bsgoms pas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas kyang gzhi gang yang thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir skyes bu'i don la dgos pa med pas brjod pa med pa'i nyes pa yod do //
translated: Because even if one were to meditate on it, it would not lead to any attainment of a basis, it would be purposeless for a person, and so the fault of pointlessness would exist.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis ma bsdus pa'i nyes pa ni phyogs gsum car la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis ma bsdus pa'i nyes pa ni phyogs gsum car la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: The fault of not being included in the three knowledges should be understood in all three positions.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The word “because” is a reason.

original: don med pa yin no snyam du gzhan dag sems par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya bas rgol ba pos thams cad mthong ba ma yin no //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis bstan bcos la dgos pa med do snyam du shes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: don med pa yin no snyam du gzhan dag sems par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya bas rgol ba pos thams cad mthong ba ma yin no // zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis bstan bcos la dgos pa med do snyam du shes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Wouldn’t others think it is pointless?” is an objection, thinking that the treatise is pointless because it is not seen by all.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “That is not so” and so forth.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag ni /
translated: “By the three knowledges” means that the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: thams cad shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid do //
translated: have the knowledge of all.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lam shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lam shes pa nyid do //
translated: Bodhisattvas are the knowledge of the path.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: Perfect buddhas are the knowledge of all aspects.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po dag gis mngon par rtogs pa mtha' dag bsdus pa ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid mngon sum du byed pa thams cad kyi rgyur smos pa yin la /🔽des na gzhi dang / gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gzhi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid gsum car gyis kyang bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos su mdor bsdus nas yang dag par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa gsum po nyid du yum gtsor mtshon te
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po dag gis mngon par rtogs pa mtha' dag bsdus pa ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid mngon sum du byed pa thams cad kyi rgyur smos pa yin la / des na gzhi dang / gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gzhi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid gsum car gyis kyang bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos su mdor bsdus nas yang dag par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa gsum po nyid du yum gtsor mtshon te
translated: The three knowledges include all realizations, and they are said to be the cause of all direct realization of buddhahood.🔽Therefore, since they are also included by the three characteristics of the basis, the antidote, and the counteragent, they are summarized in the treatise entitled Ornament of Clear Realization and are taught correctly.

original: / yum gyi don ma lus pa ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / yum gyi don ma lus pa ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the three knowledges are primarily indicated in the Mother, because the entire meaning of the Mother is included in them.

original: de de ltar mtshan nyid 'dis mtshon pa nyid kyis sngar smras pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de de ltar mtshan nyid 'dis mtshon pa nyid kyis sngar smras pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since it is characterized in this way, the previously stated faults do not exist.

original: ma lus pa nyid dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid dang / rab tu byed pa'i go rims rtogs sla ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos 'di thun mong ma yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa gang la yin zhes rab tu byed pa rnam par 'byed pas dgongs so //
analyzed: ma lus pa nyid dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid dang / rab tu byed pa'i go rims rtogs sla ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos 'di thun mong ma yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa gang la yin zhes rab tu byed pa rnam par 'byed pas dgongs so //
translated: Since it is complete, it is perfect, and since it is easy to understand the sequence of the chapters, the treatise is unique and has a correct character.

original: don 'di nyid ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: This very meaning is stated by “thus” and so forth.

original: don dang gzhung gi mdor bsdus nas gsungs pa'i thams @146b cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum nye bar bstan nas de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don dang gzhung gi mdor bsdus nas gsungs pa'i thams @146b cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum nye bar bstan nas de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan pa ni /
translated: Having taught the three omnisciences that are stated in brief as the meaning and the text, the cause and effect of that are taught.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: In that regard, the statement “the knowledge of all things” and so forth is made.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of all things is form and so forth.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: form, feeling, etc.

original: de'i chos kyi rang bzhin bsgom par bya ba nyid la mi rtag pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i bsam gtan la brten nas /
analyzed: de'i chos kyi rang bzhin bsgom par bya ba nyid la mi rtag pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i bsam gtan la brten nas /
translated: The meditation on the nature of its dharmas is the contemplation of impermanence, emptiness, etc.

original: 'bras bu ni bdag tu rmongs pa spangs pa can yin te //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni bdag tu rmongs pa spangs pa can yin te //
translated: The result is the abandonment of delusion about self.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa stong pa nyid ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa stong pa nyid ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The result is the emptiness of the self-habit.

original: 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad shes pa'i stobs kyis bdag tu 'dzin pa las ldog go zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad shes pa'i stobs kyis bdag tu 'dzin pa las ldog go zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that one turns away from the self-habit by the power of knowing all the aspects of impermanence, etc. of form, etc.

original: theg pa thams cad kyis nges par 'byung ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: theg pa thams cad kyis nges par 'byung ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The escape by all vehicles is the result of the paths of the śrāvaka, etc.

original: de nyid de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid de kho na nyid de /
translated: That itself is reality.

original: dmigs su med pa la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of the non-apprehension of objects.

original: de'i mngon sum du mi byed pa gang yin pa de la brten pa ni de'i rgyus so //
analyzed: de'i mngon sum du mi byed pa gang yin pa de la brten pa ni de'i rgyus so //
translated: The non-realization of that is based on that, because of its cause.

original: 'bras bu sems can ma bsdus pa sdud par byed pa can yin pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ma thob pa dang / sbyin pa dang rab tu sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba ni 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu sems can ma bsdus pa sdud par byed pa can yin pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ma thob pa dang / sbyin pa dang rab tu sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba ni 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Giving, giving up, etc. are the result.

original: 'dis ni lam thams cad dmigs pa med par dmigs pa ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba ji srid pa'i bar du thos pa la sogs pa las ldog par mi byed do zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lam thams cad dmigs pa med par dmigs pa ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba ji srid pa'i bar du thos pa la sogs pa las ldog par mi byed do zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the bodhisattva does not turn away from listening, etc. for as long as cyclic existence lasts, by means of the knowledge of path aspects, the objective support of all paths, which is the objective support of the absence of an objective support.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med par rten pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med par rten pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The objective support of the non-production of all phenomena is the reason for the non-production of form, etc. ultimately.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa ni mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa ni mtha' med pa'o //
translated: The infinite objective support is the objective support of the infinite realm of space.

original: sems can gyi don rgyun mi 'chad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su sems can gyi don skye ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa yin pas rang dbang med par byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang yang 'khor ba ji srid du kun nas 'jug cing /
analyzed: sems can gyi don rgyun mi 'chad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su sems can gyi don skye ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa yin pas rang dbang med par byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang yang 'khor ba ji srid du kun nas 'jug cing /
translated: The uninterrupted benefit of sentient beings is the activity of the bodhisattva, which is involuntary, since the benefit of sentient beings has been cultivated since beginningless time.

original: yang dag pa nyid kyi mtha' rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid kyi mtha' rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is the realization of the limit of reality,

original: bdag med pas mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: bdag med pas mngon sum du byed do //
