translated: which is the direct realization of selflessness.

original: de dag gi bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba ni rnam par rtog pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba ni rnam par rtog pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'o //
translated: The connection with the instinct for that is the succession of conceptual thoughts.

original: de spangs pa can yin pa ni dor ba'o //
analyzed: de spangs pa can yin pa ni dor ba'o //
translated: The possession of the elimination of that is the relinquishment.

original: @147a * // de nyid ni 'bras bu yin pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: @147a * // de nyid ni 'bras bu yin pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That itself is the result.

original: 'di ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa la rten pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa ma lus par spangs pa dang / sems can gyi don yang nam mkha' lding bsgrubs pa'i mchod sdong dang 'dra bar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa la rten pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa ma lus par spangs pa dang / sems can gyi don yang nam mkha' lding bsgrubs pa'i mchod sdong dang 'dra bar bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the knowledge of all aspects based on the non-production of all phenomena, the complete abandonment of all conceptual thoughts, and the benefit of sentient beings, like a wish-fulfilling tree.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, and so on is stated.

original: skye bo blo gros dman pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan bcos kyi dgos pa med pa nyid du rtog pa la /
analyzed: skye bo blo gros dman pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan bcos kyi dgos pa med pa nyid du rtog pa la /
translated: In those of inferior intelligence, and so on, the purpose of the treatise is considered to be non-existent.

original: dam pa 'jug pa'i yan lag brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ston pa yin te /
analyzed: dam pa 'jug pa'i yan lag brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ston pa yin te /
translated: The limbs of engagement by the sublime ones are taught, such as the subject matter, and so on.

original: ma pham pa'i rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar rgyal ba gang la mnga' ba de ni ma pham pa rgyal ba'o //🔽de don ci zhig ste /
analyzed: ma pham pa'i rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar rgyal ba gang la mnga' ba de ni ma pham pa rgyal ba'o // de don ci zhig ste /
translated: The one who is like the perfect Buddha Ajita, the Victor, is called Ajita-Jina.🔽What is the meaning of that?

original: dgos pa ci zhig yod snyam na /
analyzed: dgos pa ci zhig yod snyam na /
translated: What is the purpose?

original: rang gi bstan bcos las tha mi dad pa'i rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa dang / gdul bya rnams kyis bde blag tu khong du chud pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ba yin pa de ni don la the tshom skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bstan bcos las tha mi dad pa'i rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa dang / gdul bya rnams kyis bde blag tu khong du chud pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ba yin pa de ni don la the tshom skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The subject matter, the purpose, and the purpose of the purpose are stated in the words “doubt about the meaning” and so forth.

original: mdo don ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo'i don brjod par bya ba mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: mdo don ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo'i don brjod par bya ba mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: The meaning of the sūtras is the subject matter to be expressed, which is the eight topics of realization that are the meaning of the sūtras such as the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de'i nye bar mtshon pa'i don ni /
analyzed: de'i nye bar mtshon pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning that illustrates that is

original: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid can //
analyzed: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid can //
translated: the nature of the ten Dharma activities.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated in the words “the nature of the ten Dharma activities.”

original: byang chub kyi sems dang / rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dran pa la gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang / rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dran pa la gzhag pa ste /
translated: The ten perfections such as generosity that are purified by the thought of awakening are set forth in the mind.

original: thos pa dang bsam pa dag gis yang dag par dran nas 'dir yum ston par mdzad pa sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su ston par mdzad pas bstan pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid lam ste /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa dag gis yang dag par dran nas 'dir yum ston par mdzad pa sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su ston par mdzad pas bstan pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid lam ste /
translated: Having remembered it through listening and reflection, he teaches it here, teaching the Mother in accordance with the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: byang chub tu bde bas 'gro ba nyid yin pas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub tu bde bas 'gro ba nyid yin pas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi lam mo //
translated: The path is the knowledge of all aspects that is taught, because it is the path to blissfully proceed to enlightenment.

original: lam de ni gzhan gyi zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan rnams kyis myong ba ma yin zhing rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lam de ni gzhan gyi zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan rnams kyis myong ba ma yin zhing rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: That path is not experienced or realized by others,

original: blo dang ldan pas rtogs 'gyur te //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas rtogs 'gyur te //
translated: but is realized by the wise.

original: zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du byed de /
translated: The wise refers to bodhisattvas, who manifest buddhahood.🔽The Sutra of the Secret of the Tathagatas says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo @147b las 'di'i lus dang spyod lam mtha' yas shing thug pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo @147b las 'di'i lus dang spyod lam mtha' yas shing thug pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: His body and conduct are infinite and inexhaustible.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa nyid yin na yang 'tshang rgya ba nyid mngon sum du bya ba'i smon lam gyi dbang gis gdul bya rnams la de las gzhan pa'i sku dang spyod lam so sor snang ba ltar ston pa
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa nyid yin na yang 'tshang rgya ba nyid mngon sum du bya ba'i smon lam gyi dbang gis gdul bya rnams la de las gzhan pa'i sku dang spyod lam so sor snang ba ltar ston pa
translated: Conceptualization is a bodhisattva’s affliction, but it is not a fault, since he manifests a body and behavior different from that for the sake of disciples, by the power of his vow to realize full enlightenment.

original: yin pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa ci zhig yin no //
analyzed: yin pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa ci zhig yin no //
translated: What is the purpose of this discussion?

original: bde blag tu ni rtogs 'gyur ba //
analyzed: bde blag tu ni rtogs 'gyur ba //
translated: It is for the sake of easy understanding.

original: zhes bya ba ni gdul bya rnams kyis mngon par rtogs pa brgyad bde blag tu khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba rtsom pa'i dgos pa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gdul bya rnams kyis mngon par rtogs pa brgyad bde blag tu khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba rtsom pa'i dgos pa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The disciples will easily understand the eight realizations. This is the second purpose of undertaking the analysis.

original: de ltar na mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dgos pa 'di dag kho nas skyes pa'i don 'grub pa thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin pas na thug pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dgos pa 'di dag kho nas skyes pa'i don 'grub pa thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin pas na thug pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since all the purposes of the composition of the treatise on the characteristics are fulfilled by these alone, there is no infinite regress.

original: 'di ltar stong phrag brgya ba la sogs pa'i mdo la lar bsdus pa dang / bsdus pa rgyas pa dang / rgya che ba dang rtogs par dka' ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar stong phrag brgya ba la sogs pa'i mdo la lar bsdus pa dang / bsdus pa rgyas pa dang / rgya che ba dang rtogs par dka' ba yin la /
translated: Thus, in the sutras such as the Hundred Thousand, the teaching is concise, extensive, vast, and difficult to understand.

original: bstan bcos 'di ni de las go bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di ni de las go bzlog pa yin no //
translated: But this treatise is the opposite of that.

original: de bas na 'dis ni tshe dang blo dang shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pa dag gis kyang rnam par phye bas mngon par rtogs pa'i don mod la shes pa dang / de bsgoms pas kyang sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ba yin pas sems dang ldan pa su zhig bstan bcos 'di la don med pa nyid du rtogs par byed /
analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni tshe dang blo dang shes rab chung ngu dang ldan pa dag gis kyang rnam par phye bas mngon par rtogs pa'i don mod la shes pa dang / de bsgoms pas kyang sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ba yin pas sems dang ldan pa su zhig bstan bcos 'di la don med pa nyid du rtogs par byed /
translated: Therefore, even those who have little life, intelligence, and wisdom can understand the meaning of the teaching by means of the analysis in this treatise, and by meditating on it, they will attain buddhahood, etc. Thus, what intelligent person would think that this treatise is useless?

original: bshad ma thag pa'i mdo dang de'i mtshan nyid mdzad pa sangs rgyas dang byams pa dag las go rims bzhin du de gnyis kyi gdul bya shes rab kyis rlom pa dang / cig shos kyang yod pas don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i mdo dang de'i mtshan nyid mdzad pa sangs rgyas dang byams pa dag las go rims bzhin du de gnyis kyi gdul bya shes rab kyis rlom pa dang / cig shos kyang yod pas don med pa ma yin no //
translated: The disciples of those two teachers, Buddha and Maitreya, who have just been mentioned, are, respectively, conceited about their wisdom and not conceited. Thus, the teaching and the treatise are not useless.

original: 'dis ni gang la la zhig mngon par rtogs pa nyid kyi rgyan yin gyi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag kyang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gang la la zhig mngon par rtogs pa nyid kyi rgyan yin gyi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag kyang bsal ba yin te /
translated: This also refutes those who say that the Ornament is an ornament for realization, not for the characteristics.

original: gnyi ga'i yang rgyan yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang yang mdo las bsdus pa dang rgyas pa nyid la sogs pa'i don bla ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa can ma yin no zhes zer bas de'i gzhung gis ni mtshan nyid mdzad pas don gang yang byas pa ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i yang rgyan yin pa'i phyir ro // gang yang mdo las bsdus pa dang rgyas pa nyid la sogs pa'i don bla ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa can ma yin no zhes zer bas de'i gzhung gis ni mtshan nyid mdzad pas don gang yang byas pa ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: For it is an ornament for both.🔽And those who say that the meaning of the sutra is not transmitted from one teacher to another, that the author of the Ornament did not do anything to the meaning,

original: mdo sde'i bla ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nub pas de'i mtshan nyid la @148a * //
analyzed: mdo sde'i bla ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa nub pas de'i mtshan nyid la @148a * //
translated: we reply that the characteristics of the sutra are not known to later generations,

original: yang gdul bya gus par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gtso bo nyid yin pas dgos pa gnyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gdul bya gus par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gtso bo nyid yin pas dgos pa gnyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: so the author of the Ornament taught the two purposes in order to generate respect for the sutra in those to be trained.

original: 'brel pa la sogs pa ni don gyis shes par 'gyur bas rab tu byed pa las ma smos so //
analyzed: 'brel pa la sogs pa ni don gyis shes par 'gyur bas rab tu byed pa las ma smos so //
translated: Since the connection and so on can be understood by implication, they are not mentioned in the treatise.

original: 'brel pa dang ni rjes mthun thabs //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang ni rjes mthun thabs //
translated: Connection, compatibility, method,

original: skyes bu'i don ni rjod byed pa //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don ni rjod byed pa //
translated: The meaning of the person is the expression.

original: yongs brtags dbang du byas pa'i tshig / de las gzhan pa dbang byas min //
analyzed: yongs brtags dbang du byas pa'i tshig / de las gzhan pa dbang byas min //
translated: The word is considered to be dependent on the object, but not dependent on the other.

original: zhes smos pas dam pa rnams ni yongs su brtag pa nyid kyis 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni legs par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes smos pas dam pa rnams ni yongs su brtag pa nyid kyis 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni legs par smras pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is well said that the holy ones should be engaged by way of the thorough investigation.

original: cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang kun brjod pa dang / rjes su bstan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
analyzed: cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang kun brjod pa dang / rjes su bstan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
translated: By the three miracles means by the three miracles of supernatural power, reading the thoughts, and instruction.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni nges par legs pa la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni nges par legs pa la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of benefit for oneself and others is the good life, etc.

original: de dag bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: In order to accomplish those,

original: ci la yang ma rags par chas pa ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyi go cha brtan par byas pas so //
analyzed: ci la yang ma rags par chas pa ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyi go cha brtan par byas pas so //
translated: the armor of irreversibility is made firm by the non-regressing attitude.

original: nyams su myong ba shin tu gsal ba ni mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos thos pa la sogs pa gsal bar byas pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba shin tu gsal ba ni mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos thos pa la sogs pa gsal bar byas pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The very clear experience is the consciousness that has made clear the study of the treatise on the characteristics, etc.

original: des gzhag pa'i bag chags ni mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos phul du byung ba'i shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las byung ba'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: des gzhag pa'i bag chags ni mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos phul du byung ba'i shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las byung ba'i nus pa'o //
translated: The latent impressions deposited by that are the potential that arises from the transmission of the cognition of the excellent treatise on the characteristics.

original: de las byung ba'i dran pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni dran pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i dran pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni dran pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The cognition of memory that arises from that is the cognition of memory.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub cing nyams su len pa de nyid ni spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub cing nyams su len pa de nyid ni spyod pa yin te /
translated: The practice and cultivation of the thought of awakening and generosity and so on is itself the practice.

original: 'khor ba ci srid par rten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba ci srid par rten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the support for as long as cyclic existence exists.

original: kun tu 'gro ba ni chos kyi dbyings khyab pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba ni chos kyi dbyings khyab pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The all-pervading is the cognition that pervades the dharmadhātu.

original: de rtogs pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: The realization of that is the actualization of that.

original: de nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid de rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid de rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That itself is the nature of the characteristics, which are the stages of the joyful and so on.

original: de rnams rtogs pa'i rim pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa phul du byung ba'i rim pa des rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams rtogs pa'i rim pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa phul du byung ba'i rim pa des rtogs pa'o //
translated: The stages of the realization of those are the realization by the stages of the excellence of the perfections such as generosity.

original: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams de dang der gnas shing sangs rgyas nyid sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'di'i dgos pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams de dang der gnas shing sangs rgyas nyid sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'di'i dgos pa smras pa yin no //
translated: This states the purpose of this treatise: the perfection of wisdom itself, abiding in the stages of joy, etc., accomplishes buddhahood.

original: mngon par rtogs pa brgyad bde blag tu rtogs pas ni dgos pa mngon sum du byed pa @148b yin la /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa brgyad bde blag tu rtogs pas ni dgos pa mngon sum du byed pa @148b yin la /
translated: The direct realization of the eight realizations is the direct realization of the purpose.

original: gal te mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos kyi mdo la mngon par rtogs pa'i don rtogs par ma gyur na mdo la mngon sum du byed par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos kyi mdo la mngon par rtogs pa'i don rtogs par ma gyur na mdo la mngon sum du byed par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If one does not understand the meaning of the realizations in the sutra of the treatise on the characteristics, one will not directly realize the sutra.

original: de'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa so so'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni byams pa mngon par bzhed pa'i stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i mdo'i don tshig re re nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa so so'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni byams pa mngon par bzhed pa'i stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i mdo'i don tshig re re nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the perfection of wisdom in each of the realizations is stated in the sutras such as the Hundred Thousand Stanza Perfection of Wisdom, which Maitreya is said to have requested.

original: ma 'dzings pa nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi lus rnam par gzhag pa ni lam dang gzhung gi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: ma 'dzings pa nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi lus rnam par gzhag pa ni lam dang gzhung gi bdag nyid can no //
translated: In order to teach non-entanglement, the body of the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of non-conceptual wisdom, is presented as the path and the treatise.🔽Here,

original: 'dir / mdo don smra ba rnams kyis ni //🔽dgos pa bsdus pa'i don bcas dang // tshig don bcas dang mtshams sbyar bcas //
analyzed: 'dir / mdo don smra ba rnams kyis ni // dgos pa bsdus pa'i don bcas dang // tshig don bcas dang mtshams sbyar bcas //
translated: the expounders of the meaning of the sutras🔽should explain with the summarized meaning, the meaning of the words, the connection,

original: brgal lan bcas pas bsnyad par bya //
analyzed: brgal lan bcas pas bsnyad par bya //
translated: and the replies to objections.

original: zhes rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa las nges par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa las nges par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because this should be understood from the principles of explanation,🔽the noble Maitreya, intending to explain the perfection of wisdom in three aspects in the verse summary, states the purpose.

original: 'phags pa byams pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa gsum tshig le'ur byas pa'i rgya cher bshad pas 'chad par bzhed pas dgos pa smras zin nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa gsum tshig le'ur byas pa'i rgya cher bshad pas 'chad par bzhed pas dgos pa smras zin nas /
translated: Having stated the purpose,

original: re zhig bsdus pa dang rgyas pas bsdus pa'i don gsungs pa yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig bsdus pa dang rgyas pas bsdus pa'i don gsungs pa yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: it should be seen that he then states the summarized and extensive meanings.

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lam gyi bdag nyid can tshig gi don brgyad kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i ngag chen por rtogs pa'i tshig tu brjod pa brgyad kyis sam yang na 'og nas bshad pa'i dngos po🔽brgyad kyis yang dag par bshad cing gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lam gyi bdag nyid can tshig gi don brgyad kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i ngag chen por rtogs pa'i tshig tu brjod pa brgyad kyis sam yang na 'og nas bshad pa'i dngos po brgyad kyis yang dag par bshad cing gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of the path, is explained and taught by eight topics, the eight topics of the great way of the perfection of wisdom and so on, or else by the eight topics that will be explained below.

original: 'dis ni lam dang gzhung gi bdag nyid can gyi yum gyi lus gsungs pa yin la de gsungs pas kyang sgyu ma lta bu'i gnyis su med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bshad pa yin te /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i tshul thams cad du kun rdzob dang don dam pas brgyan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni lam dang gzhung gi bdag nyid can gyi yum gyi lus gsungs pa yin la de gsungs pas kyang sgyu ma lta bu'i gnyis su med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bshad pa yin te / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul thams cad du kun rdzob dang don dam pas brgyan te /
translated: This explains the body of the mother, which has the nature of the path and the treatise, and by explaining that, it also explains illusory nondual perfection of wisdom.

original: ston par mdzad pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: ston par mdzad pa nyid yin la /
translated: The bodhisattvas teach all the ways of the bodhisattva, which are adorned with the conventional and the ultimate.

original: gzhan du na gdul bya rnams mtha' gcig tu ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gdul bya rnams mtha' gcig tu ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the disciples would fall to one extreme.

original: da ni dngos po brgyad mdor bsdus pa ni shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni dngos po brgyad mdor bsdus pa ni shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Now, the summary of the eight topics is the knowledge of all aspects and so on.

original: ma skyes pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid do //🔽de bzhin du lam @149a * //
analyzed: ma skyes pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid do // de bzhin du lam @149a * //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the knowledge of all aspects by virtue of non-arising.

original: thams cad shes pa ni lam shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa ni lam shes pa nyid do //
translated: Similarly, the knowledge of the path is the knowledge of all paths.

original: de bzhin du gzhi thams cad shes pa ni thams cad shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhi thams cad shes pa ni thams cad shes pa nyid do //
translated: Similarly, the knowledge of all bases is the knowledge of all bases.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po 'di nyid gcig tu byas pa'i bdag nyid thams cad shes pa ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po 'di nyid gcig tu byas pa'i bdag nyid thams cad shes pa ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the complete and perfect realization of all aspects of these three knowledges of all aspects taken as one.

original: de las kyang rab kyi mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de las kyang rab kyi mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: And that is the culmination of the supreme.

original: 'chol ba dang ma 'chol bar rtogs pa'i don go rims su yod pas na /
analyzed: 'chol ba dang ma 'chol bar rtogs pa'i don go rims su yod pas na /
translated: The meaning of realization in a mixed and unmixed order is

original: mthar gyis pa'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'o //
translated: the serial.

original: don de dag nyid skad cig ma gcig gis rtogs pas na skad cig mngon rdzogs byang chub bo //
analyzed: don de dag nyid skad cig ma gcig gis rtogs pas na skad cig mngon rdzogs byang chub bo //
translated: The realization of those meanings in a single moment is the moment-to-moment complete enlightenment.

original: skad cig ma gnyis par bcos ma ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi skur mngon par byang chub pas chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis par bcos ma ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi skur mngon par byang chub pas chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The body that is the nature of reality is the Dharma Body, because it is the body that is the nature of reality, since it is the body that is the nature of the Dharma.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de nas zhes bya ba ni de nas lam shes pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis skabs rnam pa brgyad kyi go rims bstan pa'i phyir /🔽thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de nas zhes bya ba ni de nas lam shes pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis skabs rnam pa brgyad kyi go rims bstan pa'i phyir / thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word then is for the sake of indicating the order of the eight topics, beginning with the knowledge of paths.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The word and is for the sake of completion.🔽 The word eight is for the sake of indicating the number of the topics.🔽 The word only is for the sake of excluding other topics.

original: de rnam brgyad ces bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa ni brgyad po de dag gis yongs su rdzogs pa yin te lhag ma med pa dang ma tshang ba med pa 'di dag kho nas 'tshang rgya ba nyid grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnam brgyad ces bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa ni brgyad po de dag gis yongs su rdzogs pa yin te lhag ma med pa dang ma tshang ba med pa 'di dag kho nas 'tshang rgya ba nyid grub pa yin no //
translated: The word attains is for the sake of indicating the result.

original: yang na de nas chos kyi sku dang zhes bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na de nas chos kyi sku dang zhes bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: The word enlightenment is for the sake of indicating the result.

original: de nas de dag gi 'bras bu ni nges par bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis mngon par rtogs pa ni brgyad po 'di dag nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas de dag gi 'bras bu ni nges par bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis mngon par rtogs pa ni brgyad po 'di dag nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In this way, the eight realizations are just these.

original: de ltar mngon par rtogs pa brgyad go rims bzhin du mdor bsdus te yang dag par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par rtogs pa brgyad go rims bzhin du mdor bsdus te yang dag par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught in brief the eight realizations in order,

original: de bzhin du cung zad cig gis rgya cher bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du cung zad cig gis rgya cher bstan pa ni /
translated: he teaches a little bit in detail.

original: sems bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /🔽gzhan gyi phyir 'tshang rgya ba nyid la sems 'jog pa ni /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te / gzhan gyi phyir 'tshang rgya ba nyid la sems 'jog pa ni /
translated: He says, “arousing the mind,” and so on.

original: sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: Setting the mind on awakening for the sake of others is arousing the mind.

original: de yang sems bskyed pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //🔽rnam pa bcu la bslab pa ni gdams ngag de yang /🔽sgrub dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
analyzed: de yang sems bskyed pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to // rnam pa bcu la bslab pa ni gdams ngag de yang / sgrub dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
translated: That is taught by “arousing the mind,” and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: Training in the ten aspects is taught by “accomplishment, the truths,” and so on.

original: nges par 'byed pa ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: The certain deliverance is the direct realization of awakening.

original: de'i yan lag ni rgyu ste drod la sogs @149b pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i yan lag ni rgyu ste drod la sogs @149b pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Its cause is the branch, which is of four kinds, according to the distinctions of heat, etc.

original: de yang dmigs pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: And that is taught by the verse beginning with “Its objective support is all dharmas.

original: sgrub pa ni nyams su len pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni nyams su len pa ste /
translated: ” Practice is the performance;

original: de'i rten ni gzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i rten ni gzhi'o //
translated: its basis is the foundation.

original: de yang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: And that is the nature of the dharmadhatu, which is the identity of nondual intuition.

original: de yang rtogs pa yi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de yang rtogs pa yi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: And that is taught by the verse beginning with “The realization of the ultimate.

original: dmigs pa ni yul yin te /🔽de yang / dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni yul yin te / de yang / dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
translated: ” Objective support is the object;

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: and that is taught by the verse beginning with “The objective support is all dharmas.

original: gang la dmigs nas 'jug pa de ni ched yin te /
analyzed: gang la dmigs nas 'jug pa de ni ched yin te /
translated: ” The aim is that which is engaged by the objective support;

original: de yang sems can kun mchog ces bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de yang sems can kun mchog ces bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: and that is taught by the verse beginning with “The aim is the supremacy over all sentient beings.

original: go cha 'jug pa'i bya ba dang / zhes bya ba ni dang po gzhan gyi don las phyir mi ldog pa'i sems ni go cha'o //
analyzed: go cha 'jug pa'i bya ba dang / zhes bya ba ni dang po gzhan gyi don las phyir mi ldog pa'i sems ni go cha'o //
translated: ” Armor is the activity of engagement;

original: de'i bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam drug la /
analyzed: de'i bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam drug la /
translated: Its function is the six kinds of giving, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: This is shown by the verse beginning, “Giving, morality, etc.”

original: nyams su len pa ni 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: nyams su len pa ni 'jug pa ste /
translated: Practice is engagement.

original: de'i bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i bya ba ni /
translated: Its function is

original: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: meditation, the formless [absorptions], giving, etc.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni thams cad du sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni thams cad du sdud pa yin no //
translated: The word “and” [in the root text] includes everything.

original: 'di dag gis byang chub thob pa'i sgo nas yang dag par 'dzin pa na tshogs te snying rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gis byang chub thob pa'i sgo nas yang dag par 'dzin pa na tshogs te snying rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: These are the accumulations of compassion, etc., which are the means of attaining enlightenment.

original: tshogs de yang /
analyzed: tshogs de yang /
translated: And that accumulation

original: brtse dang sbyin la sogs pa drug / ces bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: brtse dang sbyin la sogs pa drug / ces bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: is shown by the verse beginning, “Compassion, giving, etc.”

original: nges par 'byung bcas rnams ni thob pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung bcas rnams ni thob pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Those that are accompanied by renunciation are accompanied by attainment.

original: de ni ched du bya dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de ni ched du bya dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: This is shown by the verse beginning, “The practice of the perfections.”

original: thub pa'i rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid //
analyzed: thub pa'i rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid //
translated: The omniscience of the Sage

original: ces bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi'o //
translated: is that of the perfect Buddha.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyis lha rnams kyi 'od dri ma can du mdzad pa ni mog mog por byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyis lha rnams kyi 'od dri ma can du mdzad pa ni mog mog por byed pa'o //
translated: The light of the Perfectly Enlightened One makes the light of the gods impure, i.e., it eclipses it.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni yul so sor nges pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de ni lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni yul so sor nges pa la sogs pa'o // de ni lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “and so on” refers to the fact that the light of the Buddha is superior in terms of its specific objects.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: This is indicated by the passage that begins with the words, “In order to make the gods receptive.🔽.🔽.🔽The path of the rhinoceros-like disciples.

original: slob ma bse ru'i lam gang dang // zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis btul ba yin pas na /
analyzed: slob ma bse ru'i lam gang dang // zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis btul ba yin pas na /
translated: The disciples are those who are converted by the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: slob ma ste nyan thos rnams so //
analyzed: slob ma ste nyan thos rnams so //
translated: They are the śrāvakas.

original: gcig tu spyod pas na bse ru ste /
analyzed: gcig tu spyod pas na bse ru ste /
translated: The rhinoceros-like ones are so called because they practice alone.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams so //🔽'di gnyis kyi lam gang yin pa de dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa @150a * //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams so // 'di gnyis kyi lam gang yin pa de dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa @150a * //
translated: They are the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The path of these two is indicated by the four noble truths and so on, and by the phrase, “because of the diminution of the conception of the grasped.

original: bzhi po la sogs pa dang / gzung ba'i rtog pa nyams phyir dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas go rims bzhin du ston to //🔽'di dang gzhan pa'i yon tan gyis //
analyzed: bzhi po la sogs pa dang / gzung ba'i rtog pa nyams phyir dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas go rims bzhin du ston to // 'di dang gzhan pa'i yon tan gyis //
translated: and so on, and “because the concepts of apprehended objects are eliminated” and so on.🔽🔽By these, the four and so on are taught in order.🔽🔽By these, the four and so on are taught in order.

original: phan yon che ba mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: phan yon che ba mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The path of insight is seen to have great benefits in terms of its own qualities and those of others.

original: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i yon tan dang ldan pas 'bras bu che ba ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i yon tan dang ldan pas 'bras bu che ba ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path of seeing is the great result, since it possesses seen and unseen qualities.

original: de ni / bden dang bden la bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas smos te /
analyzed: de ni / bden dang bden la bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas smos te /
translated: It is stated in the lines beginning: “Acceptance of the truths of suffering and origin” and so on.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi bya ba ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi bya ba ni byed pa ste /
translated: The path of meditation is the activity, since it is the activity of the path of seeing.

original: kun nas dul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: kun nas dul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: It is taught in the lines beginning: “Fully disciplined” and so on.

original: lhag par mos pa ni mos pa ste /🔽de yang / mos pa rang gi don dang ni //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa ni mos pa ste / de yang / mos pa rang gi don dang ni //
translated: Interest is the devotion of the path of meditation,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: and it is taught in the lines beginning: “Interest in one’s own and others’ benefit” and so on.🔽Moreover, the interest of the path of meditation is taught in the lines beginning: “Interest in the teachings of the Great Vehicle” and so on.

original: de yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po la sogs pas sangs rgyas la sogs pas don ci lta ba bzhin du mngon par dgyes pa ni /
analyzed: de yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po la sogs pas sangs rgyas la sogs pas don ci lta ba bzhin du mngon par dgyes pa ni /
translated: The path of meditation is the delight of the buddhas and so on, since it is the delight of the buddhas and so on in the path of meditation, which is small, middling, great and so on.

original: bstod dang bkur dang bsngags pa dang // zhes bya ba yin te /🔽de ni / shes rab pha rol phyin pa la //
analyzed: bstod dang bkur dang bsngags pa dang // zhes bya ba yin te / de ni / shes rab pha rol phyin pa la //
translated: It is taught in the lines beginning: “Praise, honor and extol” and so on.🔽The path of meditation is the cause of the path of no more learning, since it is the cause of the path of no more learning.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: It is taught in the lines beginning: “The perfection of wisdom” and so on.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi phyir stobs pa ni yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi phyir stobs pa ni yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: The dedication of the roots of virtue to the attainment of Buddhahood is the dedication.

original: de bzhin du dge ba rnams la yang dag par dga' ba ni rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba rnams la yang dag par dga' ba ni rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: The rejoicing in the virtues of others is the rejoicing.

original: de gnyis kyis yid la byed pa bla na med pa dag ni /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis yid la byed pa bla na med pa dag ni /
translated: The mental attentions of these two are unsurpassed.

original: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i sems la'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i sems la'o //
translated: They are in the unsurpassed thought, because of the purification of the three spheres.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: These are taught in order

original: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
translated: by the verses beginning with “The dedication is distinguished,”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gi / zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gis go rims bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gi / zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gis go rims bzhin du ston to //
translated: and beginning with “By means of the skillful means and the nondiscriminations.”

original: sangs rgyas nyid la bstod pas na bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la bstod pas na bsgrub pa ste /
translated: The establishment is the praise of Buddhahood.

original: de yang de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
analyzed: de yang de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
translated: And that is the supremacy of its nature.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: This is taught by the verse beginning with “The supremacy of its nature.”

original: shin tu dag pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' las rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu dag pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' las rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The extreme purification is the purification from the extremes.

original: de yang sangs rgyas rten dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas rten dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'og nas ston to //
translated: And that is taught below by the verse beginning with “The Buddha is the supreme support.”

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni mos pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni mos pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa lnga pa'o //
translated: This is called the path of cultivation. The five beginning with “faith” are the path of cultivation.

original: mkhas rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam ba'i bden pa shes pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi dgongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: mkhas rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam ba'i bden pa shes pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi dgongs pa can yin no //
translated: The “wise” are the bodhisattvas, who have the intention of nondual knowledge of the conventional and ultimate truths.

original: lam shes pa nyid @150b bshad do //🔽shes pa zhes bya ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thob pa'i shes pas bdag la sogs tshar bcad pas srid pa mi gnas shing shes bya ba nyes dmigs mthong bas sgyu
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid @150b bshad do // shes pa zhes bya ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thob pa'i shes pas bdag la sogs tshar bcad pas srid pa mi gnas shing shes bya ba nyes dmigs mthong bas sgyu
translated: The knowledge of the path has been explained.

original: ma dang 'dra ba'i 'khor ba la rtag pa'i lta ba mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: ma dang 'dra ba'i 'khor ba la rtag pa'i lta ba mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: “Knowledge” is the knowledge of the perfection of wisdom, etc., obtained by the power of the spiritual friend, etc. Since the self, etc., are destroyed by that knowledge, existence does not endure. Since the faults of the knowable are seen, there is no clinging to the view of permanence in the illusory cyclic existence.

original: sems can ma lus pa la dmigs pa'i snying rje zhi la mi gnas te bdag nyid thams cad rgyun chad mar me lta bur mya ngan las 'das pa sems can gyi don gyi thabs ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa mi byed do //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa la dmigs pa'i snying rje zhi la mi gnas te bdag nyid thams cad rgyun chad mar me lta bur mya ngan las 'das pa sems can gyi don gyi thabs ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa mi byed do //
translated: The compassion that focuses on all sentient beings does not abide in peace, but does not cling to the method for the benefit of sentient beings, which is nirvana like a flame.

original: bshad pa 'dis ni shes pa dang snying rje dag gi byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' nang du mi ltung bar gsungs pa yin te /🔽de yang / tshu rol pha rol mtha' ba min //
analyzed: bshad pa 'dis ni shes pa dang snying rje dag gi byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' nang du mi ltung bar gsungs pa yin te / de yang / tshu rol pha rol mtha' ba min //
translated: By this explanation, it is said that the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattvas through knowledge and compassion does not fall into the extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: And that is taught by “Not this shore, not the other shore, not even the middle.”

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag pa la sogs pa las yum thos pa la sogs pa'i shes pa med pas na /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag pa la sogs pa las yum thos pa la sogs pa'i shes pa med pas na /
translated: Since there is no knowledge of the mother that is listening to the spiritual friend and so on,

original: gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar dmigs pa'i shes pa ni thabs ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar dmigs pa'i shes pa ni thabs ma yin pa ste /
translated: the knowledge that observes form and so on is not the method.

original: des ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i yum thob pa las ring ba yin la /
analyzed: des ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i yum thob pa las ring ba yin la /
translated: By that, one is far from attaining the mother of the śrāvakas and so on.

original: 'di las go bzlog pa gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'i shes pa ni thabs yin te /
analyzed: 'di las go bzlog pa gzugs la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa'i shes pa ni thabs yin te /
translated: The opposite of this, the knowledge that does not objectify form, etc., is the means.

original: des ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yum thob pa ni ring ba ma yin no //🔽don 'di dag ni mtshan bcas dmigs sgo nas /
analyzed: des ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yum thob pa ni ring ba ma yin no // don 'di dag ni mtshan bcas dmigs sgo nas /
translated: By it, the Bodhisattvas do not go far from the attainment of the Mother.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'di ni thabs la zhes bya ba la sogs pas go rims bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'di ni thabs la zhes bya ba la sogs pas go rims bzhin du bstan to //
translated: These meanings are taught respectively by the passage beginning, “Subhuti, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who practice this deep perfection of wisdom,” and by the passage beginning, “This is the means.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni mi dmigs pa ring ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni mi dmigs pa ring ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bodhisattvas do not go far from nonapprehension.

original: rab 'byor la sogs pa la thos pa la sogs pas yum gyi rang gi ngo bo shes so //
analyzed: rab 'byor la sogs pa la thos pa la sogs pas yum gyi rang gi ngo bo shes so //
translated: Subhuti and the others know the essence of the Mother through hearing, etc.

original: rab 'byor la sogs pas de ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mthu nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor la sogs pas de ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mthu nyid kyis yin te /
translated: The teaching of that by Subhuti and the others is by the power of the Lord himself.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa dang 'dra zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa dang 'dra zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is as if they were walls, etc.

original: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa rnam par gzhom par bya ba yin pa'i ma yang dag pa'i shes pa'i gegs byed pa'i yum ni mi mthun pa ste /🔽yang dag par na gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'am de las @151a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa rnam par gzhom par bya ba yin pa'i ma yang dag pa'i shes pa'i gegs byed pa'i yum ni mi mthun pa ste / yang dag par na gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'am de las @151a * //
translated: The mother of the false view that is to be conquered on the path of seeing, etc. , is the adverse side.🔽In reality, it is the discrimination of the apprehended, etc. ,

original: byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: or the attachment, etc. , that arise from that.

original: blang bar bya ba 'am gzung ba la sogs pa 'joms par byed pa'i phyogs kyi yum ni gnyen po'i phyogs te /
analyzed: blang bar bya ba 'am gzung ba la sogs pa 'joms par byed pa'i phyogs kyi yum ni gnyen po'i phyogs te /
translated: The mother of the side that conquers the apprehended, etc. , that are to be adopted, is the side of the counteragent.

original: yang dag par na byang chub yin la de'i rgyur gyur pa yin pas 'dir lam la bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na byang chub yin la de'i rgyur gyur pa yin pas 'dir lam la bya'o //
translated: In reality, it is enlightenment, but since it is the cause of that, here it is the path.

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: These are taught by the following verses:🔽The emptiness of the aggregates of form, etc.

original: gzugs sogs phung po stong nyid dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / sbyin la sogs la ngar 'dzin med //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: gzugs sogs phung po stong nyid dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / sbyin la sogs la ngar 'dzin med // ces bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: And by the following: Without the conceit of “I” in generosity, etc.

original: rab tu sbyor bas na sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu sbyor bas na sbyor ba ste /
translated: Application is that which is applied to the object of attainment.

original: de ni gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de ni gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: It is taught by the following verses beginning with “The emptiness of the aggregates of form, etc.”

original: de'i mnyam nyid dang zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba nyid kyis mtshungs pa nyid de /🔽de ni / gzugs la sogs pa rlom pa med //
analyzed: de'i mnyam nyid dang zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba nyid kyis mtshungs pa nyid de / de ni / gzugs la sogs pa rlom pa med //
translated: Its equality is the same as that of the path of preparation.🔽It is taught by the verse:

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: He does not falsely project form, etc.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni yang dag pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i lam mo //🔽de ni / sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni yang dag pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i lam mo // de ni / sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
translated: The path of insight is the path of seeing correct transcendent knowledge.🔽It is taught by the verse:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: The truths of suffering, etc.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sngar bshad pa'i thabs ma yin pa dang thabs dag ni /🔽de 'dra kun shes nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sngar bshad pa'i thabs ma yin pa dang thabs dag ni / de 'dra kun shes nyid du 'dod //
translated: The disciples, etc. are the disciples, hermit buddhas, and bodhisattvas. The non-method and method previously explained for them

original: ces bya ba yin no //🔽kun nas dmigs par bya bas na /🔽rnam pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin no // kun nas dmigs par bya bas na / rnam pa ste /
translated: are considered to be the knowledge of all aspects.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the essence of the three knowledges.

original: sbyor bar bcas rnams dang zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor bar bcas rnams dang zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those who are endowed with the path of preparation are those who are endowed with the path of preparation.

original: de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag kyang /
translated: They are taught by the verse:

original: gzhi dang ye shes rnam pa yi //
analyzed: gzhi dang ye shes rnam pa yi //
translated: The basis and pristine wisdom are the aspects.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
translated: And because it does not dwell in form, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas go rims bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas go rims bzhin du ston to //
translated: Thus it is taught in order.

original: slob par bya ba yin pas na yon tan te /
analyzed: slob par bya ba yin pas na yon tan te /
translated: It is a virtue because it is to be cultivated,

original: sbyor ba la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: and it is in accord with the practice, etc.

original: de yang / bdud kyi mthu bcom la sogs pa //
analyzed: de yang / bdud kyi mthu bcom la sogs pa //
translated: And having conquered the power of Mara, etc.

original: zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ston to //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: sun par byed pas na skyon te bar du gcod par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: sun par byed pas na skyon te bar du gcod par byed pa rnams so //
translated: It is a fault because it is a hindrance, and it is a defect because it is a corruption.

original: mtshan nyid bcas pa shes pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ste de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bcas pa shes pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ste de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with the four characteristics such as being known, etc.

original: de'i skyon ni bcu tshan bzhir bcas pa //
analyzed: de'i skyon ni bcu tshan bzhir bcas pa //
translated: Its faults are the four groups of ten,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang gis mtshon te zhes bya ba la sogs pas go rims bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang gis mtshon te zhes bya ba la sogs pas go rims bzhin du ston to //
translated: and by what is it indicated? etc. Thus it is taught in order.

original: thar dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: thar dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Liberation is freedom from the afflictions.

original: nges @151b 'byed ni khyad par gyi ye shes mngon sum du byed pas te /
analyzed: nges @151b 'byed ni khyad par gyi ye shes mngon sum du byed pas te /
translated: The stage of penetration is so called because it makes manifest the special intuition.

original: gong nas gong du shes pa'i rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir de nyid ni cha ste /
analyzed: gong nas gong du shes pa'i rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir de nyid ni cha ste /
translated: It is a part because it is entered by the successive stages of knowledge.

original: de la phan pa'i phyir thar pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la phan pa'i phyir thar pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gnyis so //
translated: The two groups of learners and nonlearners are so called because they are conducive to liberation and conducive to penetration, respectively.

original: de yang / mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
analyzed: de yang / mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
translated: And it is taught that the learners are the bodhisattvas who have not yet attained the stages, and the nonlearners are the bodhisattvas who have attained the stages.

original: zhes bya ba dang / dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa 'dir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa 'dir //
translated: The learners are the bodhisattva saṅgha.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa go rims bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa go rims bzhin du ston to //
translated: And it is taught that they are from the stage of the factors conducive to insight up to the stage of the tenth bodhisattva level.🔽And it is taught that the nonlearners are the buddhas, the transcendent lords.🔽And it is taught that they are from the stage of the tathāgata up to the stage of the great enlightenment.

original: bslab par bya ba yod pa dang byang chub las phyir mi ldog pas na /
analyzed: bslab par bya ba yod pa dang byang chub las phyir mi ldog pas na /
translated: And it is taught that the learners are the bodhisattvas who have not yet attained the stages, and the nonlearners are the bodhisattvas who have attained the stages.🔽And it is taught that they are from the stage of the factors conducive to insight up to the stage of the tenth bodhisattva level.

original: slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: And it is taught that the nonlearners are the buddhas, the transcendent lords.🔽And it is taught that they are from the stage of the tathāgata up to the stage of the great enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba ni slob pa byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni slob pa byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun no //

analyzed: rgyal ba'i yum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas mi dmigs pas mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyis lam byang chub sems dpa' rang nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: The generosity of the perfection of wisdom is the generosity of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The generosity

original: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of that.

original: gdul bya rnams kyang de dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa ni gzhan gyi don yin no //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyang de dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa ni gzhan gyi don yin no //
translated: And establishing disciples in nirvana, etc. is the benefit for others.

original: de yang bsdus pa dang rgyas pa dag gi mdo bzhin du bstan pa gang yin pa de bsdus pa dang rgyas pa dag gis de bzhin du gsungs pa yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de yang bsdus pa dang rgyas pa dag gi mdo bzhin du bstan pa gang yin pa de bsdus pa dang rgyas pa dag gis de bzhin du gsungs pa yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: And that is taught in the brief and extensive versions, just as it is stated in the brief and extensive versions, not otherwise.

original: 'dis ni sems bskyed pa bshad pa'i gnas skabs yin pas mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi bstan bcos mdo dang mi mthun pa bstsal bar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sems bskyed pa bshad pa'i gnas skabs yin pas mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi bstan bcos mdo dang mi mthun pa bstsal bar byas pa yin te /
translated: This explains the stage of generating the Thought, and it removes the objection that the treatise Ornament of Realization is not in accord with the scriptures.

original: mdo sde rnams dang rgyal ba'i yum tshig gcig pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: mdo sde rnams dang rgyal ba'i yum tshig gcig pa nyid du ston te /
translated: It shows that the scriptures and the Mother of the Conquerors are of the same meaning.

original: tshul gcig dang 'gal ba'am mdo dang mi mthun pa'i don la rtogs pa dang ldan pa su yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul gcig dang 'gal ba'am mdo dang mi mthun pa'i don la rtogs pa dang ldan pa su yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: No one with understanding would enter into a meaning that is of a different method or that is in contradiction with the scriptures.

original: sngar sems bskyed pa mdor bsdus te gsungs pa'i khyad par gyi rab tu dbye ba rgya cher bstan pa'i gnas skabs kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: sngar sems bskyed pa mdor bsdus te gsungs pa'i khyad par gyi rab tu dbye ba rgya cher bstan pa'i gnas skabs kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: The verses in the middle are so called because they are included in the section that teaches the extensive classification of the distinctions taught in the brief generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: 'dun pa dang bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa ni gzhan gyi don mngon par 'dod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa ni gzhan gyi don mngon par 'dod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
translated: Aspiration, intention, and superior intention are the lesser, middling, and greater aspirations for the benefit of others.

original: sbyor ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la lus la sogs pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la lus la sogs pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: Application is the activity of body, etc. in generosity, etc.

original: sbyin pa ni slong ba rnams la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu ster ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni slong ba rnams la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu ster ba'o //
translated: Generosity is the bestowal of gifts to petitioners in accordance with their wishes.

original: tshul khrims ni legs par spyod pa'i las rnams so //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni legs par spyod pa'i las rnams so //
translated: Morality is the activities of body and speech that are well-behaved.

original: bzod pa ni gzhan gyi gnod pa shes pa rnag nus pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa ni gzhan gyi gnod pa shes pa rnag nus pa'o //
translated: Patience is the ability to endure the harm of others.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i las rnams la spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i las rnams la spro ba'o //
translated: Exertion is the enthusiasm for virtuous activities.

original: bsam gtan ni sems rtse cig pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni sems rtse cig pa'o //
translated: Meditation is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: shes rab ni thos pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni thos pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the knowledge of hearing, etc.

original: thams mkhas pa ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi thabs la sems ma zhum pa la sogs pa la bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: thams mkhas pa ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi thabs la sems ma zhum pa la sogs pa la bya ba nyid do //
translated: Skill is the non-discouragement of mind in the very means of attaining enlightenment.

original: smon lam ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: smon lam ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Vow is as above.

original: stobs @155b ni 'di nyid la bstan pas go bgos pa'o //
analyzed: stobs @155b ni 'di nyid la bstan pas go bgos pa'o //
translated: Power is the donning of armor in this very life.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de la blo phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de la blo phul du byung ba'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the excellence of mind in that.

original: mngon par shes pa ni kun shes pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni kun shes pa ste /
translated: Higher knowledge is omniscience.

original: lha'i mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the divine eye, etc.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes ni 'og nas bshad pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes rnams so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes ni 'og nas bshad pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes rnams so //
translated: Merit and knowledge are the merits and knowledges explained below.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ni 'og nas bshad pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ni 'og nas bshad pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The factors of enlightenment are the applications of mindfulness, etc., explained below.

original: snying rje ni sems can gdon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni sems can gdon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the form of desire to rescue sentient beings.

original: lhag mthong ni shes rab po //
analyzed: lhag mthong ni shes rab po //
translated: Insight is wisdom.

original: gzungs dang spobs pa ni don la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa ni don la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Retention and eloquence are the knowledge of retention of meaning, etc.

original: chos kyi skyed mos tshal ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos nye bar 'byin pa'am mdor bsdus nas rab tu ster ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi skyed mos tshal ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos nye bar 'byin pa'am mdor bsdus nas rab tu ster ba'o //
translated: The garden of Dharma is the Dharma that is the nature of scripture and realization, which is either produced or bestowed in brief.

original: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas gcig tu 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas gcig tu 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of single progress is the path of single progress because of the attainment of acquiescence in the nonarising of things.

original: chos kyi sku ni ye shes kyi sku ste 'di rnams dang ldan zhing de dang 'brel pa'i sems bskyed pa ni sa la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni ye shes kyi sku ste 'di rnams dang ldan zhing de dang 'brel pa'i sems bskyed pa ni sa la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The body of Dharma is the body of intuition. The generation of the spirit of enlightenment endowed with these and connected with them is like the earth, etc.

original: de ni go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The verse states, “It is like the earth, gold, medicine, the wish-granting gem, the sun, the moon, a treasure, a song, a king, and a cloud.”

original: 'tshang rgya ba nyid la sogs pa'i dge ba'i lam ston pas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen te bla ma'o //🔽sems can rnams la bsam pa ci lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu rab tu ster bas /
analyzed: 'tshang rgya ba nyid la sogs pa'i dge ba'i lam ston pas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen te bla ma'o // sems can rnams la bsam pa ci lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu rab tu ster bas /
translated: The spiritual friend is the guru who reveals the path of virtue, such as the attainment of Buddhahood, etc.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu'o //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu'o //
translated: The wish-granting gem is the spirit of enlightenment, which bestows the fruit in accordance with the wishes of sentient beings.

original: rtag pa dang bdag la sogs par rmongs pa'i skye bos mnyan par bya ba'i don tshar bcad pas mkhas pas mnyan par bya ba'i bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa'i don kho na nyid yang dag par dus ji lta ba bzhin du kun nas ston pa'i bdag nyid
analyzed: rtag pa dang bdag la sogs par rmongs pa'i skye bos mnyan par bya ba'i don tshar bcad pas mkhas pas mnyan par bya ba'i bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa'i don kho na nyid yang dag par dus ji lta ba bzhin du kun nas ston pa'i bdag nyid
translated: The meaning of the words to be heard by the wise is the meaning of selflessness and so on, which is taught in a way that is completely in accord with reality and in a timely way.🔽

original: can gyi sgra ni chos kyi sgra dbyangs snyan pa ste /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa'o //
analyzed: can gyi sgra ni chos kyi sgra dbyangs snyan pa ste / bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa'o //
translated: The sound of Dharma is the sweet sound of Dharma, which is the nature of the teaching of the reality of selflessness and so on, which is to be heard by the wise, by destroying the meaning to be heard by the ignorant who are confused about permanence, self and so on.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i bgegs tshar bcad pas /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i bgegs tshar bcad pas /
translated: The sweet sound is the sound of the gods who have faith in the Bhagavān when he attains manifest perfect buddhahood, proclaiming the sound of “Victory! Victory!” and so on, by destroying the obstacles of Indra and so on.🔽The sound of the Dharma is the sweet sound of Dharma, which is the nature of the teaching of the reality of selflessness and so on, which is to be heard by the wise, by destroying the meaning to be heard by the ignorant who are confused about permanence, self and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na de la mngon par dad pa'i lha rnams rgyal bar gyur cig / rgyal bar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra kun nas sgrogs pa ni sgra snyan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na de la mngon par dad pa'i lha rnams rgyal bar gyur cig / rgyal bar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra kun nas sgrogs pa ni sgra snyan pa'o //
translated: The sweet sound is the sound of the gods who have faith in the Bhagavān when he attains manifest perfect buddhahood, proclaiming the sound of “Victory! Victory!” and so on, by destroying the obstacles of Indra and so on.

original: dpe dang dpes brjod pa'i dngos po nges par spyad pas sa la sogs pa'i don gyis bya ba mnyam pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: dpe dang dpes brjod pa'i dngos po nges par spyad pas sa la sogs pa'i don gyis bya ba mnyam pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: The sound of the Dharma is the sweet sound of Dharma, which is the nature of the teaching of the reality of selflessness and so on, which is to be heard by the wise, by destroying the meaning to be heard by the ignorant who are confused about permanence, self and so on.

original: chos dkar po thams @156a * //
analyzed: chos dkar po thams @156a * //
translated: All virtuous qualities

original: cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: and so on are mentioned.

original: chos dkar po thams cad ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos dkar po thams cad ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All virtuous qualities are nonattachment and so on.

original: de'i gzhi ni gnas so //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni gnas so //
translated: Their basis is the abode.

original: de'i dngos po ni ma chags pa la sogs pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni ma chags pa la sogs pa yod pa'o //
translated: Their entity is the existence of nonattachment and so on.

original: byang chub kyi bar du mi 'gyur ba ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi bar du gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du mi 'gyur ba ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi bar du gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Up to enlightenment is up to buddhahood, without changing to something else.

original: dge ba'i chos mtha' dag ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos mtha' dag ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All virtuous qualities are nonattachment and so on.

original: de'i rnam par 'phel ba ni gong nas gong du 'phel ba'i rim gyis lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par 'phel ba ni gong nas gong du 'phel ba'i rim gyis lhag pa'o //
translated: Their increase is their superiority through the process of increasing more and more.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis sgrib pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis sgrib pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The obscurations to the three omnisciences are the afflictions that are incompatible with them.

original: de nyid bud shing yin te de sreg pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bud shing yin te de sreg pa'o //
translated: That itself is the fuel, which is burned.

original: sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa ni gdul bya rnams la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos dang zang zing rab tu sbyin pas tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa ni gdul bya rnams la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos dang zang zing rab tu sbyin pas tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: Satisfying all sentient beings means satisfying disciples by giving them the Dharma and material goods according to their aspirations.

original: lus la sogs pa dga' ba skyed pa nyid kyis na bslab par bya ba yin pa'i phyir yon tan rin po che ste stobs bcu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dga' ba skyed pa nyid kyis na bslab par bya ba yin pa'i phyir yon tan rin po che ste stobs bcu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The jewel of good qualities refers to the ten powers and so on, because they are to be trained in, since they generate delight in the body and so on.

original: de rnams kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i rten gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i rten gyi dngos po'o //
translated: They are the basis of that, because they are the cause of those.

original: mi 'dod pa thams cad mi bzod par dka' ba'i ral gri dang / mda' dang / lcags mdung dang / mdung thung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa thams cad mi bzod par dka' ba'i ral gri dang / mda' dang / lcags mdung dang / mdung thung la sogs pa'o //
translated: All undesirable things are the sword, arrow, spear, and javelin of what is difficult to bear.

original: de'i thog tu bab pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa'i thad du bab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thog tu bab pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa'i thad du bab pa'o //
translated: They descend upon him means they descend upon the Lord who is seated at the site of awakening.

original: des mi 'khrugs pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin las ma g-yos pa'o //
analyzed: des mi 'khrugs pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin las ma g-yos pa'o //
translated: He is unperturbed by them means he does not waver from the vajra-like concentration.

original: sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi rjes thogs la yang dag par nges pa ni yid ches pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi rjes thogs la yang dag par nges pa ni yid ches pa ste /
translated: Immediately after his enlightenment, he is fully convinced, that is, he has confidence.

original: des mi 'jigs pa bzhi brnyes pa na brtan pa ste mi tshugs pa'o //
analyzed: des mi 'jigs pa bzhi brnyes pa na brtan pa ste mi tshugs pa'o //
translated: When he attains the four forms of fearlessness, he is firm, i.e., unassailable.

original: des mi phyed pa ni skul bar byed pa dang bdud rnams kyis dbye bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: des mi phyed pa ni skul bar byed pa dang bdud rnams kyis dbye bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: When he attains the unattractability, he is unperturbed, i.e., unperturbed by the demons.

original: dmigs pa ni 'dod pa'i lhas btang ba'i rang gi bu mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni 'dod pa'i lhas btang ba'i rang gi bu mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object is his own daughter, etc., given to him by the desire realm gods.

original: gang de rnams kyi rnam par g-yeng ba ni mig zur gyis lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang de rnams kyi rnam par g-yeng ba ni mig zur gyis lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The distraction of those is the sidelong glances, etc.

original: des mi bskyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin las ma g-yos pa'o //
analyzed: des mi bskyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin las ma g-yos pa'o //
translated: When he attains the unshakability, he is unshaken, i.e., unshaken from his samadhi.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ni sangs rgyas nyid mthong ba'i nad med pa'i mi mthun pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa bzung ba rnams ni sgrib pa yin @156b pas
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ni sangs rgyas nyid mthong ba'i nad med pa'i mi mthun pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa bzung ba rnams ni sgrib pa yin @156b pas
translated: The obscurations of moral defilement and of the knowable are like walls, etc., because they are adverse to the vision of Buddhahood. Attachment, etc. and form, etc. are obscurations because they are apprehended.

original: na sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: na sgrib pa'o //
translated: Thus, they are obscurations.

original: de nyid ni 'khor ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud par 'tshe bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nad do //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'khor ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud par 'tshe bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nad do //
translated: Since they afflict one in the continuity of cyclic existence, they are diseases.

original: de rnams rab tu zhi ba ni rnam par zhi ba'o //🔽gnas skabs thams cad du lha mo sgyu 'phrul la sogs pa'i lhums nas nur nur po la sogs pa med par gzhal yas khang na rdo rje skyil krung gis bzhugs pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su der sems can te /
analyzed: de rnams rab tu zhi ba ni rnam par zhi ba'o // gnas skabs thams cad du lha mo sgyu 'phrul la sogs pa'i lhums nas nur nur po la sogs pa med par gzhal yas khang na rdo rje skyil krung gis bzhugs pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su der sems can te /
translated: Their complete pacification is complete peace.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i don du chos ston pa la sogs pa ste de yongs su mi gtong ba'o //🔽ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu grub pa ni 'tshang rgya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i don du chos ston pa la sogs pa ste de yongs su mi gtong ba'o // ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu grub pa ni 'tshang rgya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba rdzogs pa'o //
translated: In all situations, without the stages of embryo and so on in the womb of Maya and so on, abiding in the celestial mansion in the vajra posture and so on, in those situations, for the sake of sentient beings, such as Indra and so on, not abandoning the teaching of the Dharma and so on.🔽The accomplishment of the result as wished for is the completion of the practice of enlightenment and so on.

original: gdul bya ste nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa smin par byed pa ni yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya ste nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa smin par byed pa ni yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: Ripening those to be tamed, such as sravakas and so on, in nirvana is complete ripening.

original: gdul bya 'dun par byed pa'i chos ston pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan pas gdul bya rnams shin tu phul du byung ba dang bcas pa la 'jug pa'o //
