analyzed: gdul bya 'dun par byed pa'i chos ston pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan pas gdul bya rnams shin tu phul du byung ba dang bcas pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Teaching the Dharma to inspire those to be tamed is engaging those to be tamed in the extremely sublime through teaching the Dharma in accordance with their thoughts.

original: mthu thogs pa med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la zil gyis mi gnon pa'i nus pa mnga' ba nyid kyis gzhan gyi don nyams su bzhes shing sems can gyi don rtsom pa'i bskal pa du mar spyad pa'i gtong ba dang / shin tu gtong ba dang /
analyzed: mthu thogs pa med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la zil gyis mi gnon pa'i nus pa mnga' ba nyid kyis gzhan gyi don nyams su bzhes shing sems can gyi don rtsom pa'i bskal pa du mar spyad pa'i gtong ba dang / shin tu gtong ba dang /
translated: The phrase because of his unimpeded power means that he is able to accomplish the benefit of others and to engage in the activities that benefit sentient beings for many eons, because he possesses the power that cannot be overwhelmed.

original: gtong ba chen po la sogs pa dang / bzo'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs pa la bslab pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes yin te /
analyzed: gtong ba chen po la sogs pa dang / bzo'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs pa la bslab pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes yin te /
translated: By means of the power of unobstructed might, he takes up the benefit of others by means of the power of non-subjugation, and the accumulations of giving, very giving, great giving, etc. for many eons of the composition of the benefit of sentient beings, and the training in the various arts is the merit and knowledge.

original: de nyid kyang byang chub kyi rgyu nyid du yang dag par bsags pa yin pas na tshogs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyang byang chub kyi rgyu nyid du yang dag par bsags pa yin pas na tshogs so //
translated: Since that is also the perfect accumulation of the cause of enlightenment, it is the accumulation.

original: de rnams kyi mdzod lta bu ni rdzas gzhag pa'i khyim mo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mdzod lta bu ni rdzas gzhag pa'i khyim mo //
translated: The treasury of those is the house of the establishment of the substance.

original: 'phags pa thams cad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad de /
translated: The noble ones are all🔽the bodhisattvas, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa ni yang dang yang du mngon sum du mdzad cing rtogs sla bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa ni yang dang yang du mngon sum du mdzad cing rtogs sla bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The going and the subsequent going is the repeated manifestation and the easy realization.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag ste /
translated: Samsara and nirvana are the two.

original: srid pa dang zhi ba gang yang rung ba cig tu mi ltung zhing mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang zhi ba gang yang rung ba cig tu mi ltung zhing mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: One does not fall into or go to either existence or quiescence.

original: nyon mongs pa med par byang chub thob par byed pas bde blag tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par byang chub thob par byed pas bde blag tu 'gro'o //
translated: One goes easily, because one attains enlightenment without affliction.

original: thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos mi zad pa 'dzin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos skye ba thams cad du dga' ba nyid kyis 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin zhing mi zad pa la🔽nyams @157a * //
analyzed: thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos mi zad pa 'dzin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos skye ba thams cad du dga' ba nyid kyis 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin zhing mi zad pa la nyams @157a * //
translated: The retention of the inexhaustible Dharma, both that heard and not heard, is the retention of all the teachings that are heard and not heard, because of the delight in all the teachings that are heard and not heard, such as the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inexhaustible because it is not lost.

original: thar pa 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa byang chub mngon par 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la sbyin pa la sogs pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa byang chub mngon par 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la sbyin pa la sogs pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of generosity, etc. for beings who aspire to enlightenment, who desire liberation, etc.

original: gzhan gyi don ces bya ba la sogs pa la mnyam pa nyid kyis thams cad las mchog tu gyur pa'i nges par legs pa dang mngon par mtho ba zhes bya ba byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ces bya ba la sogs pa la mnyam pa nyid kyis thams cad las mchog tu gyur pa'i nges par legs pa dang mngon par mtho ba zhes bya ba byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the highest, because it is the highest of all, through equality. It is the highest good and the highest mundane success, because it is the activity of the highest good and the highest mundane success.

original: dga' ldan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa sprul pa lhun gyis grub pa dga' ldan la sogs pa'i lha rnams la chos sgrogs pa la sogs pa'i don yang dag par ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa sprul pa lhun gyis grub pa dga' ldan la sogs pa'i lha rnams la chos sgrogs pa la sogs pa'i don yang dag par ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “in the Tuṣita heaven” and so on is that the spontaneous emanations in the Tuṣita heaven and so on teach the Dharma to the gods there.

original: de dag dang 'tsham zhing rung ba nyid kyis na 'dun pa la sogs pa ni sa la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba nus pa nyid kyis grangs bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag dang 'tsham zhing rung ba nyid kyis na 'dun pa la sogs pa ni sa la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba nus pa nyid kyis grangs bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “in accordance with their number” is that the ten perfections of generosity and so on are in accordance with the number of the ten stages and so on, because they are able to perform the functions of the stages and so on.

original: da ni sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis byang chub pa'i bar du khyab pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis byang chub pa'i bar du khyab pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Now, in order to show the pervasion up to the twenty-second generation of the thought of enlightenment, he says, “Thus, in the three incalculable eons,” and so on.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du shes pa gang gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur bya ba la sogs pa'i las kun tu spyod pa'i shes pa de ni las dang po ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du shes pa gang gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur bya ba la sogs pa'i las kun tu spyod pa'i shes pa de ni las dang po ba'i sa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the three incalculable eons is the knowledge of the activities of serving the spiritual friends and the buddhas and so on. That is the stage of the beginner.

original: des bsdus pa ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis dang po gsum ste /
analyzed: des bsdus pa ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis dang po gsum ste /
translated: The first three are included in the small, medium, and great stages.

original: 'dun pa dang bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam par rtogs pa'i sems bskyed pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam par rtogs pa'i sems bskyed pa rnams so //
translated: They are the generation of the Thought of enlightenment which is the will, the intention, and the superior intention.

original: 'dis ni dus de'i tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa brtan pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci yod pa de thams cad zhing sa bzang po la btab pa'i sa bon gyi myu gu dang 'dra bar gnas par gyur pa dang / gser bzang po dang 'dra bar zad pa med pa dang //
analyzed: 'dis ni dus de'i tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa brtan pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci yod pa de thams cad zhing sa bzang po la btab pa'i sa bon gyi myu gu dang 'dra bar gnas par gyur pa dang / gser bzang po dang 'dra bar zad pa med pa dang //
translated: This explains that at that time, whatever roots of virtue there are, they all become like the sprouts of seeds planted in a good field, and they become like good gold, inexhaustible,

original: tshes gcig gi zla ba dang 'dra bar 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshes gcig gi zla ba dang 'dra bar 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: and like the moon of the first day, they increase.

original: de'i 'og tu gcig ni zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gcig ni zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: After that, the one is the generation of the Thought of enlightenment which is endowed with application.

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba de la 'jug pa'i lam gyis bsdus so zhes bya ba sems gang gis 'jug pa des bsdus pa ste //
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba de la 'jug pa'i lam gyis bsdus so zhes bya ba sems gang gis 'jug pa des bsdus pa ste //
translated: It is included in the path of entry to the first stage called Very Joyful.

original: sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i sems 'dis gang gi tshe thams cad mkhyen pa gsum nyid kyi sgrib pa rnams mes shing bsregs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe sa dang po rab tu @157b dga' ba la sogs par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so
analyzed: sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i sems 'dis gang gi tshe thams cad mkhyen pa gsum nyid kyi sgrib pa rnams mes shing bsregs pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe sa dang po rab tu @157b dga' ba la sogs par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so
translated: This mind possessing the preparations, when the obscurations to the three omnisciences are burned up like fire, at that time it enters the first stage, the Joyous and so on.

original: // de'i 'og tu sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa bcu ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi spyod yul can yin te /
analyzed: // de'i 'og tu sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa bcu ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi spyod yul can yin te /
translated: After that, the ten generated minds possessing generosity and so on are the domain of the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: go rims bzhin du rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
translated: In order, they are the Joyous, the Stainless, the Radiant, the Brilliant, the Difficult to Purify, the Manifested, the Gone Afar, the Immovable, the Excellent Wisdom, and the Cloud of Dharma.

original: chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba'i sa bcus bsdus pa rnams ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i sems bskyed pa phul du byung bas na /🔽rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba'i sa bcus bsdus pa rnams ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i sems bskyed pa phul du byung bas na / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.🔽The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.🔽The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.🔽The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.

original: 'dis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems phul du byung ba las sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nges par go rims bzhin tu gter chen po dang 'dra bar sems can rnams tshim par byed pa
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems phul du byung ba las sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nges par go rims bzhin tu gter chen po dang 'dra bar sems can rnams tshim par byed pa
translated: The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.🔽The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.🔽The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.🔽The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.🔽The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.🔽The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.🔽The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.

original: dang / rin po che'i 'byung khung gi gnas dang 'dra bar yon tan rin po che'i rten yin pa dang / rgya mtsho chen po dang 'dra bar mi 'dod pas mi 'khrug pa dang / rdo rje dang 'dra bar gang gis kyang mi shigs pa dang /
analyzed: dang / rin po che'i 'byung khung gi gnas dang 'dra bar yon tan rin po che'i rten yin pa dang / rgya mtsho chen po dang 'dra bar mi 'dod pas mi 'khrug pa dang / rdo rje dang 'dra bar gang gis kyang mi shigs pa dang /
translated: The ten transcendent perfections are the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, strength, aspiration and primordial wisdom.

original: ri'i rgyal po dang 'dra bar gang gis kyang bskyod par mi nus pa dang / sman chen po dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'dra bar sems can gyi don mi 'dor ba dang /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po dang 'dra bar gang gis kyang bskyod par mi nus pa dang / sman chen po dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'dra bar sems can gyi don mi 'dor ba dang /
translated: Like a spiritual friend, it never abandons the welfare of sentient beings.🔽Like a wish-fulfilling gem, it accomplishes the result of aspiration.🔽Like the sun, it ripens those to be trained.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar smon lam gyi 'bras bu 'grub pa dang / nyi ma dang 'dra bar gdul bya yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das dang 'dra bar bdag med pa la sogs pa'i chos kun nas ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar smon lam gyi 'bras bu 'grub pa dang / nyi ma dang 'dra bar gdul bya yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das dang 'dra bar bdag med pa la sogs pa'i chos kun nas ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: Like the Bhagavat, it completely reveals the Dharma of selflessness and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu gang gis snga ma las khyad par du gyur pa'i shes pas bar chad med pa'i lam la 'jug pa de ni khyad par gyi lam ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gang gis snga ma las khyad par du gyur pa'i shes pas bar chad med pa'i lam la 'jug pa de ni khyad par gyi lam ste /
translated: Subsequently, the path of entry to the uninterrupted path by means of knowledge that is superior to the former is the path of distinctive feature.

original: des bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: des bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is subsumed by that.

original: lnga ni zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dang / snying rje dang / lhag mthong dang / gzungs dang / spobs pa dang ldan @158a * //
analyzed: lnga ni zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dang / snying rje dang / lhag mthong dang / gzungs dang / spobs pa dang ldan @158a * //
translated: The five are: the superknowledges, merit, wisdom, the factors conducive to enlightenment, compassion, insight, retention, and eloquence.🔽

original: pa'i sems bskyed pa rnams so //
analyzed: pa'i sems bskyed pa rnams so //
translated: The five are the generation of the thought endowed with superknowledge, merit, intuition, the factors of enlightenment, compassion, insight, retention, and eloquence.

original: de dang sbyor ba'i stobs kyis go rims bzhin du rgyal po chen po dang 'dra bar gzhan gyi don la rjes su gnas pa dang / bang mdzod dang 'dra bar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rten du gyur pa dang / lam po che dang 'dra bar 'phags pa thams cad kyis bgrod sla bar mdzad pa'i lam rab tu thob pa dang /
analyzed: de dang sbyor ba'i stobs kyis go rims bzhin du rgyal po chen po dang 'dra bar gzhan gyi don la rjes su gnas pa dang / bang mdzod dang 'dra bar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rten du gyur pa dang / lam po che dang 'dra bar 'phags pa thams cad kyis bgrod sla bar mdzad pa'i lam rab tu thob pa dang /
translated: By the power of their application, they are like a great king, since they are engaged in the welfare of others; like a treasury, since they are the basis of merit and intuition; like a highway, since they are the path traversed by all the noble ones;

original: bzhon pa bzang po dang 'dra bar rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar mi ltung ba dang / bkod ma'i chu dang 'dra bar gdul bya rnams kyis 'bras bu thob par byed pa la zad pa med do //
analyzed: bzhon pa bzang po dang 'dra bar rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar mi ltung ba dang / bkod ma'i chu dang 'dra bar gdul bya rnams kyis 'bras bu thob par byed pa la zad pa med do //
translated: Like the water of a spring, it is inexhaustible in producing the results of disciples.

original: des na sangs rgyas kho na'i yul yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis bcu gcig pa des bsdus pa ni chos kyi skyed mos tshal dang / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang / chos kyi sku dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas kho na'i yul yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis bcu gcig pa des bsdus pa ni chos kyi skyed mos tshal dang / bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang / chos kyi sku dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Therefore, since it is the domain of buddhas alone, the eleventh is subsumed by the buddhas, who possess the Dharma garden, the path of single progress and the Dharma body.

original: gsum gyis bsdus pa ni sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang mjug nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: gsum gyis bsdus pa ni sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang mjug nyid kyis yin te /
translated: Subsumed by the three, it is the preparation, the actual basis and the conclusion.

original: sems gang gis dang po las la mngon par sbyor ba de ni sbyor ba'i sems so //
analyzed: sems gang gis dang po las la mngon par sbyor ba de ni sbyor ba'i sems so //
translated: The mind that first engages in action is the preparatory mind.

original: gang gis las rdzogs par byed pa de ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: gang gis las rdzogs par byed pa de ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: That which completes the action is the actual basis.

original: las rdzogs par byas pa la sems gang gis legs par byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba de ni mjug ste /
analyzed: las rdzogs par byas pa la sems gang gis legs par byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba de ni mjug ste /
translated: The mind that, having completed the action, says, I have done well and so on, is the conclusion.

original: de yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists.

original: de la yang go rims bzhin du sgra snyan pa dang 'dra ba thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos rnams snying la 'bab par sgrogs pa dang / chu bo'i rgyun dang 'dra bar sems can gyi don mnyam pa nyid kyis byed pa dang / sprin lta bur dga' ldan la sogs par sprul pas don ston par mdzad pa yin no //🔽yongs su sbyong ba rnam bcu yis //
analyzed: de la yang go rims bzhin du sgra snyan pa dang 'dra ba thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos rnams snying la 'bab par sgrogs pa dang / chu bo'i rgyun dang 'dra bar sems can gyi don mnyam pa nyid kyis byed pa dang / sprin lta bur dga' ldan la sogs par sprul pas don ston par mdzad pa yin no // yongs su sbyong ba rnam bcu yis //
translated: In this regard, it is like a pleasant sound, because it proclaims the Dharma, which is pleasant to the mind, whether or not it is heard; it is like a river, because it acts for the benefit of beings in an uninterrupted stream; and it is like a cloud, because it manifests emanations in Tuṣita and elsewhere in order to benefit beings.

original: sa ni dang po thob 'gyur te //
analyzed: sa ni dang po thob 'gyur te //
translated: The first stage is attained through ten thorough preparations.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa ni rgyu du ma zhig gis bsgrubs pas 'og nas 'chad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa ni rgyu du ma zhig gis bsgrubs pas 'og nas 'chad pa ma yin nam /
translated: The stages of joy and so on are established by many causes, as will be explained below.

original: de ji ltar kun la sems bskyed pas khyab pa yin zhe na 'gal ba med de gang gi phyir 'tshang rgya ba nyid du sems bskyed pa kho na'i rgyu'i gtso bo nyid yin par bshad kyi 'bras bu gang la yang rgyu cig yod par ma mthong ste //
analyzed: de ji ltar kun la sems bskyed pas khyab pa yin zhe na 'gal ba med de gang gi phyir 'tshang rgya ba nyid du sems bskyed pa kho na'i rgyu'i gtso bo nyid yin par bshad kyi 'bras bu gang la yang rgyu cig yod par ma mthong ste //
translated: How does the generation of the Thought pervade all? There is no contradiction, because it is explained that the generation of the Thought for the sake of Buddhahood is the principal cause, but no cause is seen for any effect whatsoever.

original: rgyu gzhan ngag kyang bshad pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan ngag kyang bshad pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in explaining other causes.🔽In the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras,

original: mdo sde rgyan las /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan las /
translated: it is explained:

original: sems @158b bskyed pa ni sa rnams la /
analyzed: sems @158b bskyed pa ni sa rnams la /
translated: The generation of the Thought is on the stages,🔽with interest, pure superior intention,

original: mos dang lhag bsam dag pa dang // rnam par smin pa gzhan du 'dod //
analyzed: mos dang lhag bsam dag pa dang // rnam par smin pa gzhan du 'dod //
translated: and a different full ripening,

original: de bzhin sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: and likewise, the relinquishment of obstructions.

original: de yi rtsa ba snying rjer 'dod //
analyzed: de yi rtsa ba snying rjer 'dod //
translated: Its root is considered to be compassion,

original: rtag tu sems can phan par sems //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can phan par sems //
translated: and it is always the thought to benefit sentient beings.

original: zhes bshad pas so so'i skye bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i dbye bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can gyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bshad pas so so'i skye bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i dbye bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can gyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa yin la /
translated: Thus, it is explained that the generation of the Thought is taught to have a division of cause and effect by way of the division of the stages of ordinary beings, Bodhisattvas, and Tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin du don rtogs pa'i rim pas ji skad bshad pa'i go rims kyis byang chub kyi sems bstan pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du don rtogs pa'i rim pas ji skad bshad pa'i go rims kyis byang chub kyi sems bstan pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, the stages of understanding the meaning are taught in the order explained, and the thought of enlightenment is taught.

original: 'di tsam kho nas byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba ma tshang ba ma yin zhing lhag pa ma yin par go rims bzhin du bstan par bya'o zhes ston to //🔽smon lam sngon du 'gro ba'i nyams su len par 'dod pa ni de'i yul mi shes pa las 'bras bu med pa kho nar 'gyur bas thun mong ma yin pa'i bslab pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas 'chad par bzhed pa de'i dgos pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba
analyzed: 'di tsam kho nas byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba ma tshang ba ma yin zhing lhag pa ma yin par go rims bzhin du bstan par bya'o zhes ston to // smon lam sngon du 'gro ba'i nyams su len par 'dod pa ni de'i yul mi shes pa las 'bras bu med pa kho nar 'gyur bas thun mong ma yin pa'i bslab pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas 'chad par bzhed pa de'i dgos pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the divisions of the thought of enlightenment are not incomplete and not excessive in just this much, and they are taught in the proper order.

original: la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The one who wishes to practice with a prior aspiration does not know the object of that, and it would be absolutely fruitless. Therefore, the purpose of the author of the verses of the uncommon precepts is stated in the words “thus” and so on.

original: dus ci lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'tsham pa nyid kyi dus las ma 'das pas so //
analyzed: dus ci lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'tsham pa nyid kyi dus las ma 'das pas so //
translated: “In a timely manner” means that it is not beyond the proper time.

original: don du gnyer bar byed pa ni gdams ngag don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer bar byed pa ni gdams ngag don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: “One who seeks” is one who seeks instruction.

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa ni sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa ni sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The generation of the Thought of Enlightenment has been explained above.

original: des phongs pa'i chos ni chos dkar po thams cad kyi gzhi'i dngos po la sogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des phongs pa'i chos ni chos dkar po thams cad kyi gzhi'i dngos po la sogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma of the poor is the basis, etc. for the completion of all the bright things.

original: yon tan thob pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa las sems bskyed pas gzhan la skyabs su mi 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan thob pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa las sems bskyed pas gzhan la skyabs su mi 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the good qualities is the generation of the Thought from the spiritual friend, etc. and not going to another for refuge, etc.

original: de rnams yongs su bsrung ba'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni yongs su skyong ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de rnams yongs su bsrung ba'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni yongs su skyong ba'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning of their protection is the meaning of their guarding.🔽The meaning of their increase is the meaning of their accomplishment, etc.🔽The meaning of their non-loss is the meaning of their non-abandonment.🔽The meaning of their non-regression is the meaning of their non-retrogression.🔽The meaning of their non-confusion is the meaning of their non-confusion.

original: mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa 'di dag nyid gong nas gong du 'phel ba'i rim gyis lhag par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pa'i don gsungs pa yin
analyzed: mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa 'di dag nyid gong nas gong du 'phel ba'i rim gyis lhag par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pa'i don gsungs pa yin
translated: The meaning of their non-forgetfulness is the meaning of their non-forgetfulness.🔽The meaning of their non-loss is the meaning of their non-loss.🔽The meaning of their non-regression is the meaning of their non-regression.🔽The meaning of their non-confusion is the meaning of their non-confusion.🔽The meaning of their non-forgetfulness is the meaning of their non-forgetfulness.🔽The meaning of their non-loss is the meaning of their non-loss.🔽The meaning of their non-regression is the meaning of their non-regression.🔽The meaning of their non-confusion is the meaning of their non-confusion.🔽The meaning of their non-forgetfulness is the meaning of their non-forgetfulness.🔽The meaning of their non-loss is the meaning of their non-loss.🔽The meaning of their non-regression is the meaning of their non-regression.🔽The meaning of their non-confusion is the meaning of their non-confusion.🔽The meaning of their non-forgetfulness is the meaning of their non-forgetfulness.🔽The meaning of their non-loss is the meaning of their non-loss.🔽The meaning of their non-regression is the meaning of their non-regression.🔽The meaning of their non-confusion is the meaning of their non-confusion.🔽The meaning of their non-forgetfulness is the meaning of their non-forgetfulness.🔽The meaning of their non-loss is the meaning of their non-loss.🔽The meaning of their non-regression is the meaning of their non-regression.🔽The meaning of their non-confusion is the meaning of their non-confusion.🔽The meaning of their non-forgetfulness is the meaning of their non-forget

original: te / byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba ji skad bshad pa ni byang chub kyi sems nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi'o //
analyzed: te / byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba ji skad bshad pa ni byang chub kyi sems nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi'o //
translated: The divisions of the Thought of Enlightenment as explained are those of the twenty-two kinds of Thought of Enlightenment.

original: sgrub pa ni nyams su len pa'o /🔽mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag la @159a * //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni nyams su len pa'o / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag la @159a * //
translated: Practice is the taking up of the practice.

original: bdag med pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: In the manner of non-apprehension means in the manner of the selflessness of the person and of the dharmas, and is not common to the Sravakas, etc.

original: kun rdzob ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du mi slu ba la sogs pa'i dngos po phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du mi slu ba la sogs pa'i dngos po phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The conventional is the aggregates, etc., which are things that are not deceptive in the mundane convention when not examined, and are pleasing when not examined.

original: don dam pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yum ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yum ste /
translated: The ultimate is the Mother of the Perfect Buddhas,

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phung po la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phung po la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: and the knowledge of the non-production of the aggregates, etc., which is in conformity with that.

original: de nyid ni bden pa ste 'jig rten pa dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dag la mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir de las mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni bden pa ste 'jig rten pa dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dag la mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir de las mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: That itself is the truth, because it is non-deceptive to the mundane and to the Perfect Buddhas, and it is not beyond that.

original: 'jug par bya ba ni rab tu 'jug par bya ba'o zhes slob pa sgrub pa la 'doms pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug par bya ba ni rab tu 'jug par bya ba'o zhes slob pa sgrub pa la 'doms pa'o //
translated: The object of engagement is the object of engagement.🔽The four truths are: the truth of suffering, the truth of origin, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path.🔽The truth of suffering is the truth of suffering.🔽The truth of origin is the truth of origin.🔽The truth of cessation is the truth of cessation.

original: tshad mas 'thad par 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir bden pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshad mas 'thad par 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir bden pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The truth of the path is the truth of the path.🔽The truth of suffering is the truth of suffering.🔽The truth of origin is the truth of origin.🔽The truth of cessation is the truth of cessation.🔽The truth of the path is the truth of the path.

original: de la sdug bsngal la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la'o //
translated: The truth of suffering is the truth of suffering.🔽The truth of origin is the truth of origin.

original: kun 'byung gi phung po'i 'bras bu nyid yin pas na 'bras bur gyur pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po tshe pha rol po'i'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi phung po'i 'bras bu nyid yin pas na 'bras bur gyur pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po tshe pha rol po'i'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is the truth of cessation.🔽The truth of the path is the truth of the path.🔽The truth of suffering is the truth of suffering.🔽The truth of origin is the truth of origin.🔽The truth of cessation is the truth of cessation.🔽The truth of the path is the truth of the path.🔽The truth of suffering is the truth of suffering.🔽The truth of origin is the truth of origin.🔽The truth of cessation is the truth of cessation.🔽The truth of the path is the truth of the path.🔽The truth of suffering is the truth of suffering.🔽The truth of origin is the truth of origin.🔽The truth of cessation is the truth of cessation.🔽The truth of the path is the truth of the path.🔽The truth of suffering is the truth of suffering.🔽The truth of origin is the truth of origin.🔽The truth of cessation is the truth of cessation.🔽The truth of the path is the truth of the path.🔽The truth of suffering is the truth of suffering.🔽The truth of origin is the truth of origin.🔽The truth of cessation is the truth of cessation.🔽The truth of the path is the truth of the path.🔽The truth of suffering is the truth of suffering.🔽The truth of origin is the truth of origin.🔽The truth of cessation is the truth of cessation.🔽The truth of the path is the truth of the path.🔽The truth of suffering is the truth of suffering.🔽The truth of origin is the truth of origin.🔽The truth of cessation is the truth of cessation.🔽The truth of the path is the truth of the path.🔽The truth of suffering is the truth of suffering.

original: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba la sogs pa'i tshad mas rnam par dpyad na rang bzhin gyi dngos po med pa nyid yin pa dang / gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba la sogs pa'i tshad mas rnam par dpyad na rang bzhin gyi dngos po med pa nyid yin pa dang / gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The truth

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'di nyid ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas don dam par skye ba med pa'i ngo bor rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir dbyer med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'di nyid ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas don dam par skye ba med pa'i ngo bor rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir dbyer med do //
translated: Since this very nondual transcendent wisdom is the essence of thatness, it is indivisible from the ultimate, which is by nature the essence of nonarising.

original: kun 'byung ba la zhes bya ba kun 'byung gi 'dren pa la stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / gang yang 'di las sdug bsngal gyi phung po kun 'byung bas kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po tshe 'di pa ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la zhes bya ba kun 'byung gi 'dren pa la stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / gang yang 'di las sdug bsngal gyi phung po kun 'byung bas kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po tshe 'di pa ste /
translated: The origin of suffering is the guide to the origin, which is emptiness, and the origin of the mass of suffering in this life is the origin of suffering, which is the causal aggregates of form and so on.

original: 'di gnyis ni tha mi dad pa nyid kyis dbyer med par gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ni kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya ba skye ba dang 'jig pa dang /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni tha mi dad pa nyid kyis dbyer med par gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ni kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya ba skye ba dang 'jig pa dang /
translated: These two are indivisible, since they are not different. Form and so on are not the phenomena of origin, cessation, defilement and purity.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: Desire, etc. are not the reality of selflessness.

original: 'gog pa la zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la'o //
translated: In regard to cessation means in regard to the truth of cessation.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni rtog sla'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni rtog sla'o //
translated: Emptiness, etc. are easy to understand.

original: @159b gzugs med pa ni gzugs kyi phung po med pa dang / nas zhes bya ba 'dis tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: @159b gzugs med pa ni gzugs kyi phung po med pa dang / nas zhes bya ba 'dis tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The formless means the absence of the form heap, and so on up to the absence of the consciousness heap.

original: ma rig pa skye ba yang med pa ni phung po med pas shes pa skye ba med pa la ma rig pa 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: ma rig pa skye ba yang med pa ni phung po med pas shes pa skye ba med pa la ma rig pa 'gag pa med de /
translated: The non-arising of ignorance means the non-arising of consciousness due to the absence of the heaps. The non-cessation of ignorance means the non-cessation of ignorance due to the non-arising of consciousness.

original: des na mi shes pa 'jig pa yang med do //
analyzed: des na mi shes pa 'jig pa yang med do //
translated: Thus, there is no destruction of ignorance.

original: sangs rgyas kyang med pa ni rtogs pa po med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang med pa ni rtogs pa po med pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of a Buddha means the non-existence of a knower.

original: de nyid kyis na rtogs par bya ba med pa'i phyir byang chub kyi bar du yang med de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rtogs par bya ba med pa'i phyir byang chub kyi bar du yang med de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med pa'o //
translated: And, for the same reason, up to the non-existence of enlightenment, i.e., the non-existence of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: lam la zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa la'o //
analyzed: lam la zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa la'o //
translated: In regard to the path means in regard to the truth of the path.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang bdag nyid de sbyin pa po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang bdag nyid de sbyin pa po zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfections such as giving are the self, and he is called the giver.🔽The emptiness of internal phenomena is the emptiness of external phenomena, and so on.

original: nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba dang // de bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid la phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba dang // de bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid la phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis dang /
translated: The emptiness of external phenomena is the emptiness of internal and external phenomena, and so on.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis so //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis so //
translated: The emptiness of internal and external phenomena is the emptiness of emptiness, and so on.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag ces bya ba srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag phan tshun gcig la gcig ldan pa dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa nyid kyis na sbyor ba nyid kyis ma yin mi sbyor ba nyid kyang ma yin
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag ces bya ba srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag phan tshun gcig la gcig ldan pa dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa nyid kyis na sbyor ba nyid kyis ma yin mi sbyor ba nyid kyang ma yin
translated: The beginning and end are not connected or not connected, because of the connection and non-connection of samsara and nirvana.

original: no zhes bya ba sgrub bo //
analyzed: no zhes bya ba sgrub bo //
translated: This is established.

original: sangs rgyas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the phrase in the Buddha, etc., etc. refers to the Dharma and Sangha.

original: byang chub pa'i bar du bde 'gro'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis na dga' ba skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dkon mchog la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: byang chub pa'i bar du bde 'gro'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis na dga' ba skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dkon mchog la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: Since it is the cause of happy rebirth up to enlightenment, it is the cause of the generation of joy. Thus, there are three jewels, the Buddha jewel, etc.

original: de la sangs rgyas la zhes bya ba sangs rgyas dkon mchog la sangs rgyas dang byang chub ces bya ba mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis te de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas la zhes bya ba sangs rgyas dkon mchog la sangs rgyas dang byang chub ces bya ba mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis te de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the Buddha is the Buddha jewel. The term “enlightenment” is a synonym for the Buddha, because it is characterized by thusness.

original: sangs rgyas su byed pa ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid rdzogs par byed pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su byed pa ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid rdzogs par byed pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of Buddhahood is the generation of the mind of enlightenment, etc.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni de'i bdag nyid can gyis te /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni de'i bdag nyid can gyis te /
translated: Its characteristic is that which has the nature of that.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: It is the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ni kho na nyid du ni rang bzhin med pa nyid yin pas mi dmigs pa la gzugs la sogs pa mi sbyor bas te /
analyzed: de ni kho na nyid du ni rang bzhin med pa nyid yin pas mi dmigs pa la gzugs la sogs pa mi sbyor bas te /
translated: That is reality, because it is the absence of intrinsic reality. It is not perceived, because form, etc. are not applied to it.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not applied to form, feeling, etc.

original: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa @160a * //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa @160a * //
translated: The knowledge of the equality of the object of apprehension and the apprehender.

original: nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa dang / de la dmigs par byed pa'i sems dag ni snang ba med pa tsam nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa dang / de la dmigs par byed pa'i sems dag ni snang ba med pa tsam nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: This means the knowledge that the three knowledges, such as the knowledge of all things, and the mind that apprehends them are merely without appearance.

original: chos la zhes bya ba chos dkon mchog la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis te sngar bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos la zhes bya ba chos dkon mchog la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis te sngar bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is the Jewel of the Dharma, which is all things as previously explained, by means of the three knowledges.

original: des bsdus pa ni gang gzhi dang gnyen po dang rnam pa mtha' dag ste /🔽phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po dang / rnam par byang ba dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa des /
analyzed: des bsdus pa ni gang gzhi dang gnyen po dang rnam pa mtha' dag ste / phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po dang / rnam par byang ba dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa des /
translated: That which is included in it is the basis, the antidote, and all aspects.🔽The things that are included in it are all things, both internal and external, and the aspects of purification, form, etc.

original: bsdus pa'i chos thams cad gzugs la sogs pas bsdus pa rnams ni yang dag par na ngo bo nyid med de stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i chos thams cad gzugs la sogs pas bsdus pa rnams ni yang dag par na ngo bo nyid med de stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: All things included in that are included in form, etc. They are in reality without own-being, i.e. empty.

original: dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun dkon mchog la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun dkon mchog la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The Buddha, etc. will be explained below.

original: ma zhen pa ni mngon par ma chags pa ste /
analyzed: ma zhen pa ni mngon par ma chags pa ste /
translated: Non-attachment is non-adherence.

original: de ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: That is indicated by “through the very undertaking of effort,” etc.

original: bskal pa grangs med gsum dang kun tu 'brel par 'jug pa nyid kyis ji skad du bshad pa'i don la nan tan du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa la'o //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med gsum dang kun tu 'brel par 'jug pa nyid kyis ji skad du bshad pa'i don la nan tan du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa la'o //
translated: Through the very undertaking of effort, i.e., through the connection with the three incalculable aeons, one should practice the meaning as it has been explained, i.e., one should accomplish the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment, etc.

original: lus la sogs pa bsod nams nyid kyi zhes bya ba bde ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa bsod nams nyid kyi zhes bya ba bde ba nyid kyis so //
translated: Through the very merit of the body, etc., i.e., through the very happiness.

original: la la ni dbang po rtul po'o //
analyzed: la la ni dbang po rtul po'o //
translated: Some are of dull faculties.

original: yongs su mi ngal ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su mi ngal ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: Non-weariness is non-affliction.

original: de ni dus ring mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dus ring mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: That is indicated by “for a long time,” etc.

original: dngang pa'i rang bzhin can ni dbang po rtul ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jigs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: dngang pa'i rang bzhin can ni dbang po rtul ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jigs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The fearful nature is the nature of fear because of dullness of the faculties.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nas zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa nas tshor ba la sogs pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nas zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa nas tshor ba la sogs pa'i bar ro //
translated: From form, etc. means from form up to feeling, etc.

original: rlom pa med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni yang dag par tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlom pa med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni yang dag par tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of conceit is because of the absence of the correct experience of feeling, etc.

original: lam ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: lam ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: The path is the practice.

original: de yongs su gzung ba ni 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su gzung ba ni 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The possession of that is the grasping of that.

original: de ni phyogs bcu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni phyogs bcu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: That is stated in the verse beginning with “in the ten directions.”

original: don re re'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba sna tshogs shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don re re'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba sna tshogs shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of each meaning means for the sake of the knowledge of the various things to be expressed.

original: sems zhum par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni phyogs sna tshogs bar gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen @160b mnyes par bya ba dang / des nye bar bstan pa'i don khong du chud pa so so'i bya ba mang po yod pa nyid la dbang po rtul po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems zhum par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni phyogs sna tshogs bar gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen @160b mnyes par bya ba dang / des nye bar bstan pa'i don khong du chud pa so so'i bya ba mang po yod pa nyid la dbang po rtul po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their minds are discouraged means that they have many duties to perform, such as pleasing the Buddhas and spiritual benefactors who are in various directions, and comprehending the meaning taught by them. This is because they are of dull faculties.

original: sems le lor gyur pa la chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: sems le lor gyur pa la chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid du ste /
translated: For those whose minds are lazy, the non-arising of form, etc. is taught as the Dharma.

original: de kho na nyid du na gzugs la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na gzugs la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in reality, form, etc. are non-arising by nature.

original: mthong ba'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis na spyan te de ni sha'i dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis na spyan te de ni sha'i dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The eye is so called because it is the cause of seeing. It is said to be the flesh eye, etc.

original: kun shes pas na mngon par shes pa yin la de nyid ni mthong ba gdul bya'i skye bo dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bslab par bya ba nyid yin pas na yon tan no //🔽de ni rdzu 'phrul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: kun shes pas na mngon par shes pa yin la de nyid ni mthong ba gdul bya'i skye bo dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bslab par bya ba nyid yin pas na yon tan no // de ni rdzu 'phrul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Since it is omniscience, it is superknowledge. Since it is the very thing that is to be trained in, it is a virtue, because it is the very thing that is to be seen in accordance with the disciples.🔽It is the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements, the knowledge of non-arising, and the knowledge of others' minds.

original: de shes pa gzhan la ltos na 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'i lha'i mig gi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de shes pa gzhan la ltos na 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'i lha'i mig gi shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the divine eye is the knowledge of the divine eye that arises from the great effort of depending on other knowledge.

original: zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: The defilements are the afflictions.

original: de rnams med pa ni zag pa zad pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams med pa ni zag pa zad pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of the defilements is the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements.

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From the beginning, it is peace itself, because it is naturally nirvana in reality.

original: ma mthong ba'i yon tan mthong ba'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i yon tan mthong ba'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the path of seeing because it is the very means of seeing the virtues that have not been seen.

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam bden pa bzhis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam bden pa bzhis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: That is called “subsumed by the four truths of the path of seeing” and so on.

original: bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four truths are suffering and so on.

original: des bsdus pa skad cig ma bcu drug ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des bsdus pa skad cig ma bcu drug ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Subsumed by them, the sixteen moments are impermanence and so on.🔽The path of seeing that has the nature of those is called “having the nature of the perseverance for Dharma knowledge and the knowledge of the dharma of suffering and so on.”

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam ni chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba bden pa re re zhing chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam ni chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba bden pa re re zhing chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa gnyis te /
translated: It is said that each truth has two: the perseverance for Dharma knowledge and the perseverance for subsequent knowledge.

original: shes pa bcu drug tu gyur pa de'i bdag nyid la'o //
analyzed: shes pa bcu drug tu gyur pa de'i bdag nyid la'o //
translated: It is said that it has the nature of those sixteen.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas zhes bya ba la gzugs la sogs pa stong par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas zhes bya ba la gzugs la sogs pa stong par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are realized to be essenceless, because form and so on are known to be empty.

original: sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i lus can rang gis ji lta ba bzhin du sprul pa ni log pa nyid yin par shes pas sgyu ma byed pa dag mngon par zhen pa med la /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i lus can rang gis ji lta ba bzhin du sprul pa ni log pa nyid yin par shes pas sgyu ma byed pa dag mngon par zhen pa med la /
translated: Magicians have no attachment.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //🔽des spang bar bya ba'i dngos @161a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa'o // des spang bar bya ba'i dngos @161a * //
translated: In the same way, there is no attachment to form, etc.

original: po mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs de'i gnyen po yin pa nyid kyis rnal 'byor ba de kho na nyid sgom par byed do //
analyzed: po mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs de'i gnyen po yin pa nyid kyis rnal 'byor ba de kho na nyid sgom par byed do //
translated: The yogi meditates on reality by means of the path of vision, which is the antidote to the things to be abandoned, which are the adverse side.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni 'dus byas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni 'dus byas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The path of cultivation is indicated by the words “the conditioned and the unconditioned, etc.”

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dag phyi'i spyi rgyu nyid kyis na gzugs dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dag phyi'i spyi rgyu nyid kyis na gzugs dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The conditioned and the unconditioned are the aggregates of form, morality, etc., which are the general causes of the contaminated and the uncontaminated.

original: de dag ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: de dag ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid kyis te /
translated: They are the same in nature,

original: stong pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis so //
translated: by way of emptiness.

original: des na phan tshun te gcig la gcig tha dad par gdags par mi nus pa bzhin du zhes bya ba tha snyad kyi dbye ba ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na phan tshun te gcig la gcig tha dad par gdags par mi nus pa bzhin du zhes bya ba tha snyad kyi dbye ba ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, they cannot be mutually, i.e., reciprocally, designated as different, because they are not different except in verbal expression.

original: de nyid kyis na don dam pa ba dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam don dam pa pa yin pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam mngon sum du byas pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi
analyzed: de nyid kyis na don dam pa ba dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam don dam pa pa yin pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam mngon sum du byas pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi
translated: For that very reason, they are in conformity with the ultimate, and therefore the paths of seeing and cultivation, as explained, are ultimate, because they are not different from the four noble truths that are seen by the path of seeing, as explained.

original: po de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya bar smos pa yin te /🔽de dang tha mi dad par dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: po de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya bar smos pa yin te / de dang tha mi dad par dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase, “because they are not different from them.”🔽They are perceived as not different from them,

original: de dag yul gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag yul gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they have the same object.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag tha dad du gyur ba med pas dbye ba med do //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag tha dad du gyur ba med pas dbye ba med do //
translated: Since there is no difference between the paths of seeing and cultivation, they are not differentiated.

original: rgyu des na mtshan nyid pa rnam bar gzhag pa ni med kyi 'on kyang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni mthong ba'i lam dang tha snyad 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des na mtshan nyid pa rnam bar gzhag pa ni med kyi 'on kyang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni mthong ba'i lam dang tha snyad 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the path of meditation is not established as a separate truth, but its objects are established as similar to the path of seeing.

original: yul gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dag par na mthong ba'i lam gyi khongs su bsgom pa'i lam 'dus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yul gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dag par na mthong ba'i lam gyi khongs su bsgom pa'i lam 'dus pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since they have the same object, is the path of meditation not included in the path of seeing?

original: de bsgom pa ni don med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bsgom pa ni don med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then meditation would be pointless.

original: 'on kyang de ni des spang bar bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni des spang bar bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
translated: However, it is said, “it meditates on the object to be abandoned by it.”

original: des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de'i gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa nyid kyis na rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: des spang bar bya ba'i dngos po bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de'i gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa nyid kyis na rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: The path of meditation meditates on the object to be abandoned by it, since it is the antidote to the class of objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: yul gcig pa nyid kyis na nus pa tha dad pa ga la yod ce na /
analyzed: yul gcig pa nyid kyis na nus pa tha dad pa ga la yod ce na /
translated: How can it have a different capacity, since it has the same object?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “it is the reality of dependent origination.”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the entities of cause and effect are inconceivable.

original: sgrub pa'i rnam pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rnam pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the aspect of practice?

original: dmigs pa ni gang yin rten ni gang yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gang yin rten ni gang yin /
translated: What is the objective? What is the basis?🔽What is the purpose of non-attachment, etc.?

original: ma zhen pa la @161b sogs pa'i yang dgos pa ni gang yin zhes dogs pa la de bstan pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ma zhen pa la @161b sogs pa'i yang dgos pa ni gang yin zhes dogs pa la de bstan pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The response to that question is stated in the verse beginning with “thus.”

original: de ltar byas na zhes bya pa ni spyir gdams pa smra ba la gnas pa la na'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na zhes bya pa ni spyir gdams pa smra ba la gnas pa la na'o //
translated: “Thus” refers to the general instruction to abide in the speaker.

original: phyir mi ldog par 'gro ba'i rgyu ni dbyer mi phyed par 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par 'gro ba'i rgyu ni dbyer mi phyed par 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of irreversibility is the cause of going without separation.

original: theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba'i rgyu ni rab kyi mthar phyin par mi 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba'i rgyu ni rab kyi mthar phyin par mi 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of not going by another vehicle is the cause of not going to the end of the summit.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gro ba nyid kyi rgyu ni bdud la sogs pa'i shes par drang ba'i don nyid du rang nyid kyis shes nas mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gro ba nyid kyi rgyu ni bdud la sogs pa'i shes par drang ba'i don nyid du rang nyid kyis shes nas mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of going without relying on another is the cause of not engaging after understanding the provisional meaning by oneself, through the knowledge of Māra, etc.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi dbye ba ci snyed yod pa de dag thams cad rtogs pa kho na yin pas rab tu byed pa gnyis po la don med do snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi dbye ba ci snyed yod pa de dag thams cad rtogs pa kho na yin pas rab tu byed pa gnyis po la don med do snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Therefore, the two chapters are meaningless.

original: bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to easily understand, the verse says:

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog la byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i dbye ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog la byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i dbye ba ni /
translated: The Jewel of the Sangha is classified as bodhisattvas of dull faculties and so on.

original: dbang po rtul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'u byas pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rtul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'u byas pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained by the verse beginning with dull faculties.🔽The verse says:🔽The Jewel of the Sangha is classified as bodhisattvas of dull faculties and so on.🔽This is explained by the verse beginning with dull faculties.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la mthong ba'i lam la brten nas zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga la /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la mthong ba'i lam la brten nas zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga la /
translated: The verse says:

original: dad pa dang chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i bye brag gis te /
analyzed: dad pa dang chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i bye brag gis te /
translated: The Jewel of the Sangha is classified as bodhisattvas of dull faculties and so on.🔽This is explained by the verse beginning with dull faculties.

original: dad pa dang shes rab kyis rjes su 'brang ba nyid dag gis 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa ste zhes bya ba rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu grub pa dang ldan pa dbang po rtul po dang rnon po rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dad pa dang shes rab kyis rjes su 'brang ba nyid dag gis 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa ste zhes bya ba rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu grub pa dang ldan pa dbang po rtul po dang rnon po rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who enter the first result are those who enter the result of stream entry, who possess the faculty of either dull or sharp intellectual faculty.

original: yun ring pos shes pa dang myur bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring pos shes pa dang myur bar shes pa'o //
translated: They are known as slow and quick learners, respectively.

original: de'i 'og tu de nyid 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug la ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de nyid 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug la ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: After that, one who is not free from attachment to the desire realm in the sixteenth moment of mind is a stream enterer.

original: de'i 'og tu de nyid bsgom pa'i lam la nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi rab tu spangs pa las /🔽lha dang mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba nyid kyis gzhan rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de nyid bsgom pa'i lam la nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi rab tu spangs pa las / lha dang mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba nyid kyis gzhan rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: After that, one who abandons the four types of affliction on the path of meditation🔽is a once returner and a nonreturner.

original: lha dang mi dag tu skye ba gnyis sam gsum thos pas lha'i rigs nas rigs dang / mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye bas rigs su skye ba'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi dag tu skye ba gnyis sam gsum thos pas lha'i rigs nas rigs dang / mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye bas rigs su skye ba'o //
translated: There are two other types of once returners and nonreturners who are born in the same class of god or human due to being born in the god or human class twice or three times, respectively.

original: de'i 'og tu dbang po rtul po dang rnon po dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa ste /🔽dad pa dang shes @162a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dbang po rtul po dang rnon po dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa ste / dad pa dang shes @162a * //
translated: Then, those of dull and sharp faculty who obtain results by faith and by insight🔽are the first and last.🔽

original: rab dang ldan pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa lnga spangs pas 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa ste lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa dang ldan pa ni gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: rab dang ldan pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa lnga spangs pas 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa ste lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa dang ldan pa ni gcig kho na yin no //
translated: Then, the person of dull faculty and the person of sharp faculty, who are respectively endowed with faith and endowed with insight, who have obtained the fruit of the once-returner by abandoning the five categories of defilements of the realm of desire, are the once-returners.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug spangs pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no //🔽de'i 'og tu de nyid lha rnams su skye ba gcig lhag ma lus pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan par chad gcig pa yin no //🔽de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bdun pa dang brgyad pa spangs pas 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug spangs pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no // de'i 'og tu de nyid lha rnams su skye ba gcig lhag ma lus pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan par chad gcig pa yin no // de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bdun pa dang brgyad pa spangs pas 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Then, the person who has obtained the fruit of the non-returner by abandoning the six categories of defilements of the realm of desire, is the non-returner.🔽Then, the person who has obtained the fruit of the perfected being by abandoning the ninth category of defilements of the summit of existence, is the perfected being.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu grub pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu grub pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are seven noble ones, because the once-returner and the non-returner are each divided into three.

original: dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa ni snga ma bzhin du gcig yin te dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la zhugs pa dag na dad pa dang mthong bas thob par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa ni snga ma bzhin du gcig yin te dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la zhugs pa dag na dad pa dang mthong bas thob par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Those who obtain results by faith and by seeing are one, as before, because they are explained to be those who obtain results by faith and by seeing who enter the second and third results.

original: rgyas par bshad pa ni lung gi dbang gis yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa ni lung gi dbang gis yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the extensive explanation is from the perspective of scripture.🔽Next, there are five types of nonreturners who abandon the ninth affliction of the desire realm.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dgu pa spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba'i rnam pa lnga ste der ni bar ma do dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dgu pa spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba'i rnam pa lnga ste der ni bar ma do dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “in the intermediate state and so on” refers to those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, those who attain nirvana after birth and those who attain nirvana with preparation.

original: skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni spangs /🔽mngon par 'grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni ma spangs pa'i phyir srid pa bar ma mngon par sgrub par byed pa na'am /
analyzed: skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni spangs /🔽mngon par 'grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni ma spangs pa'i phyir srid pa bar ma mngon par sgrub par byed pa na'am /
translated: The fetter of existence is abandoned.🔽The fetter of actualizing existence is not abandoned.

original: mngon par sgrub pa na srid pa bar mar lam mngon sum du byas pas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa na srid pa bar mar lam mngon sum du byas pas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: One who obtains the end of suffering by manifesting the path in the intermediate state when actually establishing the path is an intermediate state parinirvanajn.

original: kun tu sbyor ba gnyi ga ma spangs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba gnyi ga ma spangs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: One who obtains the end of suffering after being born in the form realm without abandoning both fetters is one who attains nirvana upon rebirth.🔽Similarly, one who obtains the end of suffering through manifesting the path by means of exertion after being born is one who attains nirvana through exertion.

original: de bzhin du skyes nas mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas lam mngon du byed pa thob pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes nas mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas lam mngon du byed pa thob pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa thob pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: One who obtains the end of suffering through manifesting the path without exertion after being born is one who attains nirvana without exertion.

original: de las go bzlog pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ste rnam pa bzhi dang gong du 'pho ba ni lnga ste /
analyzed: de las go bzlog pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ste rnam pa bzhi dang gong du 'pho ba ni lnga ste /
translated: These are the four types of arhats.

original: de yang 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i @162b mthar thug par 'gro ba ste rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i @162b mthar thug par 'gro ba ste rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Furthermore, there are two types: those who go to the limit of Akaniṣṭha and those who go to the limit of the peak of existence.

original: de'i 'og tu gong du 'pho ba de nyid 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ni 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dang gnas skabs thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba nyid kyis 'og min tu 'jug pa ni gong du 'pho ba gzhan rnam pa gsum mo
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gong du 'pho ba de nyid 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ni 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dang gnas skabs thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba nyid kyis 'og min tu 'jug pa ni gong du 'pho ba gzhan rnam pa gsum mo
translated: After that, those who proceed higher who go to the limit of Akaniṣṭha are of three types: those who leap over, those who leap over half and those who die and pass on in all states and enter Akaniṣṭha.

original: // de'i 'og tu gong du 'pho ba de nyid srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: // de'i 'og tu gong du 'pho ba de nyid srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba ste /
translated: After that, those who proceed higher who go to the limit of the peak of existence are of two types: those who are free from attachment to the form realm and those who are not free from attachment to the form realm.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnyis te mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba dang lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa gzhan rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnyis te mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba dang lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa gzhan rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the form realm are of two types: those who attain peace in this life and those who physically actualize.

original: de'i 'og tu srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa brgyad pa spangs pas ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa brgyad pa spangs pas ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: After that, those who abandon the eighth affliction of the peak of existence enter the result of an arhat.

original: de'i 'og tu nyan thos kyi sde snod nyid la dmigs nas rang gi lam mngon sum du byed pas sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba na rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ste de ltar nyi shu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyan thos kyi sde snod nyid la dmigs nas rang gi lam mngon sum du byed pas sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba na rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ste de ltar nyi shu'o //
translated: Then, focusing on the scriptural collection of the śrāvakas, they become pratyekabuddhas, since they do not encounter a buddha who manifests the path.

original: 'dir go sla bas 'bras bu dang po dang gnyis pa dang bzhi pa la zhugs pa'i grangs ma smos so //
analyzed: 'dir go sla bas 'bras bu dang po dang gnyis pa dang bzhi pa la zhugs pa'i grangs ma smos so //
translated: Here, since it is easy to understand, the number of those who enter the first, second, and fourth results is not mentioned.

original: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i mdo dang / stong phrag nyi shu lnga ba dang / chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i mdo dang / stong phrag nyi shu lnga ba dang / chos mngon pa las /

original: de la skad cig bco lnga ni /
analyzed: de la skad cig bco lnga ni /
translated: Fifteen moments

original: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs dang grangs dang bcas par gsungs pa yod pas log par khong du chud par mi bya'o //
