original: las dang po ba de ltar gdams ngag thob pa la zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsod nams kyi tshogs la gsogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa dang ldan pa la ye shes kyi tshogs grub par bya ba'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pas nges par 'byung ba'i mos
analyzed: las dang po ba de ltar gdams ngag thob pa la zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsod nams kyi tshogs la gsogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa dang ldan pa la ye shes kyi tshogs grub par bya ba'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pas nges par 'byung ba'i mos

analyzed: de'i gnyen po nyid kyis na mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ste /

analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa de dag gi yang dro bar gyur ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'i bdag nyid kyis te dngos po gang la yang gzugs su rung ba dang / nyams su myong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po de'i bdag nyid can gyi bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa de la dmigs pa gang yin pa dang bdag tu lta ba ni bdag tu mthong ba'o // de'i gnyen po nyid yin pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas zhugs pa'o //
translated: The view of self is seeing a self in those.

original: rang gi theg pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma @164a * //
analyzed: rang gi theg pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma @164a * //
translated: Since it is the antidote to that, it is called “the aspects of impermanence and so on,” which means engaging in the aspects of impermanence, suffering, and so on.

original: med pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: med pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: One’s vehicle is nirvāṇa with and without remainder.

original: de rtogs pa kho na ni de thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rtogs pa kho na ni de thob pa nyid do //
translated: The realization of that is the attainment of that.

original: yongs su bzung ba ni snga ma bzhin du ste de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba ni snga ma bzhin du ste de dang bral ba'o //
translated: The complete relinquishment is as before, and the freedom from that.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'og nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'og nas bshad pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of conceptualization will be explained below.

original: de dang mi ldan par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis te /
analyzed: de dang mi ldan par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are free from those, in the sense that they do not occur.

original: de ltar byas na rnam par rtog pa bzhi ni rang gi byang chub kyi gegs su gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na rnam par rtog pa bzhi ni rang gi byang chub kyi gegs su gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the four kinds of conceptualization do not obstruct their enlightenment.

original: nyan thos kyi lung las 'dres su zin kyang ma 'dres par skye ba yin no zhes bshad pas rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lung las 'dres su zin kyang ma 'dres par skye ba yin no zhes bshad pas rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba yin no //
translated: And because it is said in the Sravaka Canon that even when mixed, they are born unmixed, they are free from the four kinds of conceptualization.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam pa dang dmigs pa dag yongs su bzung ba'i dbang gis khyad par du 'phags pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam pa dang dmigs pa dag yongs su bzung ba'i dbang gis khyad par du 'phags pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: And the superiority of the bodhisattvas, due to their special retention of aspects and objective supports, is indicated by the verse beginning, The bodhisattvas.

original: bden pa bzhi bo'i dngos po la dmigs pa ni nges par 'byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro //🔽de ni ci rigs par kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba la'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi bo'i dngos po la dmigs pa ni nges par 'byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro // de ni ci rigs par kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba la'o //
translated: The observation of the entities of the four noble truths is connected with the passage beginning “the factors that contribute to enlightenment that are conducive to penetration.”

original: rgyu'i sgo nas ni kun 'byung ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po'i rgyu nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgo nas ni kun 'byung ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po'i rgyu nyid yin pas so //
translated: In some cases, the origin of suffering is described in terms of its cause, because it is the cause of the mass of suffering.

original: kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba sdug bsngal la ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas zhes bya ba sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bur gyur ba'i sgo nas te /🔽sdug bsngal ni kun 'byung gi 'bras bu nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba sdug bsngal la ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas zhes bya ba sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bur gyur ba'i sgo nas te / sdug bsngal ni kun 'byung gi 'bras bu nyid yin pas so //
translated: In some cases, suffering is described in terms of its result, because it is the result of the origin of suffering.

original: kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba 'gog pa la ni ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba yang dag par na chos thams cad 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba 'gog pa la ni ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba yang dag par na chos thams cad 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In some cases, cessation is described in terms of its essential nature, because it is the essential nature of the cessation of all entities in an ultimate sense.

original: kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba lam la ni chos nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi chos mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba lam la ni chos nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi chos mi dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In some places, the path is said to be the non-apprehension of the dharmas of the three knowledges, from the perspective of the aspect of reality.

original: snga ma bzhin du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pas so //
translated: As before, it is also said to be from another perspective, that of non-attachment, etc.

original: bsre ba zhes bya ba ni rgya cher bsgom pa ni'o //
analyzed: bsre ba zhes bya ba ni rgya cher bsgom pa ni'o //
translated: Blending is the extensive cultivation.

original: phal cher sde ba rnams bdag cag gi sde snod gsum la khyed kyi theg pa mi snang bas khyed cag gi theg pa ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sun 'byin par smra bas /
analyzed: phal cher sde ba rnams bdag cag gi sde snod gsum la khyed kyi theg pa mi snang bas khyed cag gi theg pa ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sun 'byin par smra bas /
translated: Most of the sects say, Your vehicle does not appear in our three baskets, therefore your vehicle was not spoken by the Buddha, and so on, as refutations.

original: de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: To dispel that, Therefore... and so on is stated.

original: 'di ni lugs @164b gzhan kho na yin pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir theg pa chen po'i gnas skabs khyad par rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa de bas na ste /🔽de'i phyogs theg pa chen po las lugs kho na gzhan yin pas de la brten nas zhes bya ba de mthong ba'i tshul gyis theg pa chen po gang du yang sun 'byin par brjod par mi bya zhing sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni lugs @164b gzhan kho na yin pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir theg pa chen po'i gnas skabs khyad par rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa de bas na ste / de'i phyogs theg pa chen po las lugs kho na gzhan yin pas de la brten nas zhes bya ba de mthong ba'i tshul gyis theg pa chen po gang du yang sun 'byin par brjod par mi bya zhing sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no //
translated: because the Mahayana is superior in five ways.

original: zhes brgal bar mi bya /
analyzed: zhes brgal bar mi bya /
translated: Therefore, since it is a different system, one should not, by seeing it as a different system, criticize the Mahayana as being a refutation of the Mahayana, nor should one argue that it is not the word of the Buddha.

original: bdag cag gi sde snod gsum du khyed kyi theg pa mi snang ba dang sam skri ta'i skad kyis ma gsungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba 'di dang / skad gzhan ma mkhyen na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa dang khyed cag kho na gdul bya nyid yin na thams cad gdul bya ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: bdag cag gi sde snod gsum du khyed kyi theg pa mi snang ba dang sam skri ta'i skad kyis ma gsungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba 'di dang / skad gzhan ma mkhyen na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa dang khyed cag kho na gdul bya nyid yin na thams cad gdul bya ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: And it follows that if you do not know other languages, you are not omniscient, and if you are the only disciples, then everyone else is not a disciple.

original: yu bu cag gnyi ga de ltar mi 'dod pas 'di ni ci ltar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yu bu cag gnyi ga de ltar mi 'dod pas 'di ni ci ltar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: But we do not accept that, so this is not right in any way.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i rgol ba ni mdo sde rgyan la sogs pa las sha za'i skad la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa pa yang dag pa'i lta ba mi shes pa'i sha za rnams la mnyam par bstan pas rgya cher tshar bcad pa yin par
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i rgol ba ni mdo sde rgyan la sogs pa las sha za'i skad la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa pa yang dag pa'i lta ba mi shes pa'i sha za rnams la mnyam par bstan pas rgya cher tshar bcad pa yin par
translated: Such arguments are refuted in the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras and so on, where it is said that the Buddha taught the Shravakayana in the language of the rakshasas and so on, and that the rakshasas who do not know the correct view are refuted in detail by teaching them the equality of all phenomena.

original: blta bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: blta bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is the intention of the above passage.

original: yang 'di'i dgongs pa 'di ma yin pas rtag pa'i lung dang mi rtag pa'i lung bzhin du theg pa gzhan dang gzhan 'gal ba ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'di'i dgongs pa 'di ma yin pas rtag pa'i lung dang mi rtag pa'i lung bzhin du theg pa gzhan dang gzhan 'gal ba ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Also, it should not be said that “this is not the intended meaning of the Mahāyāna, so it is not contradictory to other vehicles, like the scriptures on permanence and the scriptures on impermanence.”

original: gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i byang chub dang 'gal bar 'og nas bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i byang chub dang 'gal bar 'og nas bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained below that “the dharmas of others exist” and so on contradicts their enlightenment.

original: gzhan du na bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde ba dang / rnal byor spyod pa dang / dbu ma ba'i sangs rgyas pa rnams gong nas gong gi rim pas khyad par du 'phags par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde ba dang / rnal byor spyod pa dang / dbu ma ba'i sangs rgyas pa rnams gong nas gong gi rim pas khyad par du 'phags par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the Buddhists—the Vaibhāṣika, Sautrāntika, Yogācāra, and Madhyamaka—be progressively superior?

original: yang na theg pa chen po khyad par du 'phags pa bstan pa na theg pa gzhan khyad par can ma yin par bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang na theg pa chen po khyad par du 'phags pa bstan pa na theg pa gzhan khyad par can ma yin par bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Or, when the Mahāyāna is taught to be superior, is it not explained that other vehicles are not superior?

original: des phongs pa la 'jug pa'i las kyi nyes par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma'i lan ni de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: des phongs pa la 'jug pa'i las kyi nyes par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma'i lan ni de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The response to the former position, “Why wouldn’t it be a fault of engaging in the action of being bereft of Dharma?” is stated with “Therefore…”

original: 'di ni lugs gzhan kho na yin pas zhes bya ba ni theg pa khyad @165a * //
analyzed: 'di ni lugs gzhan kho na yin pas zhes bya ba ni theg pa khyad @165a * //
translated: This is just another system.

original: par can dang khyad par can ma yin pa dag ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa brtan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: par can dang khyad par can ma yin pa dag ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa brtan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: One should understand the special and non-special vehicles just as they are.🔽Since it is so, therefore, one should not express any refutation based on another vehicle.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir gang du yang theg pa gzhan la brten nas sun dbyung ba brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba la 'jug pa'i las kyi nyes pa brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir gang du yang theg pa gzhan la brten nas sun dbyung ba brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba la 'jug pa'i las kyi nyes pa brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not express the fault of engaging in the action of being bereft of Dharma.

original: rang rang gi theg pa la gnas pa rnams bdag cag gi bas gzhan gyi theg pa nyams par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi theg pa las nyams nas de lhag par mos pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rang rang gi theg pa la gnas pa rnams bdag cag gi bas gzhan gyi theg pa nyams par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi theg pa las nyams nas de lhag par mos pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because they are intent on the inferiority of their own vehicle, they do not aspire to the superiority of the other vehicle, having fallen away from their own vehicle.

original: de nyid kyis na gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun dbyung ba sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa ni nyes pa ma yin te 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun dbyung ba sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa ni nyes pa ma yin te 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the previously explained fault in the refutation, “The other’s dharmas also exist, etc.,” is not a fault, because it is our own position.

original: bshad pa 'di la rang gi theg pa la gnas pa dag ni rang gi theg pa spong pa des phongs par gyur ba'i las su gzhag pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di la rang gi theg pa la gnas pa dag ni rang gi theg pa spong pa des phongs par gyur ba'i las su gzhag pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In this explanation, those who abide in their own vehicle should be seen as being engaged in the activity of abandoning their own vehicle.

original: dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa ni bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag go //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa ni bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag go //
translated: With respect to “apprehension, etc.,” the establishment and negation of the arising and cessation of form, etc., are the establishment and negation of the apprehension of form, etc.

original: gnas pa ni 'dis gnas shing tha snyad du byed pas na gnas te sgra ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni 'dis gnas shing tha snyad du byed pas na gnas te sgra ma lus pa'o //
translated: Abiding is the abiding of this, and since it is conventionally designated, it is abiding.

original: bral ba ni mi gnas pa ste med pa yin pas gnas bral lo //
analyzed: bral ba ni mi gnas pa ste med pa yin pas gnas bral lo //
translated: The absence of abiding is non-abiding, and since it is non-existent, it is the absence of abiding.

original: btags dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i tha snyad de dang de ni brjod du med pa yin pas /
analyzed: btags dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i tha snyad de dang de ni brjod du med pa yin pas /
translated: The designation is the conventional designation of Buddha, etc. That is inexpressible,

original: btags dang brjod du med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btags dang brjod du med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and therefore it is said to be the inexpressible designation.

original: dro bar gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa gsum gyi dmigs pa dang rnam pa dag 'grel ba las /
analyzed: dro bar gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa gsum gyi dmigs pa dang rnam pa dag 'grel ba las /
translated: The focal object and aspects of the three types of roots of virtue belonging to heat are explained in the commentary.

original: chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la smos pa yin te /
analyzed: chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la smos pa yin te /
translated: The focal object of the small is stated and so on.

original: de la dro ba chung ngu'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
analyzed: de la dro ba chung ngu'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
translated: Therein, the focal object of small heat and so on is explained by impermanence and so on.

original: dro ba 'bring gi dmigs pa ni mos pa dang zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa la yod pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: dro ba 'bring gi dmigs pa ni mos pa dang zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa la yod pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The focal object of medium heat is interest, which is the conventional designation of form and so on as existent and so on.

original: de kho na nyid ni don dam pa mthong bas de rnams nyid bdag med pa'o //🔽de dag gi yid la byed pa gang yin pa de dag gis grangs bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya bar bsgrub pa dang dgag @165b pa dag ni dmigs par mthong ba zhes bya ba sprul ba'i gzugs la sogs pa🔽lta ba dang 'dra bar dngos po snang bzhin pa na dngos po med pa yin la /🔽de yang de kho na nyid du ni ma yin no zhes dmigs pa gnyi ga sgyu ma byed pas sprul pa lta bur bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //🔽ming thams cad med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du med pas so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni don dam pa mthong bas de rnams nyid bdag med pa'o // de dag gi yid la byed pa gang yin pa de dag gis grangs bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya bar bsgrub pa dang dgag @165b pa dag ni dmigs par mthong ba zhes bya ba sprul ba'i gzugs la sogs pa lta ba dang 'dra bar dngos po snang bzhin pa na dngos po med pa yin la / de yang de kho na nyid du ni ma yin no zhes dmigs pa gnyi ga sgyu ma byed pas sprul pa lta bur bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so // ming thams cad med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du med pas so //
translated: Reality is the ultimate, and so they are selfless.

original: de mi 'dra ba gang yin pa de ni 'dir gsal bar rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de mi 'dra ba gang yin pa de ni 'dir gsal bar rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa'o //
translated: What is not like that is the particular characteristic.

original: rgyun ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rgyun ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The continuum is as before.

original: 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid don gyi bya ba nus pa dang mi nus pa'i bdag nyid can du med de /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid don gyi bya ba nus pa dang mi nus pa'i bdag nyid can du med de /
translated: The characteristic of these two is not in the nature of the capacity or incapacity for the activity of the object, whether in general or in particular.

original: brjod pa po med pas brjod par bya ba med do //
analyzed: brjod pa po med pas brjod par bya ba med do //
translated: Since there is no speaker, there is no object of speech.

original: zhes bya bar dgongs so //🔽rang gi mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob tu yang brjod du med pa ma yin nam sgra rnams ni sel ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar der dgag cen bden mod kyi sgra gsal ba nyid la 'jug pa na lan 'ga' zhig de la yang brjod par
analyzed: zhes bya bar dgongs so // rang gi mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob tu yang brjod du med pa ma yin nam sgra rnams ni sel ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar der dgag cen bden mod kyi sgra gsal ba nyid la 'jug pa na lan 'ga' zhig de la yang brjod par
translated: This is the idea.🔽Isn't the particular characteristic inexpressible even conventionally? Since words have the exclusion of other as their object, how can it be refuted in that way?🔽It is true, but when a word engages a particular, it is conceived to be the object of expression.

original: bya b nyid yin par mngon par zhen to zhes bya ba'i bar du srid pa dgag pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bya b nyid yin par mngon par zhen to zhes bya ba'i bar du srid pa dgag pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Up to this point, the possibility of refutation is accepted.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas bral ba'o //
translated: This is the absence of a locus.

original: dro ba chen po ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi btags pa ste tha snyad do //
analyzed: dro ba chen po ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi btags pa ste tha snyad do //
translated: Great warmth is the designation, the convention, of all phenomena such as form.

original: de ni chen po'i dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni chen po'i dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: It is the object of the great, etc.🔽The phenomena designated by conventions such as form, Buddha, etc., are like conventions that are made by the power of conventional activity.

original: gzugs nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa brdar btags pa'i chos tha snyad du bya ba'i dbang gis kun tu tha snyad du byas pa dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa gcig yin pa'i bsam pas ming du nges pa'o
analyzed: gzugs nas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa brdar btags pa'i chos tha snyad du bya ba'i dbang gis kun tu tha snyad du byas pa dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa gcig yin pa'i bsam pas ming du nges pa'o
translated: The thought that they are one, such as Buddha and freedom from attachment, etc., is a determination in name.

original: // de ni gzugs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: // de ni gzugs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis brjod du med pa'o //
translated: It is inexpressible by the convention of form, etc.

original: dro ba zhes bya ba'i don dang ldan pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: dro ba zhes bya ba'i don dang ldan pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of warmth is possessed by that, etc.🔽If there is no obstacle immediately after this, it becomes the path of seeing.

original: 'di'i rjes thogs la bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam du 'gyur ba yin par thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu dro ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di'i rjes thogs la bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam du 'gyur ba yin par thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu dro ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in warmth is after the factors conducive to liberation.

original: rtse mor rtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa @166a * //
analyzed: rtse mor rtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa @166a * //
translated: The peak is the object and aspect of the root of the wholesome of realization.

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ni gzugs la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ni gzugs la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The small, middling and great are stated in the verse beginning with “form etc.”

original: gzugs sogs mi gnas zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid du mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs sogs mi gnas zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid du mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
translated: “Form etc. is not present” means that one does not settle down on the existence of form etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag ni de'i ngo bor zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no //🔽de dag ces bya ba gzugs la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid 'di dag ni gcig la gcig ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag ni de'i ngo bor zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no // de dag ces bya ba gzugs la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid 'di dag ni gcig la gcig ste /
translated: “They are not existent in that nature” means that form etc. is devoid of an essential nature in the nature of form etc.

original: phan tshun rang bzhin nam ngo bo nyid gcig yin no //🔽de mi rtag sogs par mi gnas //
analyzed: phan tshun rang bzhin nam ngo bo nyid gcig yin no // de mi rtag sogs par mi gnas //
translated: “They” refers to form etc. and emptiness. These are mutually one, i.e. they are mutually one in nature or essence.

original: zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: “They are not present as impermanent etc.” means that one does not settle down on form etc. as impermanent, painful etc.

original: de rnams zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid ni de'i ngo bos stong zhes bya ba stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bos bdag med cing de dag ste /🔽gzugs la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid dag ni gcig la gcig gis te /
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid ni de'i ngo bos stong zhes bya ba stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bos bdag med cing de dag ste / gzugs la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid dag ni gcig la gcig gis te /
translated: Those, i.e., the emptiness of form, etc., are essentially selfless, i.e., empty, because of emptiness.

original: phan tshun rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun rang bzhin gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: Form, etc., and emptiness are mutually the same in essence, i.e., they are the same in essence.🔽One does not grasp at things,

original: chos rnams mi 'dzin gang yin dang // zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid du med pas bdag gir mi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams mi 'dzin gang yin dang // zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid du med pas bdag gir mi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: i.e., one does not grasp at form, etc., as one’s own, because they do not exist in reality.

original: de dag mtshan mar ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: de dag mtshan mar ma mthong phyir //
translated: Because one does not see their signs,

original: zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: i.e., because one does not see the signs of form, etc., in reality.🔽By means of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyis ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa'i rgyu ste shes pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa'i rgyu ste shes pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: i.e., by means of the special knowledge which is the cause of the analysis of form, etc.

original: des yongs su rtogs pa ni de kho na nyid du rnam par dbye ba'i yul gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med cing dngos po med pa nyid du shes pa'o //🔽de ni / thams cad dmigs su med par ni //
analyzed: des yongs su rtogs pa ni de kho na nyid du rnam par dbye ba'i yul gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med cing dngos po med pa nyid du shes pa'o // de ni / thams cad dmigs su med par ni //
translated: The thorough understanding of that is the knowledge that the objects of the differentiation of reality, the phenomena of form, etc., do not exist and are insubstantial.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That is stated in the verse, “All is not apprehended as real,” etc.

original: chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'brel pa'o //🔽chos yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i cha skye ba med par rtogs pa nyid du rnam par shes pas spyod cing rnam par brtag pa ste /
analyzed: chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'brel pa'o // chos yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i cha skye ba med par rtogs pa nyid du rnam par shes pas spyod cing rnam par brtag pa ste /
translated: The connection is with the phrase, “The object of the small . . . ,” etc.🔽The thorough differentiation of phenomena is the thorough differentiation of the aspects of form, etc., as non-arisen. It is the thorough understanding of that by the consciousness that is the thorough differentiation of the wisdom by which one sees the non-arisenness of form, etc.

original: shes rab gang gis gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med par mthong ba rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab de la yang @166b skye ba med par bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab gang gis gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med par mthong ba rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab de la yang @166b skye ba med par bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should think about the non-arisenness of that wisdom of thorough differentiation.

original: 'dis ni rnam pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med cing rang bzhin med pa nyid du chos kyi sgo nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med cing rang bzhin med pa nyid du chos kyi sgo nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the perfection of wisdom, which is the aspect, in terms of the Dharma, as being without own-being.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar gong nas gong du khyad par thob cing g-yo ba yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba ste dro ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar gong nas gong du khyad par thob cing g-yo ba yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba ste dro ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The wholesome roots which are 'wavering' are so called because they are like faith, etc., and are wavering in that they are subject to regression and are not yet firmly established.

original: de'i mchog yin pa'i phyir rtse mor gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i mchog yin pa'i phyir rtse mor gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The 'summit' is so called because it is the highest of the wholesome roots which are wavering.

original: bzod par gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsum ni gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: bzod par gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsum ni gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin la /
translated: The wholesome roots which are 'connected with acceptance' have three objects and aspects, and these are stated in the verse by the words 'form, etc.'

original: rab tu byed pa'i don ni chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i don ni chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the 'categories' is stated by the words 'the small object, etc.'

original: bzod par rtogs pa chung ngu'i ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba dang nyams su myong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzod par rtogs pa chung ngu'i ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba dang nyams su myong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The small object of the wholesome roots which are connected with acceptance is the characteristic of form, etc., i.e. suitability to material form, experience, etc.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni yang sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sa ba la sogs pa 'di nyid ni 'di'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni yang sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sa ba la sogs pa 'di nyid ni 'di'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Its own nature is this very nature of earth, etc., which is the characteristic of earth, etc.

original: 'di dag ni de kho na nyid du na stong pa nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med par rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyis na gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang sa la sogs pa de'i mtshan nyid dang ngo bo nyid med pa
analyzed: 'di dag ni de kho na nyid du na stong pa nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med par rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyis na gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang sa la sogs pa de'i mtshan nyid dang ngo bo nyid med pa
translated: Since these are empty of reality, they are natureless. Since they are the same in nature, form, etc. is the characteristic of form, etc. and earth, etc. is the characteristic of earth, etc.

original: nyid yin no //
analyzed: nyid yin no //
translated: and natureless.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Form, etc. has been explained.

original: skye bo dmigs pa can ni phyi rol gyi don yod pa la lta ba rnams te /
analyzed: skye bo dmigs pa can ni phyi rol gyi don yod pa la lta ba rnams te /
translated: The objective is the view that external objects exist.

original: de'i ngor gzugs la sogs pa sngar bshad pa dang dngos po med pa de nyid ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i ngor gzugs la sogs pa sngar bshad pa dang dngos po med pa de nyid ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: From that point of view, the previously explained form, etc. and the non-entity are the same in nature.

original: bzod par rtogs pa 'bring gi ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyis yang dag par na gzugs la sogs pa skye ba yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzod par rtogs pa 'bring gi ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyis yang dag par na gzugs la sogs pa skye ba yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The nature of the middling realization of acceptance is that, due to non-production by nature, in reality there is no arising of form and so forth.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pas gzugs la sogs pa stong pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pas gzugs la sogs pa stong pa nyid du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one realizes the essence of all phenomena, one knows form and so forth as emptiness.

original: lus la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi rnam pas rnam par dag cing dri ma med pa yin te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi rnam pas rnam par dag cing dri ma med pa yin te /
translated: The body and so forth are completely pure and stainless in all aspects, in terms of outer and inner identity.

original: 'dir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su rnam pa thams cad du dag pa ste med pas cung zad tsam gyis dag pa yin par blta bar bya'o //🔽de dag @167a * //
analyzed: 'dir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su rnam pa thams cad du dag pa ste med pas cung zad tsam gyis dag pa yin par blta bar bya'o // de dag @167a * //
translated: Here, in the stage of the factors conducive to penetration, one should view them as pure to a small extent, since they are not completely pure.

original: skye med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: skye med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Those are explained as non-arising and so forth.

original: bzod par rtogs pa chen po'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: bzod par rtogs pa chen po'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The nature of the great realization of acceptance is the general and specific characteristics explained earlier.

original: de mi 'thad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yin par mi rung zhing mi rigs pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: de mi 'thad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yin par mi rung zhing mi rigs pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: That is not tenable, because form, etc. are not suitable and are not reasonable. Therefore, one should attend to the absence of the characteristics of all phenomena, such as form, etc.

original: de'i mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The absence of their signs, etc. have already been explained.

original: rang bzhin kho na gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams kyi rten dang bral ba nyid kyis na gzugs la sogs pa'i rten med pa yid la byed pa ste kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa yod par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin kho na gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams kyi rten dang bral ba nyid kyis na gzugs la sogs pa'i rten med pa yid la byed pa ste kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa yod par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The absence of a basis for form, etc. is the mental attention to the very nature of form, etc. as devoid of a basis for the signs of form, etc. It is the non-apprehension of form, etc. as existing conventionally.

original: de la mi mos pa ni mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi mos pa ni mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
translated: Non-interest in that is non-apprehension.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa ste de'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa ste de'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The intrinsic identity of form, etc. is the sign of form, etc.

original: de'i mtshan mar mi rten pa ni mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan mar mi rten pa ni mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
translated: Non-reliance on that sign is non-apprehension.

original: de'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: The sign of that, etc. have already been explained.

original: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsam pa'o //
translated: The attention to reality is the thought that all phenomena are emptiness.

original: de yongs su shes pa med pa ni dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su shes pa med pa ni dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of that is the non-apprehension of emptiness.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa ni 'du shes nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa ni 'du shes nyid do //
translated: The possession of right knowledge is the very perception.

original: de med pas na 'du shes med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de med pas na 'du shes med pa nyid de /
translated: The non-existence of that is the very non-perception.

original: dngos po'i chos la mngon par zhen pa dang / mngon par ma zhen pa de med na de ci ltar yod ces bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos la mngon par zhen pa dang / mngon par ma zhen pa de med na de ci ltar yod ces bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that if there is no attachment to the phenomena of things, and if there is no non-attachment, how can there be any existence?

original: bzod pa zhes bya ba don dang ldan pa nyid ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bzod pa zhes bya ba don dang ldan pa nyid ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the word “patience” is stated in the passage beginning “Thus, etc.”🔽Thus, one who possesses the object and aspect of patience has no bad destinies.

original: de ltar na bzod pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ldan pa la ni ngan 'gro med pas zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: de ltar na bzod pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang ldan pa la ni ngan 'gro med pas zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las /
translated: In the Abhidharma it is said:

original: bzod thob ngan song mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: bzod thob ngan song mi 'gro'o //
translated: One who has attained patience does not go to bad destinies.

original: zhes bshad pas bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni so so'i skye bo dang 'dra bar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ngan song gsum med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni so so'i skye bo dang 'dra bar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ngan song gsum med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has attained the stage of patience is not reborn in the three lower miserable destinies, such as the hells, like ordinary beings.

original: chos chen po la bzod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chos chen po la bzod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of patience with the great doctrine.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa med pa la sogs par bzod pas yid du 'ong ba'i bzod par gtogs pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa med pa la sogs par bzod pas yid du 'ong ba'i bzod par gtogs pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Patience with the nonexistence of form, etc., is the three aspects of the pleasant patience.

original: chos kyi mchog tu gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsum ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog tu gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsum ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The three aspects of the roots of virtue belonging to the supreme mundane state are called concentration, etc.

original: dmigs @167b pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad du chos can yang bstan par rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dmigs @167b pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad du chos can yang bstan par rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: In all cases, is it not reasonable to teach the objective support, etc., as the possessor of the attributes?

original: de chos tsam du brtan pa nyid kyis bsgom pa ni mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de chos tsam du brtan pa nyid kyis bsgom pa ni mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: Since it is only the stability of the mere attributes that is cultivated, it is unreasonable.

original: dmigs pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba der ni chos dang chos can yod pas gzhan dag la sgra'i dbye bas don ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba der ni chos dang chos can yod pas gzhan dag la sgra'i dbye bas don ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “except for” refers to the subject and predicate, because the meaning is indicated by the division of the term in other cases.🔽The term that expresses the subject and predicate that are distinguished indicates the object that is expressed in words.

original: khyad par du byas pa'i chos dang chos can gyi tshig tu rjod par byed pa gang yin pa'i sgra des dmigs pa tshig tu brjod par bya ba yin na zhes bya ba 'dir dmigs pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin la des na don ni 'di yin
analyzed: khyad par du byas pa'i chos dang chos can gyi tshig tu rjod par byed pa gang yin pa'i sgra des dmigs pa tshig tu brjod par bya ba yin na zhes bya ba 'dir dmigs pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin la des na don ni 'di yin
translated: Here the object is merely an illustration, and the meaning is this:

original: te / dmigs pa dang rnam pa brjod pa yang khyad par du byas pa'i tshig gis yin te /
analyzed: te / dmigs pa dang rnam pa brjod pa yang khyad par du byas pa'i tshig gis yin te /
translated: The object and the expression of the aspect are also distinguished by the term.

original: rnam pa mngon zhen la sogs 'gog / ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa dang dmigs pa'i chos can kun tu drangs pa lta bur thams cad du bshad pa yin par nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ston pa brjod pa'i rab tu byed pa las
analyzed: rnam pa mngon zhen la sogs 'gog / ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa dang dmigs pa'i chos can kun tu drangs pa lta bur thams cad du bshad pa yin par nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ston pa brjod pa'i rab tu byed pa las
translated: This is taught in the Topic Divisions:🔽“What is the universal basis?

original: ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pa yin no //
translated: It is the basis of all phenomena.”🔽In this way, the universal basis is taught.

original: de lta na yang ci der chos brjod pas chos can rtogs pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci der chos brjod pas chos can rtogs pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: In that case, is the subject understood through the expression of the phenomenon?

original: khyad par gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The text says, “Other distinctions . . .”

original: khyad par gzhan ni ris mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan ni ris mi mthun pa'o //
translated: Other distinctions are dissimilar classes.

original: de rnams spong ba dang mi spong ba ni ldog pa dang mi ldog pa ma gtogs pa 'di dag la chos dang chos can gyi khyad par ni yang dag par na 'ga' yang med do zhes lugs las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bstan bcos kyi rigs
analyzed: de rnams spong ba dang mi spong ba ni ldog pa dang mi ldog pa ma gtogs pa 'di dag la chos dang chos can gyi khyad par ni yang dag par na 'ga' yang med do zhes lugs las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bstan bcos kyi rigs
translated: Except for the abandonment and nonabandonment of those, there is no distinction between the phenomenon and the subject in reality.

original: pas so // gal te de kho na nyid du na chos dang chos can gyi khyad par yod na de'i tshe dngos po spyir yang mi 'gyur te so sor med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pas so // gal te de kho na nyid du na chos dang chos can gyi khyad par yod na de'i tshe dngos po spyir yang mi 'gyur te so sor med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If, in reality, there were a distinction between the phenomenon and the property possessor, then at that time, the thing would not be a generality because it would not exist individually.

original: de bas na 'di ni shing nyid dang 'dra bar 'dir yang gang du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhir gtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa ma smras pa der yang mi ldog pa'i sgo nas de dag ni der gtogs pa nyid yin par grags pa grub pas /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni shing nyid dang 'dra bar 'dir yang gang du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhir gtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa ma smras pa der yang mi ldog pa'i sgo nas de dag ni der gtogs pa nyid yin par grags pa grub pas /
translated: Therefore, just like the nature of a tree, here also, wherever the focal object and aspect that are included within the four noble truths are not mentioned, they are established as being included there by way of not being averted.

original: chos dang chos can dag gnyi ga med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pas rgol ba 'di ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: chos dang chos can dag gnyi ga med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pas rgol ba 'di ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the phenomenon and the property possessor are both not possible without the other, this objection is not suitable in any way.

original: don gyis kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la brten par 'gyur ba ni rnam pa gcig tu na zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyis kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la brten par 'gyur ba ni rnam pa gcig tu na zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: Also, by the meaning, it is based on the four noble truths. In one way, it is said:

original: @168a * // yang na tshig le'ur byas pa sdeb pa'i ngor zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i sdeb sbyor dang 'gal pa'i 'jigs pas tha dad par brjod kyang zhes bya ba chos can bden pa las kun tu drangs te /
analyzed: @168a * // yang na tshig le'ur byas pa sdeb pa'i ngor zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i sdeb sbyor dang 'gal pa'i 'jigs pas tha dad par brjod kyang zhes bya ba chos can bden pa las kun tu drangs te /
translated: Or, in the context of metrical composition, although they are expressed separately out of fear of contradicting the meter of metrical composition, the subject is drawn from the truth of suffering.

original: rnam pa mngon zhen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis dbye ba dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i chos kyi dbye ba smos pa yin na yang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa ni chos can yin la der gtogs pa kho na dmigs pa dang rnam pa chos
analyzed: rnam pa mngon zhen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis dbye ba dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i chos kyi dbye ba smos pa yin na yang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa ni chos can yin la der gtogs pa kho na dmigs pa dang rnam pa chos
translated: Although the differentiation of objects and aspects is mentioned by the words “manifesting attachment” and so on, the subject is the truth of suffering and so on, and the objects and aspects are its attributes.

original: yin no zhes 'chad pa po rnams kyis bshad pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yin no zhes 'chad pa po rnams kyis bshad pa shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as explained by the commentators.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa 'gog par byed pa'i bdag la sogs pa ni yang dag par skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba rim mam cig car dag gis don gyi bya ba byed par mi rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa 'gog par byed pa'i bdag la sogs pa ni yang dag par skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba rim mam cig car dag gis don gyi bya ba byed par mi rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i
translated: It is not tenable that the self and so on, which are refuted as being the basis of such things as manifest clinging, are the basis of the activity of the object, either sequentially or simultaneously, since they are said to be devoid of real arising and disintegration.

original: tshad mas rang gi ngo bo brtag pa ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar bsgrub pa dang dgag pas stong pa yin la /
analyzed: tshad mas rang gi ngo bo brtag pa ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar bsgrub pa dang dgag pas stong pa yin la /
translated: The valid cognition that analyzes their nature establishes that they are empty of affirmation and negation, like the horn of a donkey.

original: mngon par zhen pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag tu med pa'i phyir bdag la sogs pa rten yin par mi rigs kyi don gyis na bden pa la brten pa nyid yod do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag tu med pa'i phyir bdag la sogs pa rten yin par mi rigs kyi don gyis na bden pa la brten pa nyid yod do //
translated: Since they do not exist in either the conventional or the ultimate, it is not tenable that the self and so on are the basis of manifest clinging and so on. But in fact, they are the basis of the two truths.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden par yod pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden par yod pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that they exist conventionally.

original: 'og ma dag la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang du chos tsam zhig brten pa der thams cad du sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po kho na chos can yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og ma dag la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang du chos tsam zhig brten pa der thams cad du sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po kho na chos can yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the other [members of dependent origination].

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi ni gzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi ni gzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The four conceptualizations are stated in the verse beginning with “basis,” etc.

original: gzung bar rnam par rtog pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gzung bar rnam par rtog pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two conceptualizations of the apprehended:

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: gzhi ste srid pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir te 'dod chags la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gzhi ste srid pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir te 'dod chags la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: From the basis, because it is the activity of the continuum of existence. Attachment, etc. are the counteragents.

original: de'i gnyen po ni lam ste de bas na rnam pa gnyis la de dag gi dbye bas de mi re re zhing rnam pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni lam ste de bas na rnam pa gnyis la de dag gi dbye bas de mi re re zhing rnam pa dgu yin no //
translated: The counteragent to that is the path. Therefore, by the division of those two, each has nine aspects.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: rmongs dang phung sogs bye brag gis //
analyzed: rmongs dang phung sogs bye brag gis //
translated: From delusion, the aggregates, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang phung po la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang phung po la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: By the divisions of ignorance, etc., and by the divisions of the aggregates, etc.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni gzung bar zhes bya ba la sogs @168b pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni gzung bar zhes bya ba la sogs @168b pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verses is: “grasping, etc.”

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten can dang gnyen po'i rten can nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa la brten pa dang / sems bskyed pa la sogs pa kun brten pas //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten can dang gnyen po'i rten can nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa la brten pa dang / sems bskyed pa la sogs pa kun brten pas //
translated: “By the support of defilement and the support of the antidote” means: the support of defilement such as passion, etc., and the support of the antidote such as the generation of the thought of enlightenment, etc.

original: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //
analyzed: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //
translated: “By the basis and its antidote”

original: zhes bya ba yin no //🔽gzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no // gzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
translated: is the meaning.

original: zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: “The imagination of the apprehended is twofold” has been explained.

original: ma rig pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phung po la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / bla na med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phung po la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / bla na med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: “By the divisions of ignorance, etc., and of the purified aggregates, etc.” means: by the divisions of ignorance, etc., and by the divisions of the unsurpassed form, etc.

original: rmongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: “Delusion, etc.” has been explained.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni bdag sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni bdag sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The two kinds of conceptualization that apprehend are indicated by “self, etc.”

original: rdzas dang brtags pa'i rten can gyi //
analyzed: rdzas dang brtags pa'i rten can gyi //
translated: The two kinds of apprehension are asserted to be based on substance and imputation.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang skyes bu la gnas pa 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod ces bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang skyes bu la gnas pa 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod ces bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: “Based on substance and imputation” should be understood to mean that the two kinds of apprehension are based on the person and the individual.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni de yang re re zhing rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni de yang re re zhing rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: “Likewise” means that each of these is of nine kinds.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: bdag sogs rang dbang ngo bo dang // zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag sogs rang dbang ngo bo dang // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From “self, etc., independent essence.”

original: rang dbang can gyi bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rang dbang can gyi bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The view of a self that is independent is the mode of the view of self, etc.

original: phung sogs rten ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams la sogs pa la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni la la zhig gis btags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzas te gang zag go //
analyzed: phung sogs rten ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams la sogs pa la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro // tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni la la zhig gis btags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzas te gang zag go //
translated: The basis of the aggregates, etc., is the aggregates, the sense bases, the elements, etc., because they are the objects of apprehension.

original: tha snyad nyid du btags pa nyid kyis na btags pa ste skyes bu'o //
analyzed: tha snyad nyid du btags pa nyid kyis na btags pa ste skyes bu'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the person is a substance because it is an imputation, and the individual is an imputation because it is a convention.

original: de la dmigs pa ni de'i yul te zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //🔽bdag rang dbang can du phung po la sogs pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis na bdag rang dbang can dang phung po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni de'i yul te zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no // bdag rang dbang can du phung po la sogs pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis na bdag rang dbang can dang phung po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ste /
translated: The object of that is its object.🔽The self is the object of the aggregates, etc. because it is observed in dependence on the aggregates, etc.🔽The self is independent because it is the object of the aggregates, etc.

original: rang dbang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang dbang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: The self is independent because it is the object of the aggregates, etc.🔽The meaning of this is summarized in the following:

original: de la mdor bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba mang du yod na yang mdor bsdus na rnam par rtog pa bzhi'i don bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la mdor bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba mang du yod na yang mdor bsdus na rnam par rtog pa bzhi'i don bshad par bya'o //
translated: Although there is much to be said, in brief the meaning of the four misconceptions should be explained.🔽The first two misconceptions concern the apprehended object.

original: re zhig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni gzung bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa @169a * //🔽smos pa yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni gzung bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa @169a * // smos pa yin te /
translated: The first two misconceptions concern the apprehended object.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhi'i rten can ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhi'i rten can ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The four afflicted views are the basis of attachment, etc.

original: ma rig pa ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is non-knowledge.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The aggregates of form, etc. are form, feeling, etc.

original: ming ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
analyzed: ming ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
translated: Name is the four aggregates that are not form.

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: Form is the aggregate of form.

original: 'di dag la mngon par zhen pa ni ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la mngon par zhen pa ni ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Clinging to them is clinging to name-and-form.

original: mtha' gnyis la chags pa ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis la chags pa ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' la zhen pa'o //
translated: Attachment to the two extremes is clinging to the extremes of eternalism and annihilationism.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pas so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pas so //
translated: Affliction is by desire, etc.

original: rnam par byang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Purification is nirvana.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'o /
translated: Non-abiding in the noble path is clinging to the path of seeing, etc.

original: dmigs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Objectification is clinging to form, etc.

original: bdag la sogs pa ni 'dod chags dang gzhan du 'du shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa ni 'dod chags dang gzhan du 'du shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Self, etc. is desire, discrimination of another, etc.

original: rnam par dag pa bskyed pa la sogs pa ni 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa ma skyed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa bskyed pa la sogs pa ni 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa ma skyed pa ste /
translated: The purity of the generation of the thought of enlightenment, etc. is the non-generation of the purity of the three spheres.

original: de yang dag par sbyang ba'i rnam par dag pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang dag par sbyang ba'i rnam par dag pa gsum mo //
translated: And that is the purity of the purification of the three.

original: de la gzung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi lam la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi lam la gnas pa'o //
translated: Therein, the purity of the object is the purity of the objective supports. The purity of the subject is the purity of the aspects. The purity of the result is the purity of the result of the purification.

original: phung po ni phung po rnams so //
analyzed: phung po ni phung po rnams so //
translated: The aggregates are the five aggregates.

original: skye ba'i sgo ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams so //
translated: The sense-fields are the sense-fields of eye, etc.

original: rigs ni khams bco brgyad do //
analyzed: rigs ni khams bco brgyad do //
translated: The elements are the eighteen elements.

original: skye ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Dependent origination is the dependent origination.

original: stong pa nyid ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is the selflessness.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the perfections is the very enlightenment.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam ni gsum ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam ni gsum ste /
translated: The path is the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path of no-more-learning.

original: de la gzung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa ni de dag go //
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa ni de dag go //
translated: Therein, the purity of the object is the purity of the objective supports. The purity of the subject is the purity of the aspects. The purity of the result is the purity of the result of the purification.

original: kha cig na re de la gzhi thams cad pa kho na dang por gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin la rnam par byang ba'i gzhi kho na ni gnyis pa yin pas 'di dag ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di gnyis khyad par yin no //
analyzed: kha cig na re de la gzhi thams cad pa kho na dang por gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin la rnam par byang ba'i gzhi kho na ni gnyis pa yin pas 'di dag ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di gnyis khyad par yin no //
translated: Some say: The first is the conception of the apprehended that holds the universal basis alone as its object. The second is the conception of the apprehended that holds the basis of purification alone as its object.

original: de ltar byas na gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gang yin pa gnyis pa yang de yin no //🔽zhes snga ma ston par byas pa yin la re @169b zhig dang po gang yin pa de gnyis pa yang yin te 'di ltar gzhi thams cad pa dang po gzung ba'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur gyi gnyis pa ni dang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar byas na gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gang yin pa gnyis pa yang de yin no // zhes snga ma ston par byas pa yin la re @169b zhig dang po gang yin pa de gnyis pa yang yin te 'di ltar gzhi thams cad pa dang po gzung ba'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur gyi gnyis pa ni dang po ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the first conception of the apprehended is also the second.

original: 'di ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ni rnam par byang ba tsam la brten pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ni rnam par byang ba tsam la brten pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This is taught in the first line, which states that the first is also the second. The first is the conception of the apprehended that holds the universal basis as its object. The second is not the first because the second conception of the apprehended is based on mere purification.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di gnyis kyi dbye ba ni gzhan rnam par dpyad pa'i don gyis dang po ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi la rten pa yin la gnyis pa ni rnam par byang ba tsam la brten pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di gnyis kyi dbye ba ni gzhan rnam par dpyad pa'i don gyis dang po ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi la rten pa yin la gnyis pa ni rnam par byang ba tsam la brten pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The difference between these two is that the first is based on the foundation of defilement, while the second is based on mere purification.

original: da ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'dzin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'dzin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Now, the conception of the apprehender is stated with “the conception of the apprehender,” and so on.

original: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can de ni gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid dang / cha shas med pa nyid dang / rgyur gyur pa nyid dang lta ba po yin pa nyid kyis na bdag rang dbang can dang gcig dang rgyu dang lta ba bo'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can de ni gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid dang / cha shas med pa nyid dang / rgyur gyur pa nyid dang lta ba po yin pa nyid kyis na bdag rang dbang can dang gcig dang rgyu dang lta ba bo'o //
translated: The conception of the apprehender that is based on the substantial existence of the person imputed by others is the conception of the self as independent, single, a cause, and a seer.

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rten gyi bdag nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis lnga ste /
translated: The first is the conceptualization of the basis that is the nature of affliction.

analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgu po 'di dag gang yin pa des bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The nine conceptualizations of grasping are included in these.
