analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can phung po ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of grasping permanence is based on the imputed existence of a person. The aggregates are form, etc.

original: skye mched ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can mig dang gzugs la sogs pa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: skye mched ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can mig dang gzugs la sogs pa bcu gnyis so //
translated: The sense spheres are the twelve, such as the eye and form, that are of the nature of the internal and external.

original: khams ni mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bco brgyad do //
analyzed: khams ni mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bco brgyad do //
translated: The elements are eighteen in number, being classified according to the eye element, form element, eye consciousness element, etc.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni grags par zad do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni grags par zad do //
translated: Dependent origination is well known.

original: rnam par byang ba ni mya ngan las 'das @170a * //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni mya ngan las 'das @170a * //
translated: Purification is nirvana.

original: pa'o // mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par dang mi slob ba'i lam ste bzhi'o //🔽de rnams dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa 'di rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gzhi'i dro ba la sogs pa bzhi dang grangs ji lta ba bzhin du ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'o // mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par dang mi slob ba'i lam ste bzhi'o // de rnams dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa 'di rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gzhi'i dro ba la sogs pa bzhi dang grangs ji lta ba bzhin du ldan pa yin no //
translated: The four are the path of insight, the path of cultivation, the special path, and the path of no-more-learning.🔽The four kinds of conceptualization that have the nature of grasping these are the four foundations of the bodhisattva's heat, etc., which are aids to penetration, in accordance with their number.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The four kinds of conceptualization that have the nature of grasping these are the four foundations of the bodhisattva's heat, etc., which are aids to penetration, in accordance with their number.

original: rnam par rtog pa mtha' yas pa yin na yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir lam du gtogs pa kho na'i rnam par rtog pa bstan gyi de las gzhan pa ni ci yang mi byed pa nyid kyis na spang bar bya ba ma yin zhing blang bar
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mtha' yas pa yin na yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir lam du gtogs pa kho na'i rnam par rtog pa bstan gyi de las gzhan pa ni ci yang mi byed pa nyid kyis na spang bar bya ba ma yin zhing blang bar
translated: Although there are infinite conceptualizations, only those conceptualizations that are included in the path are taught, because they are not adverse. Those that are not included in the path are not taught, because they are not to be adopted or rejected.

original: bya ba ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: They are not to be rejected because they are not to be done, and they are not to be adopted because they are not to be done.

original: tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba dang mthun par zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba dang mthun par zhes bya ba ni //
translated: In accordance with the application of the verse.

original: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis yongs su 'dzin pa sngar gsungs nas yang mjug thogs su bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis yongs su 'dzin pa sngar gsungs nas yang mjug thogs su bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ba'o //
translated: The verse is applied in the order of objective support and aspect, etc., and after the complete explanation, the intermediate verse is applied immediately after.

original: yang na de'i stobs kyi ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na de'i stobs kyi ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Or, it is applied in the sense that they become distinguished as explained by the power of those.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa bzhi po nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir sems mi 'gong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa bzhi po nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir sems mi 'gong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In order to teach the four kinds of conceptions that are not common to the Sravakas, etc. , by the power of their retention, he says, his mind is not cowed, etc.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi ston pa po ni phyi dang nang du lta ba yod pas de lta bu ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi ston pa po ni phyi dang nang du lta ba yod pas de lta bu ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The Teacher of the Sravakas is not like that, because he has the view of external and internal things.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid lam de ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes thos pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid lam de ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes thos pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't it the case that the Lord himself teaches that path?

original: gal te de rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'dra bar mi dmigs pa la dmigs par 'gyur na bden mod kyi 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'dra bar mi dmigs pa la dmigs par 'gyur na bden mod kyi 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If they were like the Bodhisattvas, they would have the nonapprehension of nonapprehension, but that is not the case.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba de'i dbang gis dngos po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i lam rang gi bsam pa'i dbang gis zhugs pa yin du zin na yang 'on kyang yang dag par 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba de'i dbang gis dngos po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i lam rang gi bsam pa'i dbang gis zhugs pa yin du zin na yang 'on kyang yang dag par 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Or else, even if the Lord, without conceptualization, enters the path of impermanence, etc., of things by the power of his own thought, still, there is no grasping of reality,

original: yang dag par ston par mdzad na yang de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par ston par mdzad na yang de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, even though he teaches reality, it becomes otherwise by the power of his thought.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi nyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi nyes pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the Lord is not at fault,

original: sems can gyi bsam @170b pa'i dbang gi skabs dang 'dra bar theg pa chen po la 'dzeg par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par ston par mdzad pa yin na yang de ltar smon lam btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam @170b pa'i dbang gi skabs dang 'dra bar theg pa chen po la 'dzeg par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par ston par mdzad pa yin na yang de ltar smon lam btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, even though he teaches reality in order to cause beings to enter the Mahayana, he does so in accordance with the power of their thoughts, since they have made such aspirations.

original: nyan thos nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta ba skyes pa yin te gang gi phyir rang gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi dbang gis srid pa thog ma med pa nas rnam par bsgos pa'i bag chags kyis bcom ldan 'das don dam par dngos po yod par
analyzed: nyan thos nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta ba skyes pa yin te gang gi phyir rang gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi dbang gis srid pa thog ma med pa nas rnam par bsgos pa'i bag chags kyis bcom ldan 'das don dam par dngos po yod par
translated: The śrāvakas are born with an incorrect view because, due to their own pride, they are destroyed by the latent tendencies that have been infused since beginningless time.🔽

original: zhal gyis bzhes pa dang de bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i lam gyis shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba la zhugs par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhal gyis bzhes pa dang de bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i lam gyis shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba la zhugs par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The śrāvakas have generated the wrong view of reality because, due to the power of their manifest pride, they have been defeated by the latent propensities that have been infused since beginningless time. They understand that the Bhagavat accepts that ultimately things exist, and that they engage in the elimination of the obscurations to omniscience through the path of impermanence and so on.

original: de lta na ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that ordinary beings would also be like that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di nyid las gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di nyid las gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is explained below in the lines, “Other phenomena also exist,” and so on.

original: bsgrub pa dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the lines, “Those who possess the proof,” and so on,

original: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug ste //
analyzed: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug ste //
translated: there are six qualities of realization.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba'i chos rnam pa drug gi rten zhes bya ba gzhi la ni byang chub sems dpa' rgyud kyi rigs yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba'i chos rnam pa drug gi rten zhes bya ba gzhi la ni byang chub sems dpa' rgyud kyi rigs yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: The basis is the support of the six kinds of things to be understood. It should be explained that the bodhisattva is the spiritual gene.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rten pa'i rtogs par bya ba'i chos gang zhig yin zhes rtogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rten pa'i rtogs par bya ba'i chos gang zhig yin zhes rtogs pa la /
translated: If one asks, What is the bodhisattva, the thing to be understood that is the support?

analyzed: der de bskyed pa'i rim gyis chos de bstan par bya ba'i phyir gnyen po dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show that thing by the process of its generation, he says the antidote, etc.

original: gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang // zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i rab kyi mthar thug pa la gnas pa'i sems kyi khyad par dang des spang bar bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag go //🔽gnyen po dang mi mthun pa de dag spangs pa ste /

translated: The antidote and abandonment are the special mental states of the bodhisattva who is abiding in the final perfection of meditation, and the adverse entities that are to be abandoned by that.🔽The abandonment of those antidotes and adverse entities is their complete exhaustion.

original: de dag yongs su gtugs pa ni de'i rnam par rtog pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yongs su gtugs pa ni de'i rnam par rtog pa zad pa'o //

analyzed: de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The origination and cessation of the antidote and the object

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas su gyur nas gzhan gyi don bya'o zhes sngon gyi smon lam dang de la sbyin pa la sogs pa thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa ste /🔽sems mi 'gong ba nyid la sogs pa de'i stobs kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas shing srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa de'i mtshan nyid ste de'i bdag nyid can gyi shes rab dang snying rje dag gis shes rab dang
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas su gyur nas gzhan gyi don bya'o zhes sngon gyi smon lam dang de la sbyin pa la sogs pa thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa ste / sems mi 'gong ba nyid la sogs pa de'i stobs kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas shing srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa de'i mtshan nyid ste de'i bdag nyid can gyi shes rab dang snying rje dag gis shes rab dang
translated: The power of that former aspiration and the skill in means such as generosity, etc.,🔽are the characteristics of the non-abiding in cyclic existence and nirvana, and the non-abiding in existence and peace, by the power of that non-discouragement, etc.

original: thabs kyi ye shes skye @171b ba'i phyir //
analyzed: thabs kyi ye shes skye @171b ba'i phyir //
translated: The wisdom and compassion that have that as their nature are the wisdom and method knowledges that arise.

original: shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is explained that “wisdom and compassion are possessed.”

original: de'i 'og tu de dag skyes pas zhes bya ba shes rab dang thabs kyi ye shes gnyis skyes pas nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mongs ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag skyes pas zhes bya ba shes rab dang thabs kyi ye shes gnyis skyes pas nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mongs ma yin pa ste /
translated: Then, after that, by the arising of those two, the wisdom of wisdom and method arises, and it is not shared in common with sravakas, etc.

original: chos gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa ma yin ba stobs bcu la sogs pa de skye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: chos gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa ma yin ba stobs bcu la sogs pa de skye ba'i phyir //
translated: The Dharma that is not common to the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, such as the ten powers, is generated.

original: slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The disciples are uncommon.🔽After that, the disciples who do not transgress the conduct of the disciples according to their thoughts, such as remaining in the world, are taught through indirect teachings.

original: de'i 'og tu bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gdul bya rnams kyi spyod pa las ma 'das pas bzhugs pa la sogs pa la ldem por dgongs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba gal te dang por chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa thos pas skrag nas
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gdul bya rnams kyi spyod pa las ma 'das pas bzhugs pa la sogs pa la ldem por dgongs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba gal te dang por chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa thos pas skrag nas
translated: If they are frightened by first hearing about the selflessness of phenomena and persons, they will remain in the views of the tirthikas.

original: mu stegs pa'i lta ba nyid la gnas par 'gyur bas snying rjes bu gcig pa dang 'dra bar mchod sbyin la sogs pa la srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang thog ma med pa'i dus na goms pa'i rtag pa dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lta ba las
analyzed: mu stegs pa'i lta ba nyid la gnas par 'gyur bas snying rjes bu gcig pa dang 'dra bar mchod sbyin la sogs pa la srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang thog ma med pa'i dus na goms pa'i rtag pa dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lta ba las
translated: Out of compassion, like a father to his only son, they are taught to kill in sacrifices and so on and to engage in the views of permanence, Brahma and so on, which they have been accustomed to since beginningless time.

original: bzlog nas theg pa gnyis las gsungs pa'i dge ba bcu'i gzhi dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i lta ba la bcug cing ngal so ba sngon du 'gro bas theg pa chen po la gzhag pa'i bsam pa'i thabs kyis de ltar theg pa gsum gyi lam la bkod
analyzed: bzlog nas theg pa gnyis las gsungs pa'i dge ba bcu'i gzhi dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i lta ba la bcug cing ngal so ba sngon du 'gro bas theg pa chen po la gzhag pa'i bsam pa'i thabs kyis de ltar theg pa gsum gyi lam la bkod
translated: Having turned them away from the two vehicles, he establishes them in the Great Vehicle by the method of the resolve to place them in the ten spheres of the wholesome taught in the two vehicles, in the view of impermanence, etc., and in the Great Vehicle, preceded by the rest from the fatigue of those practices.

original: pa gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid kyis gzhan gyi don gyi go rims bzhin du de las 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid kyis gzhan gyi don gyi go rims bzhin du de las 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The order of the benefit for others is explained in accordance with the order of the arising of the knowledge of the benefit for others, which is characterized by the establishment of beings in the path of the three vehicles.🔽The order of the benefit for others

original: gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: is explained in accordance with the order of the arising of the knowledge of the benefit for others.

original: de'i 'og tu 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du phyi'i mtshan ma dang 'bad pa dag stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub par gzhan gyi don gyi ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du phyi'i mtshan ma dang 'bad pa dag stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub par gzhan gyi don gyi ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: After that, for as long as cyclic existence lasts, the knowledge of the benefit for others arises effortlessly and signlessly, because the external signs and efforts are empty.

original: ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar //
analyzed: ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar //
translated: The knowledge of the benefit for others

original: zhes bya bar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bar bshad pa yin no //
translated: is explained as being effortless.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: This is easy to understand.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar chos thams cad la zhen pa med pa nyid du slob pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar chos thams cad la zhen pa med pa nyid du slob pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is not the bodhisattva trained in the very absence of attachment to all things, like a magical person?

original: ji ltar yang dag par na rten yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par na rten yod pa yin te /
translated: How can there be a real basis?🔽That is not reasonable.

original: de ni mi rigs so zhes rtog pa la kun rdzob tu gtan la dbab pa ni bsgrub pa'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs so zhes rtog pa la kun rdzob tu gtan la dbab pa ni bsgrub pa'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The establishment of the conventional is stated in the verse beginning with “The object of attainment, etc.”

original: bsgrub pa'i chos ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i chos ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object of attainment is the generation of the will to enlightenment, etc.

original: de'i gnas skabs kyi dbye ba ni gdul bya'i bye brag las rang bzhin @172a * //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs kyi dbye ba ni gdul bya'i bye brag las rang bzhin @172a * //
translated: The divisions of its states are distinguished by the various disciples.

original: phye ba'o // dbye ba des yang dag par na de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin mi rigs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kho na ji skad du bshad pa'i chos kyi gzhir gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: phye ba'o // dbye ba des yang dag par na de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin mi rigs pas chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kho na ji skad du bshad pa'i chos kyi gzhir gyur pa yin te /
translated: By that division, since another nature is not reasonable in reality, the nature of the Dharma-dhātu alone is the basis of the Dharma as it has been explained.

original: gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos drug gi rten yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos drug gi rten yin no //
translated: It is the basis of the six dharmas, beginning with “antidote” and “abandonment.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu gsum la rigs zhes bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu gsum la rigs zhes bstan to //
translated: The thirteen kinds of bodhisattva are taught to be the family.

original: zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig tu na yon tan bskyed pa'i don gyis na kun rdzob tu rigs zhes bya'o zhes yum las bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig tu na yon tan bskyed pa'i don gyis na kun rdzob tu rigs zhes bya'o zhes yum las bshad do //
translated: In terms of etymology, it is called the family because it generates good qualities.🔽The first half of the verse that will be explained below beginning with “the expanse of reality” teaches the prior position.

original: chos kyi dbyings la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'og nas bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed snga mas ni phyogs snga ma ston pa'i zur gyis rnam par 'byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /🔽yang dag par na de las gzhan pa'i rgyu yod par mi 'thad pas chos kyi dbyings kho na ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'og nas bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed snga mas ni phyogs snga ma ston pa'i zur gyis rnam par 'byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te / yang dag par na de las gzhan pa'i rgyu yod par mi 'thad pas chos kyi dbyings kho na ste /
translated: The distinction is made by saying “if” and so on.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid 'phags pa'i chos rtogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid 'phags pa'i chos rtogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is not tenable that there is another cause apart from that, the expanse of reality is the cause of attaining the qualities such as the ten powers, the qualities of the āryas, because it is the nondual exalted wisdom itself.

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid can gyi //
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid can gyi //
translated: If it were the nature of that,

original: zhes bya ba chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: This is the nature of the Reality limit.

original: bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni stobs bcu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni stobs bcu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The unsurpassed qualities of the Buddha are the ten powers, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa med pas shes pa tsam gyi tshul lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa med pas shes pa tsam gyi tshul lo //
translated: The bodhisattva who is naturally abiding is the method of mere consciousness, because of the non-existence of the aggregates, etc.

original: rigs ni chos nyid du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: rigs ni chos nyid du brtags pa'o //
translated: The family is the imagination of what is real.

original: ci la yod pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ci la yod pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: How is it that it exists in that?

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings la dbye ba med pa las cir 'gyur zhen /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings la dbye ba med pa las cir 'gyur zhen /
translated: At that time, how is it that the Reality limit is without differentiation?

original: 'di ni rang bzhin gyis gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin gyis gnas pa yin te /
translated: This is naturally abiding,

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud pa'i chos nyid las thob pa yin la /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud pa'i chos nyid las thob pa yin la /
translated: because it is obtained from the reality that has been transmitted since beginningless time.

original: 'di ni tshogs pa las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshogs pa las byung ba yin te /
translated: This is the family that arises from the collection,

original: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba goms pa las thob pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba goms pa las thob pa yin no //
translated: because it is obtained from the cultivation of former roots of virtue.

original: 'di ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges pa yin te /
translated: This is the family that is ascertained as the Sravaka, the Pratyekabuddha, and the Tathagata,🔽because it is obtained from the cultivation of the roots of virtue that are conducive to those.

original: rkyen chen pos kyang bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen chen pos kyang bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they cannot be averted even by great conditions.

original: 'di ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs ma nges pa yin te /
translated: This is the unfixed potential of the sravaka and so on.

original: rkyen gyis bzlog tu 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir rigs tha dad pa zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen gyis bzlog tu 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir rigs tha dad pa zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical to say that it is a different potential, because it is asserted that it can be averted by conditions.

original: de ltar na @172b byang chub sems dpa' kho na ma yin no zhes bya ba byang chub sems 'ba' zhig rigs yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ltar na @172b byang chub sems dpa' kho na ma yin no zhes bya ba byang chub sems 'ba' zhig rigs yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
translated: Thus, it is illogical to say that the bodhisattva alone has the potential, because the potential of the sravaka and so on is also asserted to be a potential here.🔽This is the thought of the opponent.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyang rigs nyid du 'dir 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rgol ba po gzhan gyi bsam pa yin no snyam pa zhes bya ba de ltar skye bo blo dman pa lung mngon par mi shes pa de rnams kyi ngor
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyang rigs nyid du 'dir 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rgol ba po gzhan gyi bsam pa yin no snyam pa zhes bya ba de ltar skye bo blo dman pa lung mngon par mi shes pa de rnams kyi ngor
translated: The author of the commentary says that this is the thought of those of inferior intellect who do not understand the scriptures.

original: zhes bya ba la brtse ba'i dbang gis de mi shes pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba sngar gsungs shing rgol ba bslangs nas bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la brtse ba'i dbang gis de mi shes pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba sngar gsungs shing rgol ba bslangs nas bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The verse in the middle is supplied by the statement of the objection, anticipating the question, “Why is it necessary to remove the ignorance of those who are not confused?”

original: de la rgol ba'i don phyed snga ma'i lan ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rgol ba'i don phyed snga ma'i lan ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The answer to the first half of the objection is stated in the line, “Just as, etc.”

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam ste de rtogs pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du shes pa'i go rims kyis ji ltar te ji lta bar dmigs pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpas chos🔽kyi dbyings la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam ste de rtogs pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du shes pa'i go rims kyis ji ltar te ji lta bar dmigs pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpas chos kyi dbyings la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The śrāvaka vehicle, etc., is the path of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha. The phrase “by the order of understanding” means by the order of understanding the higher and higher. Just as, i.e., in the same way that the śrāvakas, etc., understand the reality realm, so the bodhisattvas should understand the reality realm.

original: de bzhin du de dang 'dra bar 'phags pa'i chos rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de dang 'dra bar 'phags pa'i chos rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: The rest of the verse is supplied by the phrase “in order to realize the noble qualities.”

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: rigs nyid du tha snyad 'dogs so zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' kho na nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: rigs nyid du tha snyad 'dogs so zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' kho na nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su tha snyad du byed do //
translated: The term “lineage” is used for the bodhisattva alone, but not for śrāvakas and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos kyi dbyings kho na rgyur gyur par rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kho na rgyur gyur par rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the dharmadhātu alone is posited as the cause,

original: yang dag par na de las gzhan pa'i rgyu yod par mi 'thad pas theg pa gsum gyis rigs kyi rgyu nyid byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kho na yin par mdo sde las bstan pa'i phyir lung las chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin byang
analyzed: yang dag par na de las gzhan pa'i rgyu yod par mi 'thad pas theg pa gsum gyis rigs kyi rgyu nyid byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kho na yin par mdo sde las bstan pa'i phyir lung las chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin byang
translated: and since it is untenable that there is another cause apart from that, the sūtras teach that the cause of the lineage of the three vehicles is the bodhisattva alone, the nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: chub sems dpa'i rgyur byas nas spyir theg pa gsum 'bras bu yin pa la brten te /
analyzed: chub sems dpa'i rgyur byas nas spyir theg pa gsum 'bras bu yin pa la brten te /
translated: Therefore, based on the result of the three vehicles in general,🔽the sūtras say:

original: ji ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the lineages of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha are determined, so too the lineage of the Tathāgata is known in the state of the bodhisattva.

original: zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no //🔽theg pa gsum dbyer med pa'i phyogs @173a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no // theg pa gsum dbyer med pa'i phyogs @173a * //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: ltar na yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis khas blangs pa de rigs pa'i dpes byang chub sems dpa' rigs su rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de'i phyir dpe ma grub pa'i dogs pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: ltar na yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis khas blangs pa de rigs pa'i dpes byang chub sems dpa' rigs su rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de'i phyir dpe ma grub pa'i dogs pa mi bya'o //
translated: Even from the perspective of the non-differentiation of the three vehicles, since the two vehicles of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha are accepted, one should not doubt that the example is not established, because the bodhisattva is established as a lineage by that reasoning.

original: lan cig kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lan gzhan du gsungs te zhes bya ba ni yang dag par na rten dang brten pa po'i dngos po yod pa ma yin na yang chos kyi dbyings thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir theg pa gsum po
analyzed: lan cig kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lan gzhan du gsungs te zhes bya ba ni yang dag par na rten dang brten pa po'i dngos po yod pa ma yin na yang chos kyi dbyings thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir theg pa gsum po
translated: The answer is given in the line beginning with even once, and so on. The line another answer is given means that even though in reality the relationship of support and supported does not exist, because of the uniqueness of the dharmadhātu, the three vehicles are taught in order to guide those to be guided.

original: mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan brten pa po nyid du yongs su brtags nas /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan brten pa po nyid du yongs su brtags nas /
translated: Having thoroughly investigated the qualities of freedom from attachment and so on as the basis of the path,🔽the verse's second half replies that the three vehicles are posited in terms of the spiritual potential, stating:🔽The three vehicles are posited in terms of the spiritual potential of the three families.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yin par rnam par gzhag pa'i skabs su theg pa gsum gyi rigs su rnam par gzhag pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed 'og mas lan btab pa ni brten pa'i chos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yin par rnam par gzhag pa'i skabs su theg pa gsum gyi rigs su rnam par gzhag pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed 'og mas lan btab pa ni brten pa'i chos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since the sutras state:

original: lung las 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: lung las 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: All arya persons are distinguished by the unconditioned.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang po kho nar rigs brjod par bya ba yin te sems bskyed pa dang / thar pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni de sngon du 'gro ba ma yin nam ji ltar na de ltar bshad /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang po kho nar rigs brjod par bya ba yin te sems bskyed pa dang / thar pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni de sngon du 'gro ba ma yin nam ji ltar na de ltar bshad /
translated: The spiritual potential must be mentioned first, since the generation of the mind, the state of liberation and the factors conducive to penetration are preceded by it.

original: bden mod kyi 'di ni don gyi go rims yin la 'di yang bstan pa'i go rims yin te /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'di ni don gyi go rims yin la 'di yang bstan pa'i go rims yin te /
translated: True, but this is the order of the meaning, and this is also the order of the teaching.

original: 'bras bu gang yin pa bstan nas de'i 'og tu rgyu bstan pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin pa bstan nas de'i 'og tu rgyu bstan pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Having taught the result, he then taught the cause, so there is no fault.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i bsgrub pa ste sems bskyed pa la sogs par mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i bsgrub pa ste sems bskyed pa la sogs par mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment as explained is the generation of the mind and so on, characterized by non-apprehension, as explained before.

original: de'i rten du gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni re zhig dang por zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rten du gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni re zhig dang por zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning The basis for that and so on is stated by First of all, and so on.

original: dang por sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni thog mar nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong du bshad pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ste blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba dang btang snyoms su bya ba'i gnas rnams
analyzed: dang por sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni thog mar nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong du bshad pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ste blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba dang btang snyoms su bya ba'i gnas rnams
translated: First of all, the application is the initial explanation shared with the śrāvakas and others of the wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral, which are the bases to be adopted, rejected, and indifferent to.

original: so // gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: so // gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: go rims bzhin du dge sbyong gi tshul nyid dang srog gcod pa nyid dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i lus kyi las la sogs @173b pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du dge sbyong gi tshul nyid dang srog gcod pa nyid dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i lus kyi las la sogs @173b pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: respectively, they are the nature of the spiritual life, the nature of killing, and the nature of neutral physical karma, and so on.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ni dri ma med pa'i lam dang / bsam bzhin du 'khrul pa med par gzhan gyi srog gcod pa dang shes bzhin ma yin pa'i lus kyi nyes par spyod pa'i las rnams so //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ni dri ma med pa'i lam dang / bsam bzhin du 'khrul pa med par gzhan gyi srog gcod pa dang shes bzhin ma yin pa'i lus kyi nyes par spyod pa'i las rnams so //
translated: The spiritual life is the uncontaminated path, the nature of killing is the intentional killing of another, and neutral physical karma is non-revealing form.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni re re zhing sbyar te /🔽tshul khrims dang / ma byin par len pa dang / ngag gi nyes par spyod pa'i las la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni re re zhing sbyar te / tshul khrims dang / ma byin par len pa dang / ngag gi nyes par spyod pa'i las la sogs pa ste /
translated: The term “and so on” is applied to each of these three.

original: chos gsum po de dag go //
analyzed: chos gsum po de dag go //
translated: Morality, taking what is not given, verbal misdeeds, and so on are the three dharmas.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag nyid ces bya ba sngar bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag nyid ces bya ba sngar bshad pa rnams so //
translated: After that, “those very” refers to those previously explained.

original: lhag ma rnams zhes bya ba sa bon rul ba dang 'dra ba nyid kyis na lung du ma bstan pa dor la gang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten pa la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba bzhi nyid
analyzed: lhag ma rnams zhes bya ba sa bon rul ba dang 'dra ba nyid kyis na lung du ma bstan pa dor la gang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten pa la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis su dbye ba bzhi nyid
translated: The rest are of two types, mundane and supramundane, because they are like rotten seeds, i.e., indeterminate.

original: kyis zhes bya ba de rnams nyed re re zhing 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i dbye bas phung po rnam pa bzhi nyid do //
analyzed: kyis zhes bya ba de rnams nyed re re zhing 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i dbye bas phung po rnam pa bzhi nyid do //
translated: The four aggregates are of four types each, because they are divided into mundane, supramundane, with-outflows, and without-outflows.

original: de ni grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa rnams te /
analyzed: de ni grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa rnams te /
translated: They are mundane, etc., in order, because they are included in the mundane path,

original: byis pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: i.e., they are the aggregates of the ordinary person, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: They are supramundane, etc., because they are included in the supramundane noble path,

original: 'phags pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: i.e., they are the aggregates of the noble one, etc.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis na 'jig rten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa ste /🔽bdag tu lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis na 'jig rten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa ste / bdag tu lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because it is not the antidote to the view of self, it is mundane.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po nyid yin pas na der lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po nyid yin pas na der lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because it is the antidote to the view of self, it is the view of no-self.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa ste bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa ste bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, there are four types: mundane, supramundane, contaminated, and uncontaminated.

original: rgyu'i lhan cig byed pa las skyes pa'i phyir rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i lhan cig byed pa las skyes pa'i phyir rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Because it arises from the co-operating cause of a cause, it is called dependent on a cause.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa bsam pas rang nyid skye ba'i phyir rgyu la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa bsam pas rang nyid skye ba'i phyir rgyu la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis so //
translated: Because it arises by itself through the power of affliction, etc., it is called not dependent on a cause. Thus, there are two types: conditioned and unconditioned.

original: 'phags pa'i skye bo dang zhes bya ba smos pa la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyi rgyud las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye bo dang zhes bya ba smos pa la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyi rgyud las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “and the noble ones” means that they arise from the mind of the perfect Buddha.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud las byung ba'i chos @174a * //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud las byung ba'i chos @174a * //
translated: The phrase “the Dharma that is the essence of the Buddha’s mind” means that they arise from the mind of the perfect Buddha.

original: can no // stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te de ltar gcig yin no //
analyzed: can no // stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te de ltar gcig yin no //
translated: The ten powers are the power of knowledge regarding proper and improper conditions.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgra ni phung po la sogs pa re re zhing sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgra ni phung po la sogs pa re re zhing sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The phrase “such things” refers to the aggregates, etc.

original: skye mched dang gzugs med pa'i skye mched rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i khams dang / stong pa nyid dang / gzugs med pa dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang gzugs med pa'i skye mched rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i khams dang / stong pa nyid dang / gzugs med pa dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “such things” refers to the sense bases, the formless meditative absorptions, the correct exertions, the elements of form, etc., emptiness, the formless states, the fearlessnesses, etc.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The terms “perfect,” “complete,” etc., have been explained.

original: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes rten dang dmigs pa dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba ni rang bzhin gtso bor gyur pa ni rigs yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes rten dang dmigs pa dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba ni rang bzhin gtso bor gyur pa ni rigs yin la /
translated: The ārya Vimuktasena explains that the classification of the characteristics of the basis and the object is that lineage is the principal nature.

original: 'gyur ba gtso bor gyur pa ni dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba gtso bor gyur pa ni dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The object is the principal transformation.

original: dang po yul gyi shes pa rtogs nas de'i 'og tu de bstan pas sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i sems chen po dang ldan pas sems can kun mchog nyid de sems chen po nyid do //
analyzed: dang po yul gyi shes pa rtogs nas de'i 'og tu de bstan pas sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i sems chen po dang ldan pas sems can kun mchog nyid de sems chen po nyid do //
translated: The great mind is the generation of the thought, I will generate the great thought, I will realize the object after first realizing the consciousness of the object and then I will become supreme among all sentient beings.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi sems can la sogs par lta ba bag chags dang bcas pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston pas spong ba chen po nyid do //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi sems can la sogs par lta ba bag chags dang bcas pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston pas spong ba chen po nyid do //
translated: Great abandonment is the teaching of the Dharma in order to abandon the view of sentient beings and so on of those to be trained together with its latent dispositions.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ma lus pa spangs nas kyang byang chub rtogs par byed pas rtogs pa chen po nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ma lus pa spangs nas kyang byang chub rtogs par byed pas rtogs pa chen po nyid do //
translated: Great realization is the realization of enlightenment after abandoning attachment and so on without exception.

original: gsum po de dag ste chen po nyid gsum gang yin pa'i bdag nyid chen po gang yin pa rnams ched du byas shing thob par bya ba'i sgrub pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba des rang 'byung gi ye shes tsam gong nas gong du skyes pa rdzogs pa'i sangs
analyzed: gsum po de dag ste chen po nyid gsum gang yin pa'i bdag nyid chen po gang yin pa rnams ched du byas shing thob par bya ba'i sgrub pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba des rang 'byung gi ye shes tsam gong nas gong du skyes pa rdzogs pa'i sangs
translated: The three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses. Those who engage in the practice of attaining the three greatnesses intentionally should know that the three types of objects of activity are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.

original: rgyas la sogs pa'i ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas la sogs pa'i ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum du shes par bya'o //
translated: The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.🔽The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thams cad du 'gro ba mi dmigs par rtogs pa'i sems dang nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa dang / yul dang dus kyis chod pa dang dngos po pra ba yang shes pa mi srid pas nyan thos la sogs pa la bdag nyid che ba gsum po 'di dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs te /🔽'dod pa tsam gyi nyon mongs pa spong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thams cad du 'gro ba mi dmigs par rtogs pa'i sems dang nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa dang / yul dang dus kyis chod pa dang dngos po pra ba yang shes pa mi srid pas nyan thos la sogs pa la bdag nyid che ba gsum po 'di dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs te /🔽'dod pa tsam gyi nyon mongs pa spong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three greatnesses of the three greatnesses are the three greatnesses of the three greatnesses of

original: @174b sangs rgyas las byang chub sems dpa' rnams khyad par yang dag par na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @174b sangs rgyas las byang chub sems dpa' rnams khyad par yang dag par na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The difference between Buddhas and Bodhisattvas is not real,

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thob pa'i skal ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thob pa'i skal ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the fortune to attain the qualities of a Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa dang ldan pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams rang 'byung ba yin no zhes bshad pa nyes pa med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa dang ldan pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams rang 'byung ba yin no zhes bshad pa nyes pa med do //
translated: Thus, the statement that Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are self-arisen is not faulty, because it is made with this intention.

original: dmigs pa las ched du bya ba khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: dmigs pa las ched du bya ba khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the object and the aim?

original: da ltar gyi ni dmigs pa ste nye ba na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi ni dmigs pa ste nye ba na gnas pa'o //
translated: The present is the object, because it is near.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ched du bya ba ste rgyang ring ba yin pa ni 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes mda' ltong sbyor ba dang 'ben la phog pa dang chos mthun pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ched du bya ba ste rgyang ring ba yin pa ni 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sdes mda' ltong sbyor ba dang 'ben la phog pa dang chos mthun pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The future is the aim, because it is distant. This is like the analogy of a bow and arrow, as explained by the Noble Vimuktasena.

original: sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa la sogs pa rten dang dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba brjod nas sgrub pa de'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa la sogs pa rten dang dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba brjod nas sgrub pa de'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin zhe na /
translated: Having described the basis, the object, and the purpose of the practice, what is the nature of that practice?

original: zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: The question is asked.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi yul la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi yul la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object of the three knowledges is the four noble truths, etc.

original: spyir te thams cad la mngon par khyab pa dge ba'i chos kyi rten can te chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: spyir te thams cad la mngon par khyab pa dge ba'i chos kyi rten can te chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'o //
translated: The basis of virtuous qualities is the universal, i.e., the realm of Dharma.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi la mngon par rtogs pa re re zhing zhes bya ba re re'i bsgom par bya ba'i rtogs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi la mngon par rtogs pa re re zhing zhes bya ba re re'i bsgom par bya ba'i rtogs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four realizations are the realization of all aspects, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten can zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la brten pa'i bya ba nyams su len pa ni sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten can zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la brten pa'i bya ba nyams su len pa ni sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The practice is the performance of the practice based on the six perfections, i.e., giving, etc.

original: chos kyi sku'i mngon par rtogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis dkar po nyid yin zhing gnas med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma bshad do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i mngon par rtogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis dkar po nyid yin zhing gnas med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma bshad do //
translated: The realization of the Dharma body is not explained because it is naturally pure and it has no location.🔽Having thus presented the perfections, their individual characteristics should be mentioned.

original: de ltar bsgrub pa rnam par gzhag nas so so'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba 'og nas bshad pa'i rim pas sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang khyad par gyi lam ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsgrub pa rnam par gzhag nas so so'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba 'og nas bshad pa'i rim pas sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang khyad par gyi lam ste /
translated: The armor practice and so on, which are explained below, are the characteristics of the perfections.

original: bzhi po de'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid go cha la sogs ba 'og nas bshad pa de rnams kyi nang nas brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid yin zhing dge ba'i las la spro ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa de nyid kyis na dang bo go
analyzed: bzhi po de'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid go cha la sogs ba 'og nas bshad pa de rnams kyi nang nas brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid yin zhing dge ba'i las la spro ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa de nyid kyis na dang bo go
translated: Of those, the essence of the perfection of effort is the essence of exertion and the nature of delight in virtue.

original: cha'i bsgrub pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: cha'i bsgrub pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The armor practice is taught first by that alone.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa ste sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa ste sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
translated: Generosity and so on refers to generosity, ethics and so on.

original: rnam pa drug la /
analyzed: rnam pa drug la /
translated: The six aspects are as follows.

original: de dag so sor bsdus @175a * //
analyzed: de dag so sor bsdus @175a * //
translated: Each of these is further divided into two.🔽

original: pa yis // zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa de rnams nyid so so'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa yis // zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa de rnams nyid so so'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six sets of six are to be understood as stated in the three mother scriptures, by way of the purity of the three spheres and so on, as they are explained.

original: go cha'i bsgrub pa gang yin pa ni thog ma kho nar byang chub pa'i bar du don gyi bya ba dam bcas pa nyams su len pa'o //🔽de ni ji skad du bshad pa'i 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa la sogs pas yum gsum car las drug tshan drug gis te /
analyzed: go cha'i bsgrub pa gang yin pa ni thog ma kho nar byang chub pa'i bar du don gyi bya ba dam bcas pa nyams su len pa'o // de ni ji skad du bshad pa'i 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa la sogs pas yum gsum car las drug tshan drug gis te /
translated: The armor practice is the undertaking of the promised activity for the sake of enlightenment, from the very beginning.

original: rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs par shes par bya'o //
translated: The six sets of six are to be understood as stated in the three mother scriptures, by way of the purity of the three spheres and so on, as they are explained.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse summary is stated by the words “the giving of Dharma” and so on.

original: longs spyod la ltos pa med pas tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
analyzed: longs spyod la ltos pa med pas tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
translated: One takes up morality because one is not concerned with wealth.

original: tshul khrims rjes su bsrung bas ni bzod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su bsrung bas ni bzod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes patient because one protects morality.

original: skyo ba rnag par nus na brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: skyo ba rnag par nus na brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: If one is able to purify weariness, one undertakes effort.

original: le lo dang bral na bsam gtan rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: le lo dang bral na bsam gtan rdzogs par byed do //
translated: If one is free from laziness, one perfects meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan phun sum chogs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob par bya ba yin pas de ltar sbyin pa la sogs par rtogs pa'i go rims kyis bstan to //
analyzed: bsam gtan phun sum chogs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob par bya ba yin pas de ltar sbyin pa la sogs par rtogs pa'i go rims kyis bstan to //
translated: Since the perfection of meditative concentration is for the sake of attaining supramundane wisdom, the order of generosity, etc. is taught in that way.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa rab tu sbyin par byed pa dang / bdag nyid gcig pu dul bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sems ni nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa rab tu sbyin par byed pa dang / bdag nyid gcig pu dul bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sems ni nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Therein, the thought of a bodhisattva who gives the gift of Dharma, etc., giving the gift of Dharma and material things, and the thought “I alone will be disciplined,” etc. are the attentions of a śrāvaka.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dngos po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dngos po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The word “etc.” refers to the attention to impermanence, etc.

original: de spang ba ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de spang ba ni tshul khrims so //
translated: The avoidance of those is morality.

original: skye bo thams cad kyis mi snyan par smra ba ni gshe ba la sogs pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad kyis mi snyan par smra ba ni gshe ba la sogs pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The unpleasant speech of all beings is the expression of abuse, etc.

original: de bzod pa ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzod pa ni bzod pa'o //
translated: The patience with that is patience.

original: 'dun pa ni dge ba mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni dge ba mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the desire for virtue.

original: des bskyed pa ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: des bskyed pa ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: Exertion is the generation of that.

original: theg pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam dang tha dad par chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam dang tha dad par chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa ni bsam gtan no //
translated: Meditation is the one-pointedness of mind that is not mixed with other vehicles, which is the focus on the non-apprehension of all phenomena as distinct from the paths of the Sravakas and so forth.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngo bar byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams sems can thams cad 'tshang rgya ba nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing stobs pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngo bar byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams sems can thams cad 'tshang rgya ba nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing stobs pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: Wisdom is the dedication to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, the complete dedication of the merit of generosity and so forth to the enlightenment of all sentient beings.

original: 'di rnams la sbyin @175b par byed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po la sogs pa der gang mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams la sbyin @175b par byed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po la sogs pa der gang mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: Here, the so-called generosity and so forth are the non-apprehension of the object to be given, the giver, and so forth.

original: der go cha bgos pa nyid kyis byang chub pa'i bar du brtson 'grus brtsams pas so //
analyzed: der go cha bgos pa nyid kyis byang chub pa'i bar du brtson 'grus brtsams pas so //
translated: Here, by the armor of the vow, up to enlightenment, one is diligent.

original: sbyin pa'i phyogs la nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa spangs pas 'dir gzhan gyi don la dam 'cha' ba ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i phyogs la nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa spangs pas 'dir gzhan gyi don la dam 'cha' ba ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the vow to benefit others here, since it abandons the attitude of the disciples.

original: de med na mi 'byung ba'i sbyin pa dang / bzod pa la sogs pa yod pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa med par gzhan gyi don bya bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba'i sbyin pa dang / bzod pa la sogs pa yod pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa med par gzhan gyi don bya bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Generosity, patience, etc. exist when morality exists, because it is not possible to benefit others without generosity, etc.

original: de bzhin du bzod pa dang ldan na sems can dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod pa dang ldan na sems can dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, when one has patience, sentient beings come under one's control.

original: 'dir yang de bzhin du sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtson 'grus la sogs pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang de bzhin du sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtson 'grus la sogs pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Here also, generosity, morality, effort, etc. exist in the same way.

original: kho na med na dgra bo zhi bar 'gyur bas sems can rnams dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho na med na dgra bo zhi bar 'gyur bas sems can rnams dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one has effort, generosity, etc. exist, because sentient beings are agreeable, since one is not angry with them.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i las la spro ba nyid kyis de dang ldan pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bsam gtan dang shes rab yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i las la spro ba nyid kyis de dang ldan pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bsam gtan dang shes rab yod pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, when one has effort, generosity, etc. exist, because one is enthusiastic about virtuous karma.

original: brtson 'grus dang bral ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang bral ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because generosity and so on do not occur in those who lack effort.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang ldan pa ni 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa dang shes rab ni yod la rnam par g-yengs pa la de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang ldan pa ni 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa dang shes rab ni yod la rnam par g-yengs pa la de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, one who possesses meditative concentration has generosity and so on that is purified of the three spheres, and one who possesses wisdom has generosity and so on that is purified of the three spheres, but that is impossible for one who is distracted.

original: de ltar shes rab dang ldan pa la de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa yod de /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab dang ldan pa la de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa yod de /
translated: Thus, one who possesses wisdom has generosity and so on in the same way.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa med par sems can rnams byang chub par yongs su bsngo ba'i dge ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa med par sems can rnams byang chub par yongs su bsngo ba'i dge ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for one who lacks generosity and so on to dedicate virtue to the enlightenment of beings.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa re re zhing tshul khrims la sogs pa khong du chud pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa re re zhing tshul khrims la sogs pa khong du chud pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since each of generosity and so on is included in ethics and so on,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa smos pa ni rnam pa drug nyid yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa smos pa ni rnam pa drug nyid yin no //
translated: the mention of generosity and so on indicates their sixfold nature.

original: de ltar sbyin pa la ji lta ba bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i go cha nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa la ji lta ba bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i go cha nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as with generosity, so also with morality and so on, one should understand the armor of nonapprehending and so on.

original: de ni de ltar tshul khrims bsrung //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar tshul khrims bsrung // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: One should guard morality as explained, and so on.

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni bsam gtan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni bsam gtan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning with concentration is stated in the verse:

original: dang po la sogs pa bzhi ni bsam gtan @176a * //
analyzed: dang po la sogs pa bzhi ni bsam gtan @176a * //
translated: The four beginning with the first are the concentrations.

original: no // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: no // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The sphere of infinite space and so on are the formless attainments.

original: sbyin sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sbyin sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning with generosity is easy to understand.

original: khams gsum pa'i sems can la khyab par dmigs pa'i byams pa dang / snying rje la sogs pa'i tshad med pa rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sems can la khyab par dmigs pa'i byams pa dang / snying rje la sogs pa'i tshad med pa rnams so //
translated: The immeasurables are love, compassion, and so on, which are focused on sentient beings of the three realms.

original: dmigs pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning with nonapprehending is easy to understand.

original: yang dag par gnas pa ni smon pa'i sems dang nyams su len pa'i sems kyi mthar thug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: yang dag par gnas pa ni smon pa'i sems dang nyams su len pa'i sems kyi mthar thug pa'i sems so //
translated: The correct state is the state of the ultimate of the aspiration thought and the practice thought.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni de'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni de'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Its characteristic is its nature.

original: de nyid kyis na theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag ces bya ba sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag ces bya ba sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By that alone, the entire Dharma of the Great Vehicle is the generation of the thought, etc.

original: de gnon pa ni rim gyis mi ldog pa'i sems kyis bgrod pa ste /
analyzed: de gnon pa ni rim gyis mi ldog pa'i sems kyis bgrod pa ste /
translated: Its ascent is the progress by the thought of irreversibility.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
translated: It is its nature.

original: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la 'dzeg pa zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la 'dzeg pa zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The practice of engagement is the ascent to the Great Vehicle.

original: 'dir yang rtogs pa'i rim pas bsam gtan la sogs pa'i rim pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang rtogs pa'i rim pas bsam gtan la sogs pa'i rim pa yin no //
translated: Here also, by the stages of realization, there are the stages of the concentrations, etc.

original: de ni rnam pa dgu'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dgu'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That is the ninefold.

original: snying rje chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtse ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtse ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don bshad pa yin te /
translated: The verse-text is explained by the words compassion, etc.

original: zung du 'brel ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang thabs dag ni mtha' gnyis su mi ltung ba dang 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zung du 'brel ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang thabs dag ni mtha' gnyis su mi ltung ba dang 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The path of union is so called because wisdom and means are united in not falling into the two extremes.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is the samadhi of means and wisdom.

original: thabs la mkhas pa ni sems ma zhum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa ni sems ma zhum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Skill in means is the non-discouragement of mind and so forth.

original: sa dang gnyen po rnams ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: sa dang gnyen po rnams ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: The levels and antidotes will be taught below.

original: tshogs zhes bya ba'i ming don dang ldan pa ni kun rdzob kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba'i ming don dang ldan pa ni kun rdzob kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the term “collection” is indicated by “conventional” and so forth.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa las mi 'da' bar zhes bya ba ni don dam pa dang mi 'byor pas kun rdzob tu bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa yongs su brtags pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa las mi 'da' bar zhes bya ba ni don dam pa dang mi 'byor pas kun rdzob tu bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa yongs su brtags pa'o //
translated: “Not transcending conventional truth” means that since it is not connected with the ultimate, it is fully imagined to be cultivated conventionally and so forth.

original: theg pa chen po'i don mtha' dag ces bya ba sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don mtha' dag ces bya ba sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The entire meaning of the Great Vehicle” refers to arousing the mind of enlightenment and so forth.

original: de bsgrub pa ni nyams su blangs pas so //
analyzed: de bsgrub pa ni nyams su blangs pas so //
translated: “Its accomplishment” is through practice.

original: 'di dag gis yang dag par 'jug pa'i ngo bor thob pa'i sgo nas legs par brtags shing 'dzin pas byang chub chen po ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gis yang dag par 'jug pa'i ngo bor thob pa'i sgo nas legs par brtags shing 'dzin pas byang chub chen po ste /
translated: Because they are well investigated and apprehended through the attainment of the nature of correct engagement, they become great enlightenment,

original: khyab pa'i sangs @176b rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa'i sangs @176b rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that is, universal buddhahood.

original: snying rje la sogs pa'i don bshad zin pa'i phyir bor nas ye shes kyi tshogs ni de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa'i don bshad zin pa'i phyir bor nas ye shes kyi tshogs ni de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Since the meaning of compassion, etc. has already been explained, the collection of wisdom is mentioned beginning with “therein.”

original: nang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nang dang phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar nas bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: nang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nang dang phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar nas bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir brjod par bya ste /
translated: In order to easily understand the inner and outer, etc., it should be stated that the inner, etc. is connected with the outer, etc.

original: nang gi bdag nyid can gyi mig la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid du na med pa yin pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid can gyi mig la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid du na med pa yin pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The eyes, etc. which have an inner nature are inner emptiness because they do not exist in reality.

original: de bzhin du phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa ni phyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa ni phyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: Similarly, outer form, etc. is outer emptiness.

original: des bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir dbang pos bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga ste /
analyzed: des bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir dbang pos bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga ste /
translated: Both are outer and inner emptiness because they are generated by that and because they are included in the sense organs.

original: phyi dang nang gnyis ni phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gnyis ni phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The external and the internal are the emptiness of the external and the internal.

original: gang zag la sogs par brtags pa'i dngos po'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin zhing stong pa nyid kyis nang gi bdag nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid du dmigs pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid can ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zag la sogs par brtags pa'i dngos po'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin zhing stong pa nyid kyis nang gi bdag nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid du dmigs pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid can ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the emptiness of the self-existence of the cognition which perceives the emptiness of all things, such as the person, etc.

original: phyogs ni phyogs rnams dang sa la sogs pa'i snod dang 'gro ba rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni chen po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs ni phyogs rnams dang sa la sogs pa'i snod dang 'gro ba rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni chen po stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the great is the emptiness of the directions, the worlds, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang de'i lam ni don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang de'i lam ni don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is the ultimate and the path to the ultimate.

original: rkyen las skyes dang cig shos dang // zhes bya ba khams gsum pa ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rkyen las skyes dang cig shos dang // zhes bya ba khams gsum pa ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the compounded is the compounded which arises from conditions and the uncompounded.

original: ma skyes pa la sogs pa ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la sogs pa ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the uncompounded is the uncompounded which is not born, etc.

original: mtha' la sogs pa dor med dang // zhes bya ba la rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtha' la sogs pa dor med dang // zhes bya ba la rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
