translated: The emptiness of what is not to be discarded is the emptiness of what is not to be discarded.🔽The emptiness of nature is the emptiness of nature.🔽The emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽The emptiness of defining attributes is the emptiness of defining attributes.🔽The emptiness of nonobservation is the emptiness of nonobservation.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of conditioned phenomena is the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.🔽The emptiness of unconditioned phenomena is the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.🔽The emptiness of the unlimited is the emptiness of the unlimited.🔽The emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end is the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end.

original: thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus dang bral ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //🔽dor ba med pa ni gang du yang g-yeng ba med pa nyid kyi phyir gnas med par bsgom pa'i lam ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus dang bral ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do // dor ba med pa ni gang du yang g-yeng ba med pa nyid kyi phyir gnas med par bsgom pa'i lam ni /
translated: The emptiness of inherent existence is the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽The emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽The emptiness of specific characteristics is the emptiness of specific characteristics.🔽The emptiness of nonobservation is the emptiness of nonobservation.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of conditioned phenomena is the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.🔽The emptiness of unconditioned phenomena is the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the unlimited is the emptiness of the unlimited.🔽The emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end is the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end.🔽The emptiness of inherent existence is the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽The emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of specific characteristics is the emptiness of specific characteristics.🔽The emptiness of nonobservation is the emptiness of nonobservation.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of conditioned phenomena is the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.🔽The emptiness of unconditioned phenomena is the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.🔽The emptiness of the unlimited is the emptiness of the unlimited.🔽The emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end is the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end.🔽The emptiness of inherent existence is the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽The emptiness of all phenomena is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //🔽chos skye la sogs 'das sogs dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do // chos skye la sogs 'das sogs dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of specific characteristics is the emptiness of specific characteristics.🔽The emptiness of nonobservation is the emptiness of nonobservation.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of conditioned phenomena is the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of unconditioned phenomena is the emptiness

original: ldan dang cig shos ngo bo dang // @177a * //
analyzed: ldan dang cig shos ngo bo dang // @177a * //
translated: The other is the nature of the entity.

original: zhes bya ba ldan pa'i chos rnams ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ldan pa'i chos rnams ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The dharmas of possession are the emptiness of the nature of non-entity.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni dngos po'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni dngos po'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are the emptiness of entity.🔽Space is said to be empty.

original: nam mkha' stong zhes bya ba dang // zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas nam mkha' la sogs pa ni dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' stong zhes bya ba dang // zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas nam mkha' la sogs pa ni dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The unconditioned, such as space, etc., are the emptiness of non-entity.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature is the emptiness of one's own nature.

original: chos gzhan dngos po med pa nyid //
analyzed: chos gzhan dngos po med pa nyid //
translated: The non-existence of other dharmas🔽is the emptiness of other's nature, because the emptiness of the nature of the agent of another is the emptiness of other's nature.🔽The emptiness of emptiness

original: ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi ngo bo'i byed pa po stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi ngo bo'i byed pa po stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: is the emptiness of the emptiness of the emptiness of the nature of non-entity.🔽The emptiness of the great🔽is the emptiness of the great elements.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate🔽is the emptiness of the ultimate truth.🔽The emptiness of the compounded🔽is the emptiness of the compounded.🔽The emptiness of the uncompounded🔽is the emptiness of the uncompounded.🔽The emptiness of the limitless

original: stong pa nyid kyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi bye brag gis //
translated: is the emptiness of the limitless space, etc.🔽The emptiness of that which is to be extinguished🔽is the emptiness of the afflictions to be extinguished by seeing.🔽The emptiness of non-rejection🔽is the emptiness of the non-rejection of the afflictions to be extinguished by seeing.🔽The emptiness of essential nature🔽is the emptiness of the essential nature of the aggregates, etc.🔽The emptiness of all phenomena🔽is the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽The emptiness of specific characteristics

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar na stong pa rnams kyi khyad par rnam pa nyi shu ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar na stong pa rnams kyi khyad par rnam pa nyi shu ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa yin no //
translated: is the emptiness of the specific characteristics of the aggregates, etc.

original: stong pa nyid dang rnam pa nyi shu yin pa'i rgyu ni rang rang ngo bos stong pa'i phyir /🔽zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang rnam pa nyi shu yin pa'i rgyu ni rang rang ngo bos stong pa'i phyir / zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: The cause of emptiness and the twenty aspects is their emptiness of their own entities.🔽This is because the entities of the eye, etc.,

original: mig la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ji srid gzhan rnams kyis brtags pa de rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid stong pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de dang der kun rdzob dang don dam pa dang gnyi ga dag gis ci rigs par rnam par dpyad cing brtag pa mi bzod pa nyid kyis na stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ji srid gzhan rnams kyis brtags pa de rnams ni rang gi ngo bo nyid stong pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de dang der kun rdzob dang don dam pa dang gnyi ga dag gis ci rigs par rnam par dpyad cing brtag pa mi bzod pa nyid kyis na stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: to the extent that they are imagined by others, are empty of their own entities, and because they are not able to withstand analysis and investigation in terms of the conventional, the ultimate, and both, as the case may be.

original: sa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa'i tshogs yin te /
analyzed: sa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa'i tshogs yin te /
translated: The accumulation of merit is the ten grounds, beginning with the Joyous.

original: yongs su sbyong ba ni 'dus byas pa'i khyad par rnams so //
analyzed: yongs su sbyong ba ni 'dus byas pa'i khyad par rnams so //
translated: The purification is the special perfections.

original: de dag kyang bsam pa la sogs pa bcu po 'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang bsam pa la sogs pa bcu po 'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: And these should be understood as the non-apprehension of the ten, beginning with the intention, as real entities.

original: 'di dag rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di dag rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of these as real entities, etc., has already been given.

original: don 'di nyid ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi chos bcus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi chos bcus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: This very matter is stated by “with ten such characteristics.”

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa kun gyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa kun gyis so //
translated: In every way means in every manner.

original: bskyed pa'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the function of generating.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ground Joy is to be generated.

original: yongs su ni kun nas te sa rab tu dga' ba yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyu'i khyad par bcu po 'di dag gis so //
analyzed: yongs su ni kun nas te sa rab tu dga' ba yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyu'i khyad par bcu po 'di dag gis so //
translated: Thoroughly means completely. Because it is the cause of thoroughly purifying the ground Joy, it is with these ten special causes of thorough purification.

original: yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Again, what is it like?

original: ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba gang la la zhig gis 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis brtags pa de yang dag pa nyid du na stong pa nyid yin @177b pas ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba gang la la zhig gis 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis brtags pa de yang dag pa nyid du na stong pa nyid yin @177b pas ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of intrinsic reality. Whatever is imagined by others as the intrinsic nature of the great elements, etc., is in reality empty, because it is not seen.

original: des khyad par du byas pa'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pas gang la yongs su sbyang ba ste /
analyzed: des khyad par du byas pa'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pas gang la yongs su sbyang ba ste /
translated: Since the characteristic of that is not perceived, it is thoroughly purified.

original: 'dus byas pa'i khyad par kho nas bya'i /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa'i khyad par kho nas bya'i /
translated: It is only through the distinction of being conditioned that it is purified,

original: de las go bzlog pa gya gyu'i bsam pa la sogs pa nyes pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las go bzlog pa gya gyu'i bsam pa la sogs pa nyes pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: not through any other fault, such as the perverse intention of deceit.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa la bshad pa'i las bcus byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa la bshad pa'i las bcus byas pa yin te /
translated: It is purified by the ten activities explained on the ground of The Joyful One.

original: chos de rnams kyang stong pa nyid du dmigs pa na byed pa po yin gyi gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: chos de rnams kyang stong pa nyid du dmigs pa na byed pa po yin gyi gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: And those dharmas are also the agent when they are perceived as emptiness, but not otherwise.

original: de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba rnam pa brgyad po sa dri ma med pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa yongs su sbyong ba byas pa'i rgyu'i khyad par snga ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pas khyad par du byas pa'i 'dus byas pa
analyzed: de lta bu'i yongs su sbyong ba rnam pa brgyad po sa dri ma med pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa yongs su sbyong ba byas pa'i rgyu'i khyad par snga ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pas khyad par du byas pa'i 'dus byas pa
translated: Such are the eight kinds of thorough purification. The thorough purification of ethics and so forth that serve as the cause of the stainless ground is the cause of the special thorough purification that is distinguished by the nonperception of entity.

original: yin te zhes 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnams la yang de bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yin te zhes 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnams la yang de bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: The word indeed should be explained in the same way for all the verses that follow.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams srab mor byed pas na sbyangs pa'o //🔽de nyid ni yang dag par sdom pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams srab mor byed pas na sbyangs pa'o // de nyid ni yang dag par sdom pa ste /
translated: It is purified because it makes the afflictions thin.

original: de rnams rten pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams rten pa'o //
translated: It is perfectly restrained because it is the basis of those.

original: bdag dang sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang // rnam thar sgo gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang // rnam thar sgo gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: It is applied in order to easily understand such things as self and sentient being, and such things as the three doors of liberation.

original: bdag las go bzlog pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum shes pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag las go bzlog pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum shes pa yin no //
translated: The three doors of liberation are the knowledge of the opposite of self.

original: de bzhin du sems can gyi 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gyi 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa nyid do //
translated: Similarly, it is the purification of the three spheres of sentient beings.

original: gang zag gi ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi ni snying rje'o //
translated: It is compassion for the person.

original: chad pa'i ni rlom pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chad pa'i ni rlom pa med pa'o //

original: rtag pa'i ni chos mnyam pa nyid do //

original: mtshan ma'i ni tshul gcig shes pa nyid do //

original: khams kyi ni zag pa shes pa'o //

analyzed: khams gsum pa la gnas pa'i ni rtog pa kun tu 'jam pa'o //

analyzed: chags pa dang sems kun tu zhum pa'i ni 'du shes su lta ba'o //

original: sa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The ground of dispute about emptiness is not attachment.

analyzed: de dang 'gal bar brjod pa'i ni gang du 'dod par zhing gzhan du mnyam par 'gro ba'o //

translated: and “revealing oneself in all things.”🔽One attains the ground Gone Far Beyond by means of the inconceivable mass of the virtues that have arisen, such as the absence of the views of “self,” etc., and the knowledge of the door of liberation, etc.🔽The terms “lineage of the sravaka, etc.,” should be connected with the terms “lineage,” “eighth,” etc., in order to facilitate understanding.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'o //
translated: The stage of the non-returner is the stage of freedom from passion.

original: dgra bcom pa ni byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'o //
translated: The stage of the arhat is the stage of the realization of what was to be done.

original: zhugs pa gsum ni nyan thos kyi sa'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa gsum ni nyan thos kyi sa'o //
translated: The three enterers are the stage of the śrāvaka.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rang sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rang sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ste /
translated: The pratyekabuddhas are called the stage of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ltar sa brgyad de /
analyzed: de ltar sa brgyad de /
translated: Thus there are eight stages.

analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs la sogs pa'i shes pa'i khyad par rnams so //

original: 'dir rigs kyi sa la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin pas ming tsam zhig brjod pa yin la de bas na rgyu dang mtshan nyid ma brjod do zhes brtsad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rigs kyi sa la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin pas ming tsam zhig brjod pa yin la de bas na rgyu dang mtshan nyid ma brjod do zhes brtsad par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the stages of lineage and so on are not to be realized by the bodhisattvas, so they are merely mentioned by name. Therefore it should not be argued that the cause and characteristics are not mentioned.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu ni gcig yin pas sa dgu 'das nas zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu ni gcig yin pas sa dgu 'das nas zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: The nine stages of the bodhisattva are one, so it should be explained that after passing the nine stages.

original: theg pa gsum gyi don thob pa ni nges par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi don thob pa ni nges par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The attainment of the meaning of the three vehicles is liberation.🔽That is said to be:

original: de ni / thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges 'byung dang // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni / thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges 'byung dang // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The characteristic of attainment is liberation.

original: gzhan dag ni tshul shes pa rnams kyis go sla'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni tshul shes pa rnams kyis go sla'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las /
translated: The others are easy to understand for those who know the method.

analyzed: seng ge bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyi gzhung chos kyi grags pas dka' 'grel du byas pa las skabs dang po'i 'grel pa bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the first chapter of the treatise Elucidating the Ornament of the Scriptures of the Universal Vehicle, which is an explanatory commentary on the Ornament of the Scriptures of the Universal Vehicle, composed by the master Haribhadra.🔽The chapter on the knowledge of paths

original: // / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs @178b pas lam shes pa nyid gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: // / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs @178b pas lam shes pa nyid gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The chapter on the knowledge of paths is begun with the words, “The realization of the knowledge of all modes, etc.”

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od ni ye shes las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od ni ye shes las byung ba'o //
translated: The natural light is that which arises from pristine wisdom.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'od ni las las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'od ni las las skyes pa'o //
translated: The light of evolution is that which arises from karma.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning, “The knowledge of paths, etc.,”

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: is stated in the words beginning, “Therein, etc.”

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam pa bzhi'i nang nas so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam pa bzhi'i nang nas so //
translated: Therein refers to the four noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bden pa'i zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa zhi ba'i rnam pa bzhi dang go rims bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bden pa'i zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa zhi ba'i rnam pa bzhi dang go rims bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The four aspects of the truth of suffering are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.🔽The four aspects of the truth of origination are cause, origination, successive causation, and condition.🔽The four aspects of the truth of cessation are cessation, peace, self-perfection, and renunciation.🔽The four aspects of the truth of the path are path, reason, practice, and definite release.🔽The four aspects of the truth of suffering are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: de ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid dang mi mthun pa nyid kyis na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dag tu bshad la /
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid dang mi mthun pa nyid kyis na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dag tu bshad la /
translated: The four aspects of the truth of origination are cause, origination, successive causation, and condition.🔽The four aspects of the truth of cessation are cessation, peace, self-perfection, and renunciation.🔽The four aspects of the truth of the path are path, reason, practice, and definite release.🔽The four aspects of the truth of suffering are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid mi rtag pa yin par mtshungs su zin na yang zag pa dang bcas pa nyid ni mi mthun pa nyid yin gyi 'phags pa'i lam gyi ni ma yin te /🔽zag pa med pa nyid kyis na 'phags pa rnams dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin par blta'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid mi rtag pa yin par mtshungs su zin na yang zag pa dang bcas pa nyid ni mi mthun pa nyid yin gyi 'phags pa'i lam gyi ni ma yin te / zag pa med pa nyid kyis na 'phags pa rnams dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin par blta'o //
translated: The four aspects of the truth of origination are cause, origination, successive causation, and condition.🔽The four aspects of the truth of cessation are cessation, peace, self-perfection, and renunciation.🔽The four aspects of the truth of the path are path, reason, practice, and definite release.🔽The four aspects of the truth of suffering are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.🔽The four aspects of the truth of origination are cause, origination, successive causation, and condition.🔽The four aspects of the truth of cessation are cessation, peace, self-perfection, and renunciation.

original: gzhan gyis brtags pa'i bdag gi stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brtags pa'i bdag gi stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag med pa'o //
translated: The four aspects of the truth of the path are path

original: rang nyid bdag med pa nyid kyis na de'i mtshan nyid ni zhi ba ste //
analyzed: rang nyid bdag med pa nyid kyis na de'i mtshan nyid ni zhi ba ste //
translated: Since it is itself devoid of self, its characteristic is peace.

original: rnam pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: These aspects are applied to the non-apprehension of the nature of these, etc.

original: 'dis ni 'di lta ste mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid de rnam pa bzhi dag go //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di lta ste mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid de rnam pa bzhi dag go //
translated: This is the fourfold aspect, i.e. impermanence, suffering, selflessness, and peace.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyu ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyu ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: The truth of origination is the cause, etc. The cause is the fundamental cause of suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba ni 'phral gyi sdug bsngal gyi'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni 'phral gyi sdug bsngal gyi'o //
translated: Origination is the immediate suffering.

original: rab tu skye ba ni 'phral du shin tu sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu skye ba ni 'phral du shin tu sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Production is the immediate intense suffering.

original: rkyen ni sdug bsngal gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i'o //
analyzed: rkyen ni sdug bsngal gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i'o //
translated: Condition is the condition of the succession of suffering.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni nad de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni nad de /
translated: The nature of these is disease.

original: ma zhu ba la sogs pa dang / 'bras dang zug rngu ni grags par zad do //
analyzed: ma zhu ba la sogs pa dang / 'bras dang zug rngu ni grags par zad do //
translated: Indigestion, etc. and abscesses and tumors are well known.

original: sdig pa ni 'joms pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa ni 'joms pa ste /
translated: Sin is the destroyer.

original: rnam pa 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The nature of these aspects is the same as before, i.e., non-apprehension, etc.

original: 'dis ni rgyud la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyud la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa bzhi yin te /
translated: This has four aspects of the nature of a continuum, etc.

original: 'di lta ste nad nyid dang / 'bras nyid dang / zug rngu nyid dang / @179a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste nad nyid dang / 'bras nyid dang / zug rngu nyid dang / @179a * //
translated: They are: the nature of a disease, the nature of a boil, the nature of a dart,

original: sdig pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdig pa nyid do //
translated: and the nature of a crime.

original: sngar bshad pa'i bden pa dag gi rnam pa gzhan dag ni yid 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i bden pa dag gi rnam pa gzhan dag ni yid 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Other aspects of the truths previously mentioned are stated in the verse: “disgust, detachment, cessation,

original: yid 'byung ba ni skyo ba'o //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba ni skyo ba'o //
translated: disgust is weariness.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba ni yul la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba ni yul la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
translated: Detachment is turning away from objects.

original: 'gog pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba mi rgyu ba'am sems phra bar 'jug pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba mi rgyu ba'am sems phra bar 'jug pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Cessation is the state in which mind and mental functions do not operate or the state in which mind enters a subtle form.🔽Because of that, one enters, i.e., one becomes endowed with practice.

original: de'i don gyi phyir zhugs pa ni nyams su len pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi lung las gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don gyi phyir zhugs pa ni nyams su len pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi lung las gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is stated in the Sravaka scriptures.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs par rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs par rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” is meant to include the phrases “suffering” and so on.

original: yid 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dag gi zhes bya ba ni yid 'byung ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dag gi zhes bya ba ni yid 'byung ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase “the aspects of disgust” means the aspects of disgust itself.

original: pha rol dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi rnam pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol bar gyur pa nyid kyis na pha rol lo //
analyzed: pha rol dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi rnam pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol bar gyur pa nyid kyis na pha rol lo //
translated: The phrase “the aspects of the other shore and the destruction of existence” means the other shore itself is the aspect of opposition.

original: phyir rgol bar gyur pa ni 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i chos can nyid de 'di dag ni yid 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol bar gyur pa ni 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i chos can nyid de 'di dag ni yid 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The destruction of existence is the aspect of destruction because the other shore is the aspect of opposition and the destruction of existence. These are the aspects of disgust.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa dag ni g-yo ba dang rab tu 'jig pa'i rnam pa dag ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa dag ni g-yo ba dang rab tu 'jig pa'i rnam pa dag ces bya ba yin te /
translated: The aspects of freedom from attachment are the aspects of movement and complete destruction.

original: rang gi ngo bor mi gnas pa nyid kyis na g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor mi gnas pa nyid kyis na g-yo ba'o //
translated: Movement is the non-abiding in one’s own nature.

original: rgyu la mi ltos par rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid yin pas na rab tu 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu la mi ltos par rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid yin pas na rab tu 'jig pa'o //
translated: Complete destruction is the natural destruction that does not depend on a cause.

original: 'di dag ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: These are the aspects of freedom from attachment.

original: 'gog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa gzhan dag gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa gzhan dag gsungs pa yin te /
translated: cessation, etc.

original: 'di dang phyi ma'i 'jig pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid kyis na 'jig pa nyid dang / srin po la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba'i yul du gyur pa nyid kyis na nad 'go ba nyid dang 'byung ba chen po 'khrugs pa dang // glo bur ba'i gnas su gyur pa nyid kyis na 'tshe ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'di dang phyi ma'i 'jig pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid kyis na 'jig pa nyid dang / srin po la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba'i yul du gyur pa nyid kyis na nad 'go ba nyid dang 'byung ba chen po 'khrugs pa dang // glo bur ba'i gnas su gyur pa nyid kyis na 'tshe ba nyid de /
translated: Since it is the basis of the destruction of this life and the next, it is destruction. Since it is the basis of the harm of demons, etc., it is disease. Since it is the basis of the disturbance of the great elements and of the sudden calamities, it is violence.

original: de dag nyid la so sor 'gog pa'i rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid la so sor 'gog pa'i rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: These are the three aspects of cessation.

original: 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of their intrinsic reality is as before.

original: yid 'byung ba la sogs pa rnam pa bden pa gnyis su gtogs pa nyid kyis na re re zhing gnyis gnyis su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba la sogs pa rnam pa bden pa gnyis su gtogs pa nyid kyis na re re zhing gnyis gnyis su blta bar bya'o //
translated: Since the aspects of disgust, etc. belong to the two truths, each should be seen as twofold.

original: des na yid 'byung ba la pha rol dang 'jig pa'i chos can dang / 'dod chags dang bral pa la @179b g-yo ba dang / rab tu 'jigs pa'i rnam pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa la 'jigs pa dang / nad 'go ba dang 'tshe ba'i rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: des na yid 'byung ba la pha rol dang 'jig pa'i chos can dang / 'dod chags dang bral pa la @179b g-yo ba dang / rab tu 'jigs pa'i rnam pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa la 'jigs pa dang / nad 'go ba dang 'tshe ba'i rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Thus, disgust has eight aspects:🔽the aspect of the other shore, the aspect of the dharma of destruction,🔽the aspect of movement, the aspect of freedom from attachment,🔽the aspect of fear, the aspect of the beginning of illness, and the aspect of harm.🔽🔽Cessation has six aspects:🔽the aspect of fear, the aspect of the beginning of illness, and the aspect of harm.

original: spyir na bcu bzhi yin no //
analyzed: spyir na bcu bzhi yin no //
translated: Thus, there are fourteen aspects in all.

original: 'gog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na bdag med pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba rab tu zhi ba nyid kyis na zhi ba nyid dang / gya nom pa'i rnam pa dang bdag gis dben pa zhes bya ba bde ba dang gtsang ba dang bral ba nyid kyis na dben pa nyid de rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na bdag med pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba rab tu zhi ba nyid kyis na zhi ba nyid dang / gya nom pa'i rnam pa dang bdag gis dben pa zhes bya ba bde ba dang gtsang ba dang bral ba nyid kyis na dben pa nyid de rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: In regard to cessation, etc., there are three aspects: the aspect of selflessness due to being free from defilement, the aspect of peace due to the cessation of suffering, and the aspect of excellence due to being free from the stain of suffering and the stain of the aggregates.🔽The aspect of seclusion is due to being free from the self of pleasure and purity.

original: nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: That which is the escape is nirvana.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa dang phan pa'i dngos po nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa dang phan pa'i dngos po nyid kyis na /
translated: Its characteristic is the aspect of being permanent and beneficial.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni rnam pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni rnam pa gcig yin no //
translated: Emptiness, etc. are the one aspect.

original: 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The nature of these is as before.

original: lam gyi bden pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su phyin pa'i don gyis na lam nyid do //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su phyin pa'i don gyis na lam nyid do //
translated: The truth of the path is the path because it is the means of arriving at the goal.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i tshogs su gyur pa na rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i tshogs su gyur pa na rig pa nyid do //
translated: It is knowledge because it is the collection of the absence of the afflictions and the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: sems phyin ci ma log par rtogs par byed pa nyid kyis na sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems phyin ci ma log par rtogs par byed pa nyid kyis na sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: It is practice because it is the means of realizing the mind without error.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i rtag pa'i gnas su 'gro ba nyid kyis na nges par 'byin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i rtag pa'i gnas su 'gro ba nyid kyis na nges par 'byin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the means of deliverance because it is the means of arriving at the state of the absence of attachment.

original: rnam pa 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The nature of these aspects is the non-apprehension of the object, etc. as before.

original: rim pa 'di nyid kyis na theg pa chen por rnam pa kha cig ni rnam grangs nyid du /
analyzed: rim pa 'di nyid kyis na theg pa chen por rnam pa kha cig ni rnam grangs nyid du /
translated: By this very order, some aspects of the universal vehicle are synonyms.

original: kha cig ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du ston pa yin pas nyan thos kyi lam ma yin pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du ston pa yin pas nyan thos kyi lam ma yin pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Some say: Since it is taught as having its own intrinsic reality, it does not follow that it is not the śrāvaka path.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nges par 'byed pa'i zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nges par 'byed pa'i zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston pa yin te /
translated: As for “thus,” etc., it teaches the meaning of the verse “the emptiness of differentiation.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams rang rang gi ngo bo dbang po dang / don lnga dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang nyams su myong ba la sogs pa ni des stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid sna tshogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa med pa ni
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams rang rang gi ngo bo dbang po dang / don lnga dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang nyams su myong ba la sogs pa ni des stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid sna tshogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa med pa ni
translated: The aggregates of form, etc., are empty of their own individual natures, the five sense faculties, objects, imperceptible form, experience, etc. The emptiness of those is the emptiness of form, etc. The various emptinesses are not different from each other.

original: gcig yin no //
analyzed: gcig yin no //
translated: They are one.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: As for “form, etc.,” this has been explained.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Similarly, as for “in form, etc.,” etc., this is easy to understand.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs @180a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs @180a * //
translated: As for “because,” etc.,

original: pa la chos kyi mchog gi don du dgos pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: pa la chos kyi mchog gi don du dgos pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The purpose of the supreme mundane state is as follows.

original: bdag cag gi thams cad mkhyen pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin du dmigs shing mkhyen gyi /
analyzed: bdag cag gi thams cad mkhyen pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin du dmigs shing mkhyen gyi /
translated: Since our Omniscient One abandoned all afflictions and their imprints without exception, he observes and knows things to be like illusions, devoid of things and nonthings.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bdag la sogs pa gtso bo'i don ni rigs pa ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa'i tshad mar gyur pa su zhig yod /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bdag la sogs pa gtso bo'i don ni rigs pa ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa'i tshad mar gyur pa su zhig yod /
translated: Since it is illogical that any other self and so on is the principal object, who other than the Tathagata is an authority?

original: nyan thos kyi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes zab par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes zab par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “the path of the sravaka” and so on states that the wisdom of the pratyekabuddha is profound.

original: gang sgrar brjod pa ni chos bstan pa'i sgo nas chos 'phags pa la sogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ston par mdzad pa na des nyan pa po rtag tu du la sogs pa rnams kyis 'chad pa po'i shes pa'i rtsal rtogs
analyzed: gang sgrar brjod pa ni chos bstan pa'i sgo nas chos 'phags pa la sogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ston par mdzad pa na des nyan pa po rtag tu du la sogs pa rnams kyis 'chad pa po'i shes pa'i rtsal rtogs
translated: When the Dharma is taught through the medium of sound, the noble Dharmodgata and so on teach the perfection of wisdom and so on. When they do so, the listeners, through the power of their wisdom, understand the power of the knowledge of the teacher.

original: par byed pa ni chos 'phags la sogs pa ston pa po'i shes pa'i nus pa khong du chud par byed cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i ye shes bdag nyid las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du bya ba'i🔽ston pa'i rnam pa yin la /
analyzed: par byed pa ni chos 'phags la sogs pa ston pa po'i shes pa'i nus pa khong du chud par byed cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i ye shes bdag nyid las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du bya ba'i ston pa'i rnam pa yin la /
translated: It means that the buddhas, the blessed ones, cause the potential for the knowledge of the teachers, such as Dharmodgata, to be understood and that the knowledge of the perfection of wisdom, etc., arises from their own nature.

original: de dag ni zhes bya bar rang sangs rgyas ni sgra med pa'i chos bstan pas zhes bya ba ngag gis ston pa med par rang gi thos pa'i ye shes la sogs pa ste /🔽bzung ba'i don gyi bag chags spangs pa'i ye shes dang smon lam de'i mthus gzhan dag ste /
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya bar rang sangs rgyas ni sgra med pa'i chos bstan pas zhes bya ba ngag gis ston pa med par rang gi thos pa'i ye shes la sogs pa ste / bzung ba'i don gyi bag chags spangs pa'i ye shes dang smon lam de'i mthus gzhan dag ste /
translated: The statement “Those who are self-awakened teach the Dharma through various kinds of forms” is a conventional expression.🔽It means that the self-awakened ones, without teaching with speech, cause others to engage in the ten virtues, etc.,

original: des 'dul ba'i sems can rnams dge ba bcu la sogs pa zhes bya ba srog gcod pa las ldog pa la sogs pa la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: des 'dul ba'i sems can rnams dge ba bcu la sogs pa zhes bya ba srog gcod pa las ldog pa la sogs pa la 'jug par byed do //
translated: through the knowledge and prayers that abandon the propensities for apprehending the objects of their own knowledge, etc.

original: de'i phyir rang sangs rgyas de dag gi ye shes mi rtog pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang sangs rgyas de dag gi ye shes mi rtog pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of those self-awakened ones is nonconceptual.

original: ye shes kyi rtsal ni mtshan mas rtag tu med pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rtsal ni mtshan mas rtag tu med pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The power of pristine consciousness is always without characteristics and so on.

original: chos ston pa ni chos nye bar ston pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: chos ston pa ni chos nye bar ston pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the teaching of the dharma the teaching of the dharma?🔽Even though it does not exist, how is it established?🔽Having made the different sounds of the voice, the teaching of the inner is shown without words. Since there is no contradiction in the meaning of the teaching, it is called the teaching of the dharma and so on.🔽Since the meaning of the teaching is the teaching,🔽the meaning of the teaching of the dharma is the teaching of the dharma.

original: de med kyang ji ltar de rnam par gzhag ces rtog pa la skad kyi dbyings gzhan pa nyid du byas nas nang gi tshe brjod pa med par ston pa de yang ston pa'i don yin pa la 'gal ba med pas chos ston pa zhes bya ba la sogs

original: gzung ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhi ji ltar ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par bsgoms pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams rtogs pa las ma 'das pas sgyu ma byed pas sprul

original: de'i chos nyid dang mi 'gal bar ni ji ltar rgyal ba dang 'gro ba la grags pas ston pa'o //🔽brtags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / ston pa'i @181a * //

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bzod pa nyid sngon du 'gro ba can nyid 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po so so'i ma skyes pa la sogs pa yod pa la shes pa gnyis skye bas bzod pa dag dang shes pa dag ste /

translated: The four aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path are:🔽The path is the truth,🔽the path is the correct method,🔽the path is the definite emergence from cyclic existence and🔽the path is the unmistaken method.🔽

analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa'i chos mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa la sogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de'i shes pa ni mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
translated: The path of seeing is the four aspects of the path of seeing, the four aspects of the path of cultivation, and the four aspects of the path of no further learning.🔽The path of seeing is the four aspects of the path

original: de la bzod pa ni 'dod pa ste chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzod pa ni 'dod pa ste chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is desire, i.e., the acquiescence in the knowledge of the teaching.

original: bzod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chos de la de bzhin du shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chos de la de bzhin du shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the teaching is the knowledge of that teaching which is preceded by acquiescence.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa la ma skyes pa la sogs pa yod pa la snga ma bzhin du chos gang yin pa de'i shes pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa la ma skyes pa la sogs pa yod pa la snga ma bzhin du chos gang yin pa de'i shes pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the acquiescence in subsequent knowledge of the teaching is the non-apprehension of the knowledge of any teaching which is not arisen, etc. with regard to suffering, etc.

original: rjes su shes pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Subsequent knowledge is also like that.

original: de ltar na bzod pa dang / shes pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi po de rnams la sogs pas /
analyzed: de ltar na bzod pa dang / shes pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi po de rnams la sogs pas /
translated: Thus, through these four characteristics of acquiescence and knowledge, etc.

original: 'di dang gzhan pa'i yon tan dang // zhes bya ba phyir mi ldog pa la sogs pa 'di dang skye ba dran pa la sogs pa gzhan pa'i yon tan chos dang rjes su mthun pa dag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan pa'i yon tan dang // zhes bya ba phyir mi ldog pa la sogs pa 'di dang skye ba dran pa la sogs pa gzhan pa'i yon tan chos dang rjes su mthun pa dag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He possesses the qualities of this and other lives which are in conformity with the Dharma, i.e. the qualities of this life such as irreversibility and the qualities of other lives such as the recollection of former lives.

original: de nyid kyis na phan yon chen po ste //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na phan yon chen po ste //
translated: He has great benefit through just that.

original: de la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thams cad la @181b mchog tu gyur pa ster ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thams cad la @181b mchog tu gyur pa ster ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it bestows the supreme of all fruits, and so on.

original: rnam pa ji lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa bcu drug gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ji lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa bcu drug gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The sixteen aspects are stated by the phrase “in such and such a way,” and so on.

original: de bzhin nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: The phrase “suchness and the buddhas” and so on indicates the following.

original: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / rten dang brten pa po'i rnam grangs su khas mi len pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / rten dang brten pa po'i rnam grangs su khas mi len pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of acquiescence to the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering is the non-acceptance of suchness and the buddhas as synonyms for the support and the supported.

original: chen po nyid ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po nyid ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering is the great.

original: tshad med pa nyid ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa nyid ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of acquiescence to subsequent knowledge is the immeasurable.

original: dpag tu med pa ni rjes su chos shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni rjes su chos shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of subsequent knowledge is the infinite.

original: mtha' nyid la sogs pa med pa ni kun 'byung la shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: mtha' nyid la sogs pa med pa ni kun 'byung la shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of acquiescence to the knowledge of origination is the non-existence of a limit, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du nges par 'dzin pa ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du nges par 'dzin pa ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the knowledge of the origin of the Dharma is the certainty of attaining Buddhahood.

original: blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pa ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pa ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of the subsequent acceptance of the knowledge of the Dharma is the absence of acceptance and rejection.

original: byams pa la sogs pa bsgoms pa ni rjes su chos shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa bsgoms pa ni rjes su chos shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of the subsequent knowledge of the Dharma is the cultivation of love and so forth.

original: stong pa nyid ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the acceptance of the knowledge of the Dharma of cessation is emptiness.

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the knowledge of the Dharma of cessation is the attainment of Buddhahood.

original: rnam par byang ba thams cad ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba thams cad ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the subsequent acceptance of the knowledge of the Dharma is all purification.

original: nyam nga ba dang nad kun sel ba ni rjes su chos shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: nyam nga ba dang nad kun sel ba ni rjes su chos shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the subsequent knowledge of the Dharma is the removal of all dangers and illnesses.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las 'dzin pa bzhi nyid ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las 'dzin pa bzhi nyid ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the acceptance of the knowledge of the path is the four graspings from nirvana.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsrung ba la sogs pa ni lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsrung ba la sogs pa ni lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the knowledge of the path is the protection by the Buddhas and so forth.

original: dge ba bcu la sems can rnams dgod pa ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu la sems can rnams dgod pa ni rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is the dedication of sentient beings to the ten virtues.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su bsngo ba ni lam la rjes su chos shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su bsngo ba ni lam la rjes su chos shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is the dedication of virtue such as generosity to buddhahood.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: shes pa dang rnam par sbyar ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas rnam pa 'di dag nyid kyang bden pa rnams kho na'i yin par blta bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang rnam par sbyar ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas rnam pa 'di dag nyid kyang bden pa rnams kho na'i yin par blta bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is untenable that the aspects are applied to knowledge, these aspects should be viewed as belonging to the truths alone.

original: mthong ba'i lam 'di'i yang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gsungs pa gzung bar bya'o //🔽gal te @182a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'di'i yang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gsungs pa gzung bar bya'o //🔽gal te @182a * //
translated: The factors conducive to penetrative insight of this path of seeing should be understood to be omniscience.🔽If the aspects of the path of seeing are the sixteen aspects such as impermanence, then how can the aspects of the path of seeing be omniscience?

original: de lta yin na der yang rab tu dga' ba'i sa la sogs pa brjod pa yod pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam bstan pa yin pa'i phyir yang ci'i phyir smos she na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta yin na der yang rab tu dga' ba'i sa la sogs pa brjod pa yod pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam bstan pa yin pa'i phyir yang ci'i phyir smos she na brjod par bya ste /
translated: If that is so, then since the Joyful Ground and so forth are mentioned there, the path of seeing of the Bodhisattvas is also taught. Why mention it again?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no zhes brjod pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no zhes brjod pas /
translated: It is said that the knowledge of all aspects is that of the Tathagatas,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma lus pa rtogs pa la ltos pa yin pas rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyi ni de las gsungs pa'i lam du mi 'gyur bar dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du de nyid las rgyu tsam zhig bgrangs nas rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyi mthong ba la
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma lus pa rtogs pa la ltos pa yin pas rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyi ni de las gsungs pa'i lam du mi 'gyur bar dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du de nyid las rgyu tsam zhig bgrangs nas rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyi mthong ba la
translated: and since it is dependent on the realization of cause and effect without exception, in order to avert the doubt that the path taught in that text is not the path of the Bodhisattvas, the text merely lists the causes in that text, and the path of seeing and so forth of the Bodhisattvas,

original: sogs pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid can lam shes pa nyid du logs shig tu bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid can lam shes pa nyid du logs shig tu bzhag pa yin no //
translated: which is the nature of the path, is set forth separately as the knowledge of the path.

original: de ltar 'phags pa rnam par grol sde'i bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa yin pa'i phyir bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad ma thag pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam pa yin par bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyis sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa rnam par grol sde'i bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa yin pa'i phyir bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad ma thag pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam pa yin par bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyis sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Thus, because it follows the explanation of Ārya Vimuktisena, Bhadra explains that the aspects of the path of seeing just explained, beginning with “acceptance,” are the aspects of the path of seeing.

original: gzhan dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gzhung dang don ma lus pa rnam pa dang sbyar ba ma yin pas kha cig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /🔽kha cig ces bya ba ni yang slob dpon la la gzhan du 'chad de de ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gzhung dang don ma lus pa rnam pa dang sbyar ba ma yin pas kha cig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te / kha cig ces bya ba ni yang slob dpon la la gzhan du 'chad de de ni /
translated: Others do not apply the aspects to the entire text and meaning of the path of seeing.

original: bden dang bden la bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don gang yin pa ni shes pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid can yin la /
analyzed: bden dang bden la bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don gang yin pa ni shes pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid can yin la /
translated: Some say that the meaning of the verse “acceptance of the truth of the truth” and so on is the sixteen moments of knowledge.

original: de'i nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa'i gzhung gis rnam pa'i don bstan pas /
analyzed: de'i nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa'i gzhung gis rnam pa'i don bstan pas /
translated: They assert that the meaning of the aspects is taught by the text that emphasizes the illustration of that.

original: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas rnam pa'i don ma bshad par zhes bya ba gzugs la sos pa'i de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag rten dang brten pa po'i rim par mi gnas pa ni sdug bsngal
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas rnam pa'i don ma bshad par zhes bya ba gzugs la sos pa'i de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag rten dang brten pa po'i rim par mi gnas pa ni sdug bsngal
translated: The words such as “Thusness and Buddhas” are not explained as the meaning of the aspect.🔽The aspect of the perseverance for knowing the dharma with regard to suffering is the non-abiding of thusness and Buddhas in the form realm and so forth in the order of support and supported.

original: la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nges pas rnam pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma brjod par /
analyzed: la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nges pas rnam pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma brjod par /
translated: The nature of the aspect is not stated by the certainty “and so forth.”

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam ji snyed bshad pa de la skad cig ma bcu drug gang yin pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam ji snyed bshad pa de la skad cig ma bcu drug gang yin pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The sixteen moments of the path of seeing of śrāvakas and so on that are explained are the perseverance for knowing the dharma with regard to suffering and so forth.

original: de'i nye bar mtshon pa nyi tsher mdzad cing sbyar bar zad pas 'dir yang byang chub @182b sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig smos pa ni ma yin no zhes sbyar bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i nye bar mtshon pa nyi tsher mdzad cing sbyar bar zad pas 'dir yang byang chub @182b sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig smos pa ni ma yin no zhes sbyar bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be applied here that only the aspects of the bodhisattva's path of seeing are mentioned.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of that?

original: bshad pa dang ma bshad pa'i rab tu byed pa ma lus pa ni mthong ba'i lam ston par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: bshad pa dang ma bshad pa'i rab tu byed pa ma lus pa ni mthong ba'i lam ston par byed pa yin la /
translated: The entire subject matter of the unstated and stated chapters is the path of seeing.🔽And that is to be understood as applied to the verses beginning with:

original: de yang / de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnams dang sbyar bar blta'o //
analyzed: de yang / de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnams dang sbyar bar blta'o //
translated: Suchness and the Buddhas.

original: phyogs 'di la bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyi nyes pa brjod pa ni de dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyi nyes pa brjod pa ni de dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: On this point, Bhadra's criticism is stated with:

original: slob dpon de dag gis ni bsgom pa'i go rims la sogs pa ma bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mngon par rtogs pa las gsungs pa'i rim gyis bsgom zhing bslab pa'i go rims so //
analyzed: slob dpon de dag gis ni bsgom pa'i go rims la sogs pa ma bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mngon par rtogs pa las gsungs pa'i rim gyis bsgom zhing bslab pa'i go rims so //
translated: Because those masters did not teach the sequence of meditation, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa ste /
translated: The word “etc.” refers to the culmination of the perfection of meditation.🔽And from that, one accomplishes buddhahood. But this does not teach even the slightest sequence of realization.

original: de las kyang sangs rgyas nyid bsgrub pa yin la 'dis ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa cung zad kyang ma bstan to zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i lam de'i rab kyi mtha' sangs rgyas nyid bsgrub pa'i go rims cung zad kyang
analyzed: de las kyang sangs rgyas nyid bsgrub pa yin la 'dis ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa cung zad kyang ma bstan to zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa'i sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i lam de'i rab kyi mtha' sangs rgyas nyid bsgrub pa'i go rims cung zad kyang
translated: It does not explain even the slightest sequence for accomplishing the culmination of that path of generating the thought of enlightenment, etc., which was explained above.

original: ma bshad la thams cad du 'brel pa'i dbang du byas pa'i go rims med pas /
analyzed: ma bshad la thams cad du 'brel pa'i dbang du byas pa'i go rims med pas /
translated: And since it does not have a sequence that is governed by a connection with everything,

original: stong phrag brgya ba la sogs pa ltar 'tshol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: stong phrag brgya ba la sogs pa ltar 'tshol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: it would be like the Sata-sahasrika-prajnaparamita-sutra, etc., and would be difficult to understand.

original: nyes pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Another fault, etc.

original: dmigs pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa'i don dro ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par nyan thos rnams las gang yang shin tu khyad zhugs par bstan pa de yang med par 'gyur te //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa'i don dro ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par nyan thos rnams las gang yang shin tu khyad zhugs par bstan pa de yang med par 'gyur te //
translated: The meaning of the statement “object, etc.” is that the distinctive object and aspect of heat, etc. are taught to be extremely special compared to those of the Sravakas, but that would not exist.

original: phyogs 'di la ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this position is common to both.

original: de ltar na phyogs 'di ni legs pa ma yin pa snyam sems so //
analyzed: de ltar na phyogs 'di ni legs pa ma yin pa snyam sems so //
translated: Thus, this position is not good.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi rtsa ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yin la de dang mi mthun pa ni bdag med pa la goms pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po la sogs pa dngos po la dmigs pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa goms pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi rtsa ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yin la de dang mi mthun pa ni bdag med pa la goms pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po la sogs pa dngos po la dmigs pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa goms pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: The root of the mass of afflictions such as attachment is the adherence to things, and the antidote to that is the cultivation of selflessness, but since the objects of observation of the mass of suffering, etc. are mutually contradictory, would not the cultivation of selflessness be established?

original: ji ltar na de'i rgyu can sdug @183a * //
analyzed: ji ltar na de'i rgyu can sdug @183a * //
translated: How could the mass of suffering, etc. be the cause of that?

original: bsngal gyi phung po la sogs pa'i yul rnam pa bcu drug la dmigs pas 'dir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bsngal gyi phung po la sogs pa'i yul rnam pa bcu drug la dmigs pas 'dir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The path of meditation is the path on which one meditates on the truths that have been seen.🔽The path of no-more-learning is so called because there is no longer anything to be learned beyond that.🔽The path of seeing is the first direct realization of the truths that have been seen.🔽The path of meditation is the path on which one meditates on the truths that have been seen.

original: ma yin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ma yin te gang gi phyir /
translated: The path of no-more-learning is so called because there is no longer anything to be learned beyond that.🔽The path of seeing is the first direct realization of the truths that have been seen.🔽The path of meditation is the path on which one meditates on the truths that have been seen.🔽The path of no-more-learning is so called because there is no longer anything to be learned beyond that.🔽The path of seeing is the first direct realization of the truths that have been seen.

original: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnam pa bcu drug gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid yin par bstan pas dngos po med pa nyid du ji skad gsungs pa
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnam pa bcu drug gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid yin par bstan pas dngos po med pa nyid du ji skad gsungs pa
translated: The path of meditation is the path on which one meditates on the truths that have been seen.🔽The path of no-more-learning is so called because there is no longer anything to be learned beyond that.🔽The path of seeing is the first direct realization of the truths that have been seen.

original: de bzhin du bslabs pa na /🔽chos nyid kyis de skyed par byed par 'gyur bas don dam par don gyi bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes thams cad du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bslabs pa na / chos nyid kyis de skyed par byed par 'gyur bas don dam par don gyi bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes thams cad du shes par bya'o //
translated: The path of meditation is the path on which one meditates on the truths that have been seen.🔽The path of no-more-learning is so called because there is no longer anything to be learned beyond that.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //🔽mos pa rang gi don dang ni //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //🔽mos pa rang gi don dang ni //
translated: The path of seeing is the first direct realization of the truths that have been seen.🔽The path of meditation is the path on which one meditates on the truths that have been seen.🔽The path of no-more-learning is so called because there is no

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rang dang gzhan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni rang dang gzhan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te //
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning with “for oneself, for others, for both” is as follows.

original: rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i don la dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba la rang gi don la dmigs pa ni rang nyid snod du rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i don la dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba la rang gi don la dmigs pa ni rang nyid snod du rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Having the nature of the object of oneself, of others, and of both” means: the object of oneself is the object of one’s own suitability.

original: gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa ni gdul bya snod du rung ba'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa ni gdul bya snod du rung ba'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of others is the object of the suitability of the disciple.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa ni rang dang gzhan snod du rung ba'i don nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa ni rang dang gzhan snod du rung ba'i don nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The object of both is the object of the suitability of both oneself and others.

original: ji ltar mos pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa las ma 'das pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar mos pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa las ma 'das pas so //
translated: “According to one’s faith” means that one does not go beyond selflessness.

original: mthong ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub kyi lam nyid du thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub kyi lam nyid du thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: “Seeing” means that the Blessed One has realized the path of enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i chos gang yin pa ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos gang yin pa ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Virtuous dharmas” means the generation of the mind of enlightenment, etc., because they have the nature of non-attachment, etc.

original: de'i rten yin na yang zhes bya ba ni de'i gzhi yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i rten yin na yang zhes bya ba ni de'i gzhi yin na yang ngo //
translated: If it is the basis of that, then also means even though it is the basis of that.

original: dang por ni thog mar ro //
analyzed: dang por ni thog mar ro //
translated: First means initially.

original: mngon du mi byed pa'i ngo bo ni rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i phyir sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni 'dir mngon par ma zhen pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du mi byed pa'i ngo bo ni rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i phyir sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni 'dir mngon par ma zhen pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of non-manifestation is the aspect of non-attachment to the generation of the mind, etc., which are the objects of self, other, and both.

original: gang las she na bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang las she na bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: From what? He says: from the perspective of the path of cultivation.

original: goms pa'i gnas skabs las te /
analyzed: goms pa'i gnas skabs las te /
translated: From the state of cultivation.

original: rab kyi mthar thug pa med par slob pa'i dus su mngon sum du bya ba ni su la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rab kyi mthar thug pa med par slob pa'i dus su mngon sum du bya ba ni su la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is not the case that anyone has the manifestation of the culmination of the supreme at the time of training.

original: rang gi don la mos pa nyid ni 'di @183b ltar rnam pa dgu nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang gi don la mos pa nyid ni 'di @183b ltar rnam pa dgu nyid yin te /
translated: The conviction in one's own aim is just ninefold.

original: 'di lta ste chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen po'o //
translated: namely, weak-weak, weak-medium, weak-strong, medium-weak, medium-medium, medium-strong, strong-weak, strong-medium, and strong-strong.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi don la mos pa dang gnyi ga'i don la mos pa la re re zhing dgu dgu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi don la mos pa dang gnyi ga'i don la mos pa la re re zhing dgu dgu ste /
translated: Similarly, there are nine for each of the three types of faith: faith in the benefit of others, faith in the benefit of both, and faith in the benefit of oneself.

original: mos pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: mos pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: Thus there are twenty-seven types of faith.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis chung du dang 'bring la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can 'di ni gnyen po nyid yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun yang don gyis shes par bya'o zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis chung du dang 'bring la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can 'di ni gnyen po nyid yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun yang don gyis shes par bya'o zhes 'chad do //
translated: The former teachers explain that the twenty-seven types of adverse factors, such as great-great, are understood implicitly by the antidotes, which are of the nature of weak-weak, medium-weak, and so on.🔽In the scriptures, the Blessed One said:

original: lung las bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyang /
analyzed: lung las bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyang /
translated: All bodhisattvas, great beings,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstod cing bkur la bsngags pa dang / thabs gcig tu bzhugs so zhes gsungs pas /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i lhag par mos pa'i ston pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstod cing bkur la bsngags pa dang / thabs gcig tu bzhugs so zhes gsungs pas / byang chub sems dpa'i lhag par mos pa'i ston pa ni /
translated: All the Buddhas praise, honor, and extol it, and they dwell in it together.🔽The teacher of the bodhisattva's superior aspiration is indicated by the words

original: de bsgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de bsgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: the bodhisattva who cultivates it.

original: bsngo ba khyad par can ni bdag med pa la lhag par mos pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don dag gi nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsngo ba khyad par can ni bdag med pa la lhag par mos pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don dag gi nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The special dedication is superior aspiration for selflessness and is superior to the disciples, etc. because it is for the sake of all beings.

original: yang de'i byed pa mchog ni rang dang gzhan dag gi byang chub sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: yang de'i byed pa mchog ni rang dang gzhan dag gi byang chub sgrub pa'o //
translated: Moreover, its supreme activity is the accomplishment of one's own and others' enlightenment.

original: dmigs med rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i sems bskyed pa la sogs par byed pa'i yid la byed pa ni lhag par mos pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dmigs med rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i sems bskyed pa la sogs par byed pa'i yid la byed pa ni lhag par mos pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The superior aspiration of the bodhisattva is the mental attention of the bodhisattva who is skilled in means and who is engaged in the mental attention of signlessness, etc.

original: mos pa dang bsngo ba yid la byed pa dag sngon dang phyi mar gnas pa dag gi yul ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir yul gyi khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa dang ldan pas ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa zhes🔽bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: mos pa dang bsngo ba yid la byed pa dag sngon dang phyi mar gnas pa dag gi yul ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir yul gyi khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa dang ldan pas ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: Thus, with this intention, he says, “the non-apprehension of the special qualities, as they have been explained, etc.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i mos pa'i khyad par mi dmigs pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i mos pa'i khyad par mi dmigs pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: ” What is the special aspiration that is the non-apprehension of the special qualities, as they have been explained?

original: mi dmigs pa ste /🔽de ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ste / de ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
translated: It is non-apprehension.🔽It is the non-apprehension of the apprehension of the object.

original: zhes bya ba yang 'di ni yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba yin no //🔽bdag tu lta ba la sogs @184a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang 'di ni yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba yin no // bdag tu lta ba la sogs @184a * //
translated: This is the mental attention of dedication that is called “non-apprehension.

original: pa'i lta ba phyin ci log med pas phyin ci ma log pa ste /
