analyzed: pa'i lta ba phyin ci log med pas phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: ” It is not erroneous, because it is not erroneous in its views, such as the view of self, etc.

original: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid do // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the characteristic of non-error.

original: gzung ba la sogs pa med pas dben pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa med pas dben pa'o //
translated: It is void, because it is devoid of the apprehended object, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “the thus-gone one” and so on teaches the meaning of the term “buddha” and so on.

original: sems ma zhum pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas thabs la mkhas pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sems ma zhum pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas thabs la mkhas pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Because he is endowed with an undaunted mind and so on, he is skilled in means.

original: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Because he does not apprehend the act of giving and so on, he is free of signs.

original: sangs rgyas dgyes pa yin pas sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dgyes pa yin pas sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'o //
translated: Because he is pleasing to the buddhas, he is approved by the buddhas.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams la mngon par zhen pa med pa yin pa'i phyir khams gsum par ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams la mngon par zhen pa med pa yin pa'i phyir khams gsum par ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: Because he is not attached to the realms of desire and so on, he is not included in the three realms.

original: thabs bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the phrase “along with the means.”🔽The dedication is of three kinds:

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po yi //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po yi //
translated: inferior, middling, and superior.

original: bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam gsum dang // zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //🔽thams cad las mchog tu gyur ba'i bsod nams kyi bdag nyid skyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam gsum dang // zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to // thams cad las mchog tu gyur ba'i bsod nams kyi bdag nyid skyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This has already been explained.🔽The dedication that is supreme🔽is the source of great merit.

original: bsod nams che 'byung bdag nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsod nams che 'byung bdag nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the phrase “the source of great merit.”

original: bsod nams chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bsod nams chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Great merit, etc. has been explained.

original: de ltar ming du btags pa'i yid la byed pas dmigs pa med pa la sogs pa'i ming can gyi yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa bcu gnyis mi dmigs pa la dmigs pas theg pa gsum gyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can la de rnams kyi lam🔽nye bar ston pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo'i byed pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de dang ldan pa rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don mi zad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba byang chub kyi bar du 'phel bar bya ba'i don du bsngo ba rnam pa
analyzed: de ltar ming du btags pa'i yid la byed pas dmigs pa med pa la sogs pa'i ming can gyi yongs su bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa bcu gnyis mi dmigs pa la dmigs pas theg pa gsum gyis gdul bar bya ba'i sems can la de rnams kyi lam nye bar ston pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo'i byed pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de dang ldan pa rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don mi zad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba byang chub kyi bar du 'phel bar bya ba'i don du bsngo ba rnam pa
translated: Thus, by the attention that is nominally designated, the twelve kinds of attention of dedication that are nominally designated as non-apprehension, etc. are the objects of non-apprehension.🔽The bodhisattvas who possess the function of being the cause for revealing the path to sentient beings to be trained by the three vehicles

original: bcu gnyis kyis sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: bcu gnyis kyis sngo bar byed do //
translated: dedicate the twelve kinds of dedication for the sake of increasing up to enlightenment, for the sake of the inexhaustibility of the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: gang zhig mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa de ni go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i bsngo ba'i yid la byed pa de ni go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The attention of dedication that has non-apprehension as its object is stated as follows:

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid do //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub ni 'tshang rgya ba nyid do //
translated: Supreme enlightenment is the very state of Buddhahood.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po ni zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po ni zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The aggregates of morality, etc. are the pure morality, concentration, etc.

original: sems gang gis sngo bar byed pa de dang de'i bdag la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i gzhi can ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: sems gang gis sngo bar byed pa de dang de'i bdag la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i gzhi can ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The basis of the aggregates of the afflictions of self-postulation and other-postulation is the mind which is directed toward self, etc.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi dge ba ni byung ba dang @184b 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsod nams so //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi dge ba ni byung ba dang @184b 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsod nams so //
translated: The virtue of the Buddhas of the three times is the merit of the Buddhas of the past, future, and present.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang mtshan ma ni sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa 'tshang rgya ba'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang mtshan ma ni sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa 'tshang rgya ba'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: The signs of giving, etc. are the causes of Buddhahood, such as the things given, etc.

original: lam thams cad ni theg pa gsum mo //
analyzed: lam thams cad ni theg pa gsum mo //
translated: All the paths are the three vehicles.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The realms of desire, etc. are the realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i las kyi lam ni srog gcod pa las ldog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i las kyi lam ni srog gcod pa las ldog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The path of action of the ten virtues and so on is the turning away from taking life and so on.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The stream-enterers and so on are the stream-enterers, once-returners, and so on.🔽The ones who are established in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment are the bodhisattvas.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas pa rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas pa rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the special dedication by the bodhisattvas and so on.

original: 'dis ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du mos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bsam pas sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyi rim gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par
analyzed: 'dis ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du mos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bsam pas sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyi rim gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par
translated: By this, having been inspired by the previous arousing of mind and so on, with the intention of non-apprehending unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and so on, for the sake of causing sentient beings to attain perfect enlightenment by the stages of the three vehicles,

original: bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: one should dedicate that root of merit. This is the intention.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rjes su yi rang ba bsgom pa zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa dang 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rjes su yi rang ba bsgom pa zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa dang 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The verse-text and commentary called “Cultivation of Rejoicing in the Path of Cultivation” are easy to understand.

original: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu ni rang gi chos mnyan pa la sogs pa ma thob pa'i rgyu rnams so //
analyzed: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu ni rang gi chos mnyan pa la sogs pa ma thob pa'i rgyu rnams so //
translated: The cause of the loss of the Dharma is the cause of not obtaining one’s own hearing of the Dharma, etc.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i skabs yin pas rnam par dag pa spyir yin te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i skabs yin pas rnam par dag pa spyir yin te /
translated: Since this is the occasion of the very pure, it is the general purity.

original: kun rdzob de bzhin nyid gang yin //
analyzed: kun rdzob de bzhin nyid gang yin //
translated: The conventional is suchness.

original: de ni don dam pa yir 'dod //
analyzed: de ni don dam pa yir 'dod //
translated: That is accepted as the ultimate.

original: ces bya ba'i tshul gyis de ltar thob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te ;
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshul gyis de ltar thob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te ;
translated: In this way, it is said, “having obtained, etc.”

original: 'bras bu dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni 'phags pa'i gang zag ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni 'phags pa'i gang zag ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse-text beginning with “the pure fruit, etc.” is “the noble person, etc.”

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag ni nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag ni nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The noble person is the śrāvaka, etc.

original: de'i dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gang yin pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gang yin pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The fruit of his spiritual practice is the stream-enterer, etc.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa thams cad de /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa thams cad de /
translated: All that is adverse to that is the obscurations.

original: de dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa ste dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa ste dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is pure, stainless, by being free from that.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: It is the purity of form, etc.

original: gzung ba la sogs pa med pas gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa med pas gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is the emptiness of form, etc., because of the non-existence of the apprehended, etc.

original: 'bras bu la sogs pa ni bshad @185a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pa ni bshad @185a * //
translated: The results, etc. have been explained.

original: zin to // ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'bras bu ste /🔽rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i snga ma bzhin du rnam par dag pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: zin to // ci'i phyir zhe na / 'bras bu ste / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i snga ma bzhin du rnam par dag pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: Why?🔽The result is the purity of the stream-enterers, etc., as before.🔽The reality of form, etc. is the same as suchness, because of the differentiation by freedom from the adherence to the self in form, etc.

original: don dam par yod par zhen pa gang yin pa de dag dang bral bas rab tu phye ba nyid kyis na de bzhin nyid dang gzugs ni gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par yod par zhen pa gang yin pa de dag dang bral bas rab tu phye ba nyid kyis na de bzhin nyid dang gzugs ni gcig pa nyid do //
translated: and by freedom from the adherence to ultimate existence.

original: don 'di nyid ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: This very meaning is stated by the words “because of the non-apprehension of form, etc.”

original: de dag gi rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba gang gi phyir 'tshang rgya ba nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i dag pa dag ni tha mi dad cing bcad du med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba gang gi phyir 'tshang rgya ba nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i dag pa dag ni tha mi dad cing bcad du med pa nyid do //
translated: Their purity is called the purity of the Buddha, the purity of form, etc. because the enlightenment itself and the purity of form, etc. are not different and are not divided.

original: don mtshungs pa yin na yang khyad par gyi sgo nas tha dad pa'i sgrar brjod pa'i rgyu ni rang dang spyi'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: don mtshungs pa yin na yang khyad par gyi sgo nas tha dad pa'i sgrar brjod pa'i rgyu ni rang dang spyi'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Although they have the same meaning, the reason for expressing them as different words by way of distinction is stated as “their own and general characteristics,” etc.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi ji ltar grags pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi ji ltar grags pa'o //
translated: Since their own and general characteristics are not different, therefore, the result and the form, etc. are as they are known in general.

original: yang na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kho na skad cig ma gcig pa nyid du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gong nas gong du rim gyis rgyud la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir rang dang spyi'o //
analyzed: yang na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kho na skad cig ma gcig pa nyid du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gong nas gong du rim gyis rgyud la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir rang dang spyi'o //
translated: Or else, since the nondual intuition itself is just a single moment and is present in the continuum in a gradual, ascending order, it is “their own and general.”

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Their characteristic is

original: don dam par ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo nyid de de dang 'dra bar tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo nyid de de dang 'dra bar tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: In the ultimate sense, it is the nature of illusion, and it is the nature of non-difference, since it is not different from that.

original: de ltar na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang bral bas go rims bzhin du de dag gi rnam par dag pa ni tha mi dad cing bcad du med pa nyid pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang bral bas go rims bzhin du de dag gi rnam par dag pa ni tha mi dad cing bcad du med pa nyid pa yin no /
translated: Thus, because of the absence of difference in the characteristics of the particular and the universal, respectively, their purity is non-difference and indivisibility.

original: yang na 'dir 'di dag ni yang dag pa nyid du sna tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba med pas tha mi dad pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na 'dir 'di dag ni yang dag pa nyid du sna tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba med pas tha mi dad pa yin la /
translated: Alternatively, here, they are non-different because of the absence of a differentiation in the characteristic of the variety as real.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bcad pa med pas bcad du med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bcad pa med pas bcad du med pa nyid yin no //
translated: They are indivisible because of the absence of a division in the characteristic of differentiation.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: And because this is so, they are pure.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu'i rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu'i rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The purity of form etc. is just the purity of the result.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The two of these etc. has been explained.

original: rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni rnam par dag pa spyir brjod nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni rnam par dag pa spyir brjod nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The special purity is mentioned in the line beginning “Having generally described purity.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las seng ge bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyi gzhung chos kyi @185b grags pas dka' 'grel tu byas pa las skabs gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'i bshad pa'o /🔽// / gzhi thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas rab tu byed pa'i 'grel pa brjod nas thams cad shes pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las seng ge bzang po'i zhal snga nas kyi gzhung chos kyi @185b grags pas dka' 'grel tu byas pa las skabs gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'i bshad pa'o / // / gzhi thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas rab tu byed pa'i 'grel pa brjod nas thams cad shes pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: This concludes the explanation of the commentary on the second chapter of the Ornament of Clear Realization, a treatise on the instructions of the perfection of wisdom, composed by Haribhadra, in the form of a commentary on the difficult points.🔽Having explained the commentary on the chapter, the author now explains the chapter itself, beginning with the line “The basis, etc.”

original: tshu rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni dus gsum pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshu rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni dus gsum pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The verse beginning “The limit of the past, etc.” explains the verse beginning “The limit of the past, etc.”

original: dus gsum pa'i chos rnams ni dus gsum du gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum pa'i chos rnams ni dus gsum du gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phenomena of the three times are form, etc., abiding in the three times.

original: skye ba med pa'i rnam par te //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i rnam par te //
translated: The non-arising aspect

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi ma skyes pa nyid yin par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas zhes bya bar gcig pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi ma skyes pa nyid yin par mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas zhes bya bar gcig pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: Since one realizes the sameness of the non-arisenness which is dependent origination itself, one knows the oneness of the non-arisenness of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la nye bar gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod pa rang gi sems la gnas pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'i ngo bo de ni nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan dag gi ma
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la nye bar gyur ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod pa rang gi sems la gnas pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'i ngo bo de ni nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan dag gi ma
translated: The nature of that non-dual wisdom which abides in one's own mind, which is asserted to be the perfection of wisdom that is proximate to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, is not

original: yin te / de rnams la gzung ba la sogs pa'i bag chags yod pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i skye ba med pa'i ye shes med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / de rnams la gzung ba la sogs pa'i bag chags yod pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i skye ba med pa'i ye shes med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that of the others, the Sravakas and so forth, because they do not have the wisdom of non-arisenness which is all-pervading, since they have the habitual tendencies of dualistic perception.

original: dus rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dus rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The times and so forth have been explained.

original: de gang la yang mi gnas pa ni tshu rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de gang la yang mi gnas pa ni tshu rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Not abiding in any of those is not this shore and so forth.

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshu rol gyi mtha' ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshu rol gyi mtha' ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom of the victors' spiritual heirs does not dwell in the extreme of this shore, samsara.

original: so so'i skye bo la sogs pas bgrod cing mthong ba nyid kyis nye bar gyur ba'i phyir srid pa'i mthar mi gnas shing mngon par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la sogs pas bgrod cing mthong ba nyid kyis nye bar gyur ba'i phyir srid pa'i mthar mi gnas shing mngon par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: It does not dwell in the extreme of the other shore, nirvana.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is because of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i tshul phyin ci ma log par thos pa la sogs pas shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i tshul phyin ci ma log par thos pa la sogs pas shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because of knowing the unmistaken way of the perfection of wisdom and so forth through hearing and so forth.

original: pha rol gyi mtha' ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi mtha' ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The other shore is nirvana.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis bgrod par bya ba ma yin zhing ma mthong ba nyid kyis mtha' ring ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis bgrod par bya ba ma yin zhing ma mthong ba nyid kyis mtha' ring ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so //
translated: It does not dwell in nirvana, which is far away because it is not something that ordinary beings can reach or see.🔽Why is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na snying rjes zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na snying rjes zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is because of compassion.

original: sems can ma lus pa la dmigs pa'i snying rjes so //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa la dmigs pa'i snying rjes so //
translated: It is because of compassion that focuses on all sentient beings without exception.

original: srid pa dang zhi ba 'di dag rnam grangs gzhan gyis bsal bar bya ba ni go rims bzhin du bdag la sogs par lta ba dang mi lta bar gyur pa nyid kyis srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i @186a * //🔽mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: srid pa dang zhi ba 'di dag rnam grangs gzhan gyis bsal bar bya ba ni go rims bzhin du bdag la sogs par lta ba dang mi lta bar gyur pa nyid kyis srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i @186a * // mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Existence and peace are to be eliminated by another method, respectively, by the view of self, etc., and by the view of non-existence. Existence and peace have the characteristics of eternalism and nihilism.

original: de dag gi bar na mi gnas pa ni yang dag par na srid pa dang zhi bdag med pas de'i bar yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi bar na mi gnas pa ni yang dag par na srid pa dang zhi bdag med pas de'i bar yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Between them, there is no abiding, because in reality, there is no existence of either existence or peace.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: Thus, what is the perfection of wisdom?

original: tshul de ltar na srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa mtha' dang bar na gnas pa med pas srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul de ltar na srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa mtha' dang bar na gnas pa med pas srid pa dang zhi ba la mi gnas pa yin te /
translated: In this way, since existence and peace do not abide in the extremes or in the middle, one does not abide in existence or peace.

original: srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par bshad do //
translated: The non-attachment to existence and peace is explained as the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dis ni shes rab kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains “wisdom” and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yum rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bshad nas ldog pa'i sgo nas nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la de med pa ni kun shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yum rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bshad nas ldog pa'i sgo nas nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la de med pa ni kun shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Having explained the mother of the bodhisattvas in terms of their following, in terms of their turning away from it, it is absent in the śrāvakas and so on. “ Knowledge of all aspects” and so on.

original: kun shes pa nyid kyi gnas skabs su zhes bya ba ni thams cad shes pa'i dbang du byas par bzlog ste bstan pas zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' las go bzlog pa'i sgo nas bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun shes pa nyid kyi gnas skabs su zhes bya ba ni thams cad shes pa'i dbang du byas par bzlog ste bstan pas zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' las go bzlog pa'i sgo nas bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ In the state of knowledge of all aspects” is taught in reverse, from the perspective of the knowledge of all aspects. This is because it is explained in terms of the opposite of the bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa la dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dus gsum du gnas pa'i dngos po skye ba med par shes pa med pas so //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa la dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dus gsum du gnas pa'i dngos po skye ba med par shes pa med pas so //
translated: “ Because the śrāvakas and so on do not have knowledge of the three times as equality” means that they do not have knowledge of the nonarising of things that abide in the three times.

original: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ring bar gyur pas zhes bya ba ni thams cad du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i shes pa ring du spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ring bar gyur pas zhes bya ba ni thams cad du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i shes pa ring du spangs pa yin te /
translated: “Far from the perfection of right wisdom” means that one has abandoned the knowledge that does not cling to anything at all.

original: de ni dus gsum gyi dngos po skye ba med par shes pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dus gsum gyi dngos po skye ba med par shes pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it has the nature of knowing that things in the three times are not produced.

original: de ltar gyur pa rang gis rtogs pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa rang gis rtogs pa tsam ste /
translated: Such a person has only a personal understanding,

original: rang gi rig pa'i ngo bo'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying brtse ba dang shes rab dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi rig pa'i ngo bo'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying brtse ba dang shes rab dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: because he lacks the compassion and wisdom of the perfection of knowledge that has the nature of self-awareness.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la dngos po mthong bas skrag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la dngos po mthong bas skrag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he sees things in nirvana, he is afraid of it.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chad pa'i bdag nyid can dang / 'khor ba'ang 'khrul pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa cha 'dra bas rtag par lta ba skyed pa yin par gnas shing mngon par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chad pa'i bdag nyid can dang / 'khor ba'ang 'khrul pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa cha 'dra bas rtag par lta ba skyed pa yin par gnas shing mngon par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He is attached to the idea that nirvana is a nihilistic state, and he is attached to the idea that samsara is eternal, because it is a continuity of similar moments of error.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par dmigs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par dmigs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of the observation of things and nonthings.

original: de'i gzhung gis rtag pa yin pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa'i dngos po ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhung gis rtag pa yin pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa'i dngos po ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: By that passage, nirvana is a thing that exists ultimately because it is permanent.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis na de rnams kyi spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir srid pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis na de rnams kyi spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir srid pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: And existence is a nonthing because of the impermanence, etc., of those things that are to be abandoned.

original: de dag dmigs pa nyid @186b kyis shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dmigs pa nyid @186b kyis shes pa'o //
translated: Those are known by the observation of things and nonthings.

original: yang na yang dag pa nyid du phyin ci log nyid yin pas gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams don dam par dngos po yod pa nyid dang // yang dag par na de med pas de'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la dngos po med par mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa nyid du phyin ci log nyid yin pas gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams don dam par dngos po yod pa nyid dang // yang dag par na de med pas de'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la dngos po med par mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Or else, because of error in reality, one should understand that things such as form are ultimately existent things, and that their impermanence, etc., are nonthings, because they do not exist in reality.

original: gnyi ga ltar na yang nyan thos la sogs pa dmigs pa can rnams ni nges par dngos po 'ga' zhig la kun tu chags pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod du zin na yang nyams pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar na yang nyan thos la sogs pa dmigs pa can rnams ni nges par dngos po 'ga' zhig la kun tu chags pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod du zin na yang nyams pa la sogs pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so
translated: In either case, the listeners and so on, who are objectifiers, are certainly attached to some object, and so even if they have the perfection of wisdom, it is impaired and so on.

original: // lugs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de'i mtshan bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan gyis tshig le'ur byas pa'i 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: // lugs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de'i mtshan bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan gyis tshig le'ur byas pa'i 'grel pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The commentary on the verse beginning with “in the system” and beginning with “its signs” is easy to understand.

original: dngos po mtshan ma dang ldan par rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul ba'i mtshan ma rags pa la sogs pa dang ldan par cha 'dra ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la rtog pas so
analyzed: dngos po mtshan ma dang ldan par rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul ba'i mtshan ma rags pa la sogs pa dang ldan par cha 'dra ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la rtog pas so
translated: Having realized things as having signs means that, having conceived things as having coarse signs of error due to attachment to things, one conceives of things such as form that are similar in one aspect to another.

original: // yang na tshogs pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul ba'i mtshan ma'i rgyu dang ldan par gzugs la sogs pa rtog pas so //
analyzed: // yang na tshogs pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul ba'i mtshan ma'i rgyu dang ldan par gzugs la sogs pa rtog pas so //
translated: Or else, because it arises from the assembly, it is the cause of the sign of error in the attachment to things, by the conceptualization of form, etc.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo mi shes pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin log pa rnams mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo mi shes pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin log pa rnams mi shes pa'o //
translated: As for the words “to those who do not know the nature of things,” it is the non-knowing of the falsity of the nature of form, etc.

original: de'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge of its sameness is the knowledge of the non-production of form, etc.

original: thabs ma yin pas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pas ni /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pas ni /
translated: The explanation of the words “by the wrong means” is as follows.

original: thabs ma yin pas ring ba ste //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pas ring ba ste //
translated: “By the wrong means” means “by the distant.”

original: zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the words “by the distant.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' dus ring mo zhig nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pas ni /🔽de ni thabs la mkhas pa yis //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dus ring mo zhig nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pas ni / de ni thabs la mkhas pa yis //
translated: The explanation of the words “the bodhisattva for a long time” is as follows.🔽“By the skillful means”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: is the explanation of the words “by the skillful means.”

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i gnyen po byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin pa ni de ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i gnyen po byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin pa ni de ltar nyan thos la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The very discordances for the Bodhisattvas, the antidotes for the Sravakas, etc., are stated in the words “Thus, the Sravakas, etc.”

original: de ltar na nyan thos la sogs pas 'og nas bshad pa'i rim gyis yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring bar 'gyur ba sgrub pa yin zhing mi 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir log par goms pa yin pas de rnams kyi gnyen po ni byang chub
analyzed: de ltar na nyan thos la sogs pas 'og nas bshad pa'i rim gyis yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring bar 'gyur ba sgrub pa yin zhing mi 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir log par goms pa yin pas de rnams kyi gnyen po ni byang chub
translated: Thus, the Sravakas, etc., are established as having a distant Mother Perfection of Wisdom, because they do not attain it, by the process to be explained below. Since they are wrongly habituated, their antidotes are the Bodhisattvas.

original: @187a * // sems dpa' rnams kyis spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no zhes 'phags pa byams pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: @187a * // sems dpa' rnams kyis spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no zhes 'phags pa byams pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the noble Maitreya states that they are discordances, because they are to be abandoned by the Bodhisattvas.

original: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le 'ur byas pa'i don ni gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le 'ur byas pa'i don ni gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning with “form, etc.” is stated in the words “form, etc.”

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa dang gnyi ga'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa dang gnyi ga'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature of both is the contaminated of ordinary beings and the uncontaminated of the āryas.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig spangs pa'i so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig spangs pa'i so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshogs so //
translated: The aggregates of those who are free from attachment are ordinary beings who have abandoned one part of the afflictions.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dus gsum pa'i chos gang yin pa de thams cad la de'i gzhung gis dngos por ma gyur pa la dngos por dmigs pa nyid kyis don dam par yod par mngon par zhen pas gzugs la sogs pa gang yin par shes la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dus gsum pa'i chos gang yin pa de thams cad la de'i gzhung gis dngos por ma gyur pa la dngos por dmigs pa nyid kyis don dam par yod par mngon par zhen pas gzugs la sogs pa gang yin par shes la /
translated: All phenomena of the three times, such as form, are known to be form and so on by the apprehension of things as real due to the treatises that have not become things.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po de rnams nyid la gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pa stong pa nyid du blta'o //🔽sbyin pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po de rnams nyid la gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pa stong pa nyid du blta'o // sbyin pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, one should view the emptiness of the self and so on imagined by others in those very aggregates of form and so on.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi rnams te /
translated: Generosity and so on are the perfections of generosity, ethics, and so on, the factors of enlightenment, and the four concentrations.

original: 'di rnams la sgrub pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba bdag med do zhes mngon par zhen pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa de rnams kyi gnyen po ste lam yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams la sgrub pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba bdag med do zhes mngon par zhen pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa de rnams kyi gnyen po ste lam yin no //
translated: The antidote to those is the path of the śrāvakas, etc., which is called the idea of accomplishment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyin ci log 'byung ba nyid kyis bdag la sogs pa la mngon par zhugs pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams las go bzlog par zhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log 'byung ba nyid kyis bdag la sogs pa la mngon par zhugs pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams las go bzlog par zhugs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the opposite of the ordinary beings who are engaged in the self, etc., due to the occurrence of error.

original: de ltar na bshad ma thag pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bshad ma thag pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Thus, the very side of the antidote of the śrāvakas, etc., which was just explained, is the counteragent of the bodhisattvas.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyin ci log pa 'byung ba nyid kyis spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa 'byung ba nyid kyis spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Because they are to be abandoned due to the occurrence of error.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de kho na nyid du med pas stong pa nyid du lta ba la sogs pa yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de kho na nyid du med pas stong pa nyid du lta ba la sogs pa yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: It should be explained that the view of emptiness, etc., is to be abandoned by the Bodhisattvas because form, etc., do not exist in reality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bzlog ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bzlog ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: mthong ba la sogs bkag pa yis //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs bkag pa yis //
translated: “By the negation of seeing, etc.”

original: zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rtogs par bya ba nyid yin par mdo las bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rtogs par bya ba nyid yin par mdo las bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that the sutra negates the fact that form, etc., are the objects of the eye consciousness, etc.

original: de nyid kyis na rang bzhin te rtogs par @187b dka' ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rang bzhin te rtogs par @187b dka' ba nyid yin te /
translated: “By that very fact” means that it is difficult to realize.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tshad mas rtogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad skye ba med par shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba ma lus pa la chags pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tshad mas rtogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad skye ba med par shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba ma lus pa la chags pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since it is not an object realized by mundane valid knowledge, all phenomena are known to be non-arisen. Therefore, attachment to what is to be abandoned and what is to be adopted without exception is the counteragent of the bodhisattvas. It is to be abandoned.🔽Thus, he thinks.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sbyor ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sbyor ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, he says that the counteragent is as follows.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verses beginning with “all phenomena such as form” is taught.

original: sgrub pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bdag med par slob pa la rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bdag med par slob pa la rtsom pa'o //
translated: Practice is the undertaking of the study of the selflessness of form and so on.

original: de'i yongs su shes pa ni nye bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yongs su shes pa ni nye bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: Its thorough knowledge is its apprehension.

original: de bsal ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gzugs su ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gzugs su ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By way of its elimination, that is, because of the negation of reality by “not in form” and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de dang de la sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par ma zhen pas bdag med pa la goms pa'i mtshan nyid phul du byung ba'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de dang de la sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par ma zhen pas bdag med pa la goms pa'i mtshan nyid phul du byung ba'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas' application to this and that is the superior application characterized by the cultivation of selflessness, because they are not attached to form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la yul gyi dbye ba rnam pa bcu yin pa rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan la rab tu byed pa las zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la yul gyi dbye ba rnam pa bcu yin pa rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan la rab tu byed pa las zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
translated: The ten aspects of form, etc., are taught by way of their being the ten divisions of objects.

original: sbyor ba dgag pa zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dgag pa zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa yin no //
translated: The remainder is in the treatise.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the words form, etc., should be given.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: All phenomena such as form, etc., are the aggregate of form, etc.

original: de nyid mi rtag pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi rtag pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Impermanence, emptiness, etc., are easy to understand.

original: mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid du brtags pa'i phyir dang / yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa nyid dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas so sor ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid du brtags pa'i phyir dang / yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa nyid dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas so sor ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa nyid de /
translated: Because of the investigation of emptiness by way of the characteristic, and because of the possession of the aggregate of virtues and the intrinsic reality of the Dharma, there is the non-perfection and perfection of the individual.

original: gzugs la sogs pa tshang ba nyid dang ma tshang ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa tshang ba nyid dang ma tshang ba nyid do //
translated: The completeness and incompleteness of form, etc.

original: chags pa med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la ma zhen pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la ma zhen pa ste /
translated: The absence of attachment is the non-addiction to form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the four phrases beginning with “form, etc.”

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi yum gyi 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi yum gyi 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of change is the changelessness of the Mother who is the embodiment of transcendent wisdom.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na byed pa po med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na byed pa po med pa nyid yin te /
translated: The absence of an agent is due to the intrinsic reality of form, etc.

original: mi 'gyur byed po med nyid dang // zhes bya ba'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur byed po med nyid dang // zhes bya ba'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of “unchanging and without an agent” is that.

original: go rims bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni sngar bshad pa ste /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni sngar bshad pa ste /
translated: The three omnisciences are as previously explained.

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi ched du bya ba dang sbyor ba dang phyed pa gang yin pa ni sngar bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi ched du bya ba dang sbyor ba dang phyed pa gang yin pa ni sngar bshad pa ste /
translated: The purpose, application, and result that have that nature have been explained above.🔽The difficulty of those is that even though the aspects, the path, and the bases do not exist in reality,

original: de rnams kyi dka' ba nyid ni rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang gzhi rnams de kho na nyid du med na yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams @188a * //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa la 'bad pas de'i bdag nyid can gyi ched du bya ba la sogs pas ni bsgrub par dka' ba nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dka' ba nyid ni rnam pa thams cad dang lam dang gzhi rnams de kho na nyid du med na yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams @188a * // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa la 'bad pas de'i bdag nyid can gyi ched du bya ba la sogs pas ni bsgrub par dka' ba nyid yin pas /
translated: the bodhisattvas strive for the knowledge of all aspects and so forth.

original: sbyor ba dka' ba rnam gsum dang // zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dka' ba rnam gsum dang // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the difficulty of application is explained as threefold.

original: skal pa ci lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu 'thob pas mi stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: skal pa ci lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu 'thob pas mi stong pa nyid de /
translated: It is not empty of the result that is obtained according to one's fortune.

original: skal ba dang 'tsham pa las mi 'da' bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa don yod pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: skal ba dang 'tsham pa las mi 'da' bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa don yod pa nyid kyis na /
translated: Since the result of the knowledge of all aspects and so forth is obtained without transgressing one's fortune,🔽it is not empty of the result that is obtained according to one's fortune.🔽The meaning of the above is stated in the lines beginning with

original: skal ba ji bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skal ba ji bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: according to one's fortune.

original: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro nyid //🔽ces bya ba ni thams cad kyi dam par 'gyur bas mchog gzhan med pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro nyid // ces bya ba ni thams cad kyi dam par 'gyur bas mchog gzhan med pa'am /
translated: It is not subject to external conditions.

original: yang dag par na de las gzhan pa med pa'i phyir bdag med pa bsgom pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag par na de las gzhan pa med pa'i phyir bdag med pa bsgom pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of the meditation on no-self, because it is the best of all, or because there is no other, or because there is nothing else in reality.

original: de ni bdag nyid srung ba la sogs pa'i don gyi rgyur gyur pa yin pas na rkyen to //
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid srung ba la sogs pa'i don gyi rgyur gyur pa yin pas na rkyen to //
translated: It is a condition because it is the cause of the meaning of self-protection and so on.

original: yang na gzhan gyi rkyen gyi bdag nyid kyi srung ba la sogs pa'i phyir dngos po rnams dngos po med par so sor rtog pa'i ye shes zhes so //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyi rkyen gyi bdag nyid kyi srung ba la sogs pa'i phyir dngos po rnams dngos po med par so sor rtog pa'i ye shes zhes so //
translated: Or, because it is the self-nature of protection and so on, which are conditions for others, it is the wisdom of discernment of things as insubstantial.

original: der 'gro ba ni der thob pa ste /
analyzed: der 'gro ba ni der thob pa ste /
translated: Going there is attaining it.

original: rang las gzhan pa'i nus pas sam //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa'i nus pas sam //
translated: By the power of others,

original: phyi rol du lta ba'i srung ba la sogs pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol du lta ba'i srung ba la sogs pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni legs pa ma yin te /
translated: all external protections and so on are not good,🔽because they do not remove mental obstacles.

original: sems kyi gegs sel ba ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sems kyi gegs sel ba ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is the intention.

original: de yang gang 'di rgyu ba dang ni mi rgyu ba /
analyzed: de yang gang 'di rgyu ba dang ni mi rgyu ba /
translated: And this is what moves and does not move,

original: sgyu ma nam mkha'i ngo bor yongs rtogs pa //
analyzed: sgyu ma nam mkha'i ngo bor yongs rtogs pa //
translated: The illusion is fully realized as the nature of space.

original: don dam mthong ba'i srung ba de nyid yin //
analyzed: don dam mthong ba'i srung ba de nyid yin //
translated: That is the protection of seeing the ultimate.

original: srung ba'i go cha gzhan dag 'dir ci dgos //
analyzed: srung ba'i go cha gzhan dag 'dir ci dgos //
translated: What other armor of protection is needed here?

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa nyid yin pas na yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa nyid yin pas na yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is a transformation because it is the complete transformation of consciousness.

original: sngags dang sman gyi tshogs pa nyid yin pas na mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sngags dang sman gyi tshogs pa nyid yin pas na mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is a union because it is the union of mantra and medicine.

original: med pa nyid kyis na 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyis na 'gal ba'o //
translated: It is a contradiction because it is non-existence.

original: sgra ni rkyen la rag las pas na rkyen to //
analyzed: sgra ni rkyen la rag las pas na rkyen to //
translated: It is a condition because sound depends on conditions.

original: shes bya'i tshul las mi 'da' bas na mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i tshul las mi 'da' bas na mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: It is non-transgression because it does not go beyond the way of the knowable.

original: gzhi med pas na rten med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pas na rten med pa'o //
translated: It is without basis because it is groundless.

original: rgyu dang bral bas na byed pa po med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral bas na byed pa po med pa'o //
translated: It is without an agent because it is free from causes.

original: 'di rnams su snang ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni yang dag par na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yin par mi 'dod pas de yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa ni log par snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams su snang ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni yang dag par na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yin par mi 'dod pas de yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa ni log par snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: What is called appearing as these is not accepted as being consciousness, etc. in reality. Therefore, their transformation, etc. are false appearances.

original: gang de'i gnyen po'i shes pa yin pa nyid kyis na rmi lam dang // sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa lta bu nyid kyis na go rims bzhin du dngos po rnams shes pa rnam pa bdun @188b po de la shes byed rnam pa bdun zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang de'i gnyen po'i shes pa yin pa nyid kyis na rmi lam dang // sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa lta bu nyid kyis na go rims bzhin du dngos po rnams shes pa rnam pa bdun @188b po de la shes byed rnam pa bdun zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it is the cognition that is the antidote to that, it is like a dream, an illusion, a mirage, an echo, an optical illusion, a fairy city, and a magical creation.🔽The seven kinds of objects of cognition are called the seven kinds of objects of cognition because of the seven kinds of cognition that are like a dream, etc.

original: bshad ma thag par grags pa'i rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bshad ma thag par grags pa'i rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the term is that they are the objects of cognition that are like a dream, etc., as was just explained.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: de la rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa nyid kyis na yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa nyid kyis na yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The transformation of consciousness is called the transformation because of the transformation of consciousness.

original: dngos po rnams ni rmi lam lta bur shes pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dka' 'grel nyid las gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rmi lam lta bur shes pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dka' 'grel nyid las gsal ba yin no //
translated: The objects of cognition are like a dream, etc., as is clearly stated in the commentary.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa de las go bzlog pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa bcu ni shugs kyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa de las go bzlog pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa bcu ni shugs kyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The ten kinds of application that are the opposite of those of the sravakas, etc. are indicated by the words “the ten kinds of application that are the opposite of those of the sravakas, etc.”

original: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: “By the sameness of application” and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni gzugs la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni gzugs la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is as follows: “form, etc.” refers to form, feeling, etc.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa ni mngon par chags pa'o //🔽gzugs la sogs pa'i tha snyad du bya ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa ni mngon par chags pa'o // gzugs la sogs pa'i tha snyad du bya ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: “Attachment” is the adherence to form, feeling, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'o //🔽gzugs rnam gnyis dang nyi shu'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'o // gzugs rnam gnyis dang nyi shu'o //
translated: “Signs” are the signs of blue, etc., because they are the causal-signs of the conventional expression of form, etc.🔽“Conceptual differentiation” is the conceptual differentiation of form, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spros pa'o //
translated: “Elaboration” is the elaboration of the two kinds of form, the twenty kinds of form, and so on.

original: drod la sogs pa'i shes pa ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: drod la sogs pa'i shes pa ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Realization” is the knowledge of heat, etc.

original: 'di rnams kyi rlom pa rnams ni mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa yul bzhi'i dbye ba shes pa rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rlom pa rnams ni mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa yul bzhi'i dbye ba shes pa rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: “Pride” is the four kinds of knowledge of the four objects, such as adherence, etc.

original: de rnams rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa ni ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa ni ma mthong ba'o //
translated: Non-apprehension of all those aspects is non-seeing.

original: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid ni sbyor ba'i mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid ni sbyor ba'i mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: The sameness of application is the sameness of application.

original: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid so sor rtogs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid so sor rtogs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Having realized the sameness of application, etc. refers to the verse beginning with “suffering,” etc.

original: chos shes rjes su shes bzod dang // shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: chos shes rjes su shes bzod dang // shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa dag ste /
translated: Knowledge of the truth of suffering, subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, acceptance of knowledge of the truth of origin, knowledge of the truth of origin, acceptance of subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin, subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin, acceptance of knowledge of the truth of cessation, knowledge of the truth of cessation, acceptance of subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation, subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation, acceptance of knowledge of the truth of the path, knowledge of the truth of the path, acceptance of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, and subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: bzhi po de dag nyid ni skad cig ma 'byung ba nyid yin pas skad cig ste /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag nyid ni skad cig ma 'byung ba nyid yin pas skad cig ste /
translated: These four are moments, so they are momentary.

original: de'i bdag nyid can ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: They have the nature of suffering, etc.

original: gzugs rtag ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs rtag ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse on the aspects of the truth of form is impermanent, etc. is stated as “because of the absence of intrinsic nature,” etc.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na gzung ba la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid yin pas so /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du na gzung ba la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid yin pas so /
translated: Because of the absence of intrinsic reality, because of the emptiness of apprehended object, apprehending subject, etc. in reality.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Form, etc. are form, feeling, etc.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba brtan zhing gcig pa dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid dag ni dngos po'i chos yin la de dag bral zhing med pas na rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba brtan zhing gcig pa dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid dag ni dngos po'i chos yin la de dag bral zhing med pas na rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Permanence and impermanence are the qualities of entities, i.e., stability and unity, and the nature of destruction. Since they are absent, i.e., do not exist, they are neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: brtan pa dang 'jig pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa dang 'jig pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are neither stable nor subject to destruction.

original: de bzhin du sdug @189a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug @189a * //
translated: Similarly, pleasant, etc.

original: bsngal ni tshor ba yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: bsngal ni tshor ba yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: Pain is an unpleasant feeling.

original: de med pa ni sdug bsngal ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni sdug bsngal ma yin pa'o //
translated: Its absence is not pain.

original: de dag dang bral ba nyid kyis na 'ching ba dang thar pa'i rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba nyid kyis na 'ching ba dang thar pa'i rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'o //
translated: By virtue of the absence of those, i.e., by virtue of the absence of pain and pleasure, one is free from the extremes of eternalism and nihilism, i.e., of bondage and liberation.

original: gzhan gyi bdag gi dngos po med pas stong pa dang de med pa mi stong pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag gi dngos po med pas stong pa dang de med pa mi stong pa ste /
translated: The absence of the reality of other is emptiness. Its absence is not emptiness.

original: de dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: and because it is free from that, it is pure.

original: rang nyid bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyis na bdag yin la de med pa ni bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: rang nyid bdag gi ngo bo nyid kyis na bdag yin la de med pa ni bdag med pa ste /
translated: The self is that which is by nature its own essence, and the nonexistence of that is selflessness.

original: de dag nyid kho na'i ngo bo ni de ltar brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid kho na'i ngo bo ni de ltar brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of those two is just that, because they are imagined to be just that.

original: des ma skyes pa'i phan tshun 'gal ba'i tshul gnyis kyis skye ba mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / de ltar skye ba med pas ma 'gags shing /
analyzed: des ma skyes pa'i phan tshun 'gal ba'i tshul gnyis kyis skye ba mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / de ltar skye ba med pas ma 'gags shing /
translated: Since it is not logical for that which is not arisen to arise in two mutually exclusive ways, and since there is no arising in that way, there is no cessation,

original: 'jig pa med pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dang / de med pas rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dang / de med pas rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: no destruction, no affliction by attachment and so on, and no purification because of the absence of those.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni nyams pa dang 'phel bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni nyams pa dang 'phel bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The term “and so on” includes the logical impossibility of decline and increase.

original: sdug bsngal gyi byed rgyu ni rgyu yin la de med pas rgyu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi byed rgyu ni rgyu yin la de med pas rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: The cause of suffering is a cause, and because it does not exist, it is not a cause.

original: de dag ni gsog nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gsog nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Since they are just accumulations, they are like space.

original: tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni kun 'byung ba yin la de med pa ni kun 'byung ba med pa ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni kun 'byung ba yin la de med pa ni kun 'byung ba med pa ste /
translated: The cause of suffering in this life is origination. Its nonexistence is nonorigination.

original: de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Afflictions are attachment and so on.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ni khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa la sogs pa ste de dag spangs pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ni khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa la sogs pa ste de dag spangs pa'o //
translated: All secondary afflictions are anger, enmity and so on.🔽The cause of suffering in this life and for a long time is full generation. Its nonexistence is nonfull generation.

original: tshe 'di dang yun ring po'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni rab tu skye ba yin la de med pa ni rab tu skye ba med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa las grol ba ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di dang yun ring po'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni rab tu skye ba yin la de med pa ni rab tu skye ba med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa las grol ba ste /
translated: It is free from grasping because it is devoid of affliction.

original: kun tu chags pas stong pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu chags pas stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty of attachment.

original: sdug bsngal gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyu ni rkyen yin la de med pa ni rkyen ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyu ni rkyen yin la de med pa ni rkyen ma yin pa'o //
translated: The cause of the succession of suffering is conditions. Its nonexistence is nonconditions.

original: de dag las rnam par grol ba yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo shes pas ngo bos brjod du med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag las rnam par grol ba yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo shes pas ngo bos brjod du med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called inexpressible by nature because it is free from those and because it is known by its nature.

original: ye shes kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the intrinsic identity of intuition is inexpressible.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na 'gog pa yin la de med pa ni 'gog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na 'gog pa yin la de med pa ni 'gog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is cessation because of being free from afflictions, and its nonexistence is noncessation.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag par na de dag dang ma bral ba de'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni tshig tu brjod pas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan pas rgyu gzhan dag la sbyin du med🔽pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag par na de dag dang ma bral ba de'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni tshig tu brjod pas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan pas rgyu gzhan dag la sbyin du med pa yin te /
translated: Since they are not free from those in reality, therefore the meaning of the truth of cessation, which is characterized by freedom from afflictions, cannot be given to other causes by the words of the statement, “It is cessation.”

original: stong pa yin pa'i phyir sbyin par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa yin pa'i phyir sbyin par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is empty, it cannot be given, because it is not possible to give it.

original: sdug bsngal mi 'byung ba nyid kyis na zhi ba yin la de med pa ni ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi 'byung ba nyid kyis na zhi ba yin la de med pa ni ma zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because suffering does not occur, and its nonexistence is nonpeace.

original: 'di dag ni @189b yang dag par na med pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni @189b yang dag par na med pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med par byed pa ste /
translated: These are nonapprehended because they do not exist in reality.

original: mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs par shes pa'o //
translated: They are understood as nonapprehended.

original: bde ba dang gtsang bas dben pa nyid kyis na gya nom pa yin la de med pas gya nom pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang gtsang bas dben pa nyid kyis na gya nom pa yin la de med pas gya nom pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is sublime because it is devoid of pleasure and purity, and it is not sublime because it is devoid of that.

original: de dag dang bral ba'i phyir mtha' gnyis las 'das pas rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba'i phyir mtha' gnyis las 'das pas rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said to be pure because it transcends the two extremes, because it is devoid of those.

original: chad pa dang rtag pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is stainless because it is devoid of the extremes of annihilation and permanence.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni nges par 'byung ba yin la de med pa ni nges par 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni nges par 'byung ba yin la de med pa ni nges par 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the escape, and it is devoid of that.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir nad thams cad mi skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir nad thams cad mi skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said to be the non-arising of all illnesses because it is devoid of those,

original: phyi dang nang gi mu stegs pa'i lta ba 'jig pa ste gnas med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi mu stegs pa'i lta ba 'jig pa ste gnas med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the destruction of the views of the tīrthikas, both internal and external, and because it is baseless.
